I-tj9RQpzzmf2u9LDI1SKg.text: Had lunch with my wife at the Oink Cafe in Paradise Valley. We started with the Flight of Bacon platter, eight different flavors of bacon. For entrees, we had the bacon pancakes and the 50/50 burger, 50% beef / 50% bacon with a side of fries. For dessert, we enjoyed bacon donut holes, pretty much the best baked treat I've ever had! Service was excellent (Thanks, Lana!) and we enjoyed our meal greatly! Also, there is a Half-Price Books right next door, highly recommended!!

A0MIA4ETQkEBklwN9516Ng.text: Okay so I work across the street and have thought about this place every single time.  Finally, my husband being home on a weekend and no kids, we went.  I had the 1/2 flight of bacon.  It was good, not great.  My bacon was not cooked evenly (some pieces were barely done, and one piece was burnt).  It was good and I could distinguish the flavors.  The Strawberry Cheesecake pancakes were awesome though.  Service was great, friendly and courteous.  I would come back, but give specific directions on how to cook my bacon.

SWA7X7utVcice3ieX8CS3w.text: I've been here a handful of times and each time my experience has been average.  I primarily continue to come here because it's only a few blocks from my house and it's an easy place to meet clients for meetings. However, having said all of that, I highly doubt I'll be back after my experience this morning.  I arrived this morning to read the paper and relax.  I always order the huevos rancheros because it's always been good to me.  I've had clients who have ordered other items on the menu and have been very disappointed (I have had two friends order a dish that came with a biscuit--each time, the biscuits had the consistency of a rock).  Anyway, for whatever reason, I decided to live dangerously and order something else.  I ordered the egg white omelet with home fries and whole wheat toast.  It arrived and was nothing unique or off-the-charts.  But hey, it tasted good.  After I was done polishing that off, I still had a hankering (yeah, that's right--a hankering) for something else.  Considering how full I was, I needed something small.  I remembered seeing blueberry pancakes on the menu, so I asked my server how many came with a side order.  He told me a stack of two or four. I asked him if they were gigantic and he said no, they were typical pancakes.  I put in an order for two.  When they arrived they looked good, but like everything else here, were nothing special.  Imagine my surprise when I cut into the short stack and realized only one of them had blueberries in it.  Oh well, what the hell; I ate them both.  After many attempts to get a coffee refill (I was seated on the patio--if you like refills, don't sit there) I gave up and looked at the check.  (Side note: The servers here immediately give you the check after your food arrives.  Their reasoning is that they don't want you to have to wait for the check.  I don't buy it.  I feel rushed when they do this. In fact, they tell you "No rush" when they put it on the table, so clearly I'm not the only one that has wondered about this.)  The check was pretty straightforward, except for the charge related to my two blueberry pancakes (sans blueberries).  For some reason, my server accidentally charged me for the blueberry pancake meal, or so I thought, since he charged me $6.99 for the dish.  I asked about it, and guess what?  It was not a mistake.  This place has the audacity to charge $7 for TWO PANCAKES!!!  What the heck is in them that they cost $3.50 a piece?  Before I wrote this review, I called IHOP  (yes, IHOP--they're across the street from Oink, so they're competition and the food quality is comparable) and asked them how much their double blueberry pancake side costs.  A stack of two costs $3.79 and a stack of four costs $6.99.  Can you explain that to me?  Same size, same ingredients, same zip code, hell, the same street, but Oink charges DOUBLE!  Anyway, considering the outrageous prices, the average service (servers are nice, but not very quick with the refills, or anything else, except the check), and the average/slightly above average food, I feel like I can do better.  IHOP, here I come!

yxG1kB7H_RpRLD0qrYlmhQ.text: Food was ok, some of the bacon was above average. My husband got the pancakes, average. Son got French toast, basic white bread dipped in egg. I got a waffle which was actually very good. The wait staff was non existent. I waited 10 minutes for a water refill. When we gave our name we told them 2 and a high chair. The manager seated us and told us there were no high chairs- as we passed a table with 2, I told him we'd have to go elsewhere and magically there were plenty of highchairs. We ordered a bacon flight. I will say it was all good and cooked the right way- not some crunchy dog treat like some restaurants. I highly recommend the jalapeno bacon! With hickory and pecan wood tied for second. My husband was sure to have his card out when the wait staff appeared, we didn't know how long it would be if she had to make another trip.

i_GpewllRJ4BZErgJAH7DQ.text: Underwhelming. It was a decent, basic breakfast. Nothing special. The bacon board was kind of sad looking with 4 shriveled pieces of bacon on a giant plastic cutting board.

FL_CwhxRv_qG5jbHe6cwAg.text: Ate breakfast with friends.  The french toast was overwhelming!  More than any one person should eat!  The bacon is the best in town.  Compares favorably with ihop across the street and would pick indy over a chain anytime.  Will go again if just to try the bacon doughnuts!

qJGfwVdtenrVayYK2d2buQ.text: Nice alternative to the typical IHOP places. Good food and neat concept, and our waitress was a blast! Liked it so much we bought a mug!

y44muQekFnexLbS1yQUpWg.text: Best bacon ever! They're Belgium waffle was delicious and service was fast and friendly

CRYP8ijL6SowMQJc1KQM9Q.text: This place used to be good. It has gone down hill since they first opened, in my opinion. I could have just gone to IHOP across the street. There's not much bacon on the menu. The front area used to have a good display of deserts and bacon-infused food, but that's gone. I tried their donut made with bacon last time and that was yummy, that's why I returned but it's not a highlight anymore. I ordered the eggs benedict and it was blah...very dry. Hope to find another restaurant that really capitalize on the PIG...bacon especially. That's what the name OINK is, duh!!!

V1-Juvlb82N5GSE-nhNcag.text: We have been here a handful of times, but I have never taken the time time to write a review until today. We went out to celebrate Father's Day a little early since we won't be in town for the next few weekends. Anyway, we happen to mention it just in conversation and the next thing we know, our waitress brought over some complimentary bacon donuts. Then the manager stopped by to welcome us and just say hello and happy Father's Day! I have to say the service today was phenomenal. We felt so special and just loved being there today. The food has always been good, but the service today is what will make us go back sooner rather than later!!! Thanks guys!!

TJwLGmD6rVGgIrHMM4OafA.text: Patience required. We go on Sundays and usually get there around 8:30am. Typically the wait is about 15 minutes. My favorite so far is the Oink Breakfast Burger and the Sweet Potato Fries. The service is usually slow. It's a very busy place and I'm an understanding person so it doesn't really bother me much but for someone in a rush it's probably not going to be a good choice for you. Good luck getting a refill on your water. My husband ordered the steak and eggs last time and he asked for his steak to be cooked medium well. When he got it the steak was more like medium rare...super pink and undercooked. So he was upset about that. The manager did offer to bring him a new dish, so that was nice.  Main reason we keep coming back is that we live so close. It's a decent breakfast, definitely better than Denny's.

j2BrGfzodurrmhzuhLwO5g.text: Wowza!! We started by sharing the warm maple bacon donut holes which were so delicious. I had the pork confit eggs benedict, and son had bacon pancakes. And we couldn't pass on the flight of bacon. Ok...so we were stuffed, but it was well worth it!!

iJbTJsRgRpj7s4hqjO3Reg.text: I don't like how their tables are set up. Booths against the side of the walls, with individual tables in the aisle. Not the best set up if you're there by yourself because everybody's staring at you and makes for awkward dining experience.  Some of the wait staff are very rude, and yet some are very friendly. I saw they automatically gave every other table in the place free glasses of water. I didn't get any free glasses of water. I wish some of the rude wait staff would quit or get fired, because they give the place a bad rep. They do have a good manager who is helpful with customer requests.   Good mix of customers. Not too many old people, not too many kids, not too many business people there, just a good mix of customers. I didn't feel uncomfortable or out of place there. Will probably be back.

BSk5K3WqMyvA2cmuqgPJlA.text: Worst chorizo I have ever tasted... Never again!!! I ordered the Arizona omelet and it was covered in "ranchero" sauce that had the worst flavor. I will never be back.

mB4VAh1fKeJnzZHVOGRPZw.text: Good was amazing! Server was amazing also! We waited longer then the 30 minutes quoted and that wouldn't usually be a problem but they always had open tables and not seating them. They had a manager maybe even owner she was a women helping and she was super unprofessional and rude. She talked to the server while he was trying to seat us about what he was doing and also our server while she was trying to take an order about the tv. Super unprofessional. On top of that some people came in after us and sat at a empty dirty table outside. Instead of seating actual people on their list the manager or owner women came out and gave them menus knowing they had sat themselves. I won't be back for this reason. I am a paying customer who knows how to actually wait until my name is called and they allow others just to seat themselves. Also the women ridiculing the server and hostess in front of us was really uncomfortable.

Ilcf6TrjkMH60dtpNJ-zBQ.text: Service was slooooow, but the food was decent. Not a great first impression, but I am all about second chances. Will try it again.

mMCEPzUMYmePacksJdxMTw.text: Good place to eat.  Don't be in a hurry. You will wait to be seated on Sunday mornings. Give this place a try . I'm sure that you will be back. Have a peaceful day.

XwTR4lbpZK-lUOD6cQQxrw.text: Pretty weak, it's a Dennys disguised as some sort of niche bacon place

SmWrA4jPB_fwYdC-vePpog.text: Went for breakfast with friends and was not overly impressed with the food. Two tiny pieces of bacon with "home fries" that appeared to come from frozen. There are far better choices close by. We won't be going back.

Ef4ICUI6N80BfLCtgi9W2Q.text: The PV Mall area is in desperate need of a good breakfast joint. You can get Matt's if you go downtown and there are now multiple Over Easy's around the east valley. Unfortunately, this place isn't it. I'm wondering if the 5 star reviews have this place mixed up with another place. Let me first say I think they are trying but if you are bold enough to have a "Bacon Lovers Entrance" then you better deliver. Everyone was friendly and we seated promptly. My boy had the kids pigs in a blanket and I had the two egg breakfast.   Before I jump ahead I should back up a bit. Coffee... I love good coffee and for $2.29 I expect some tasty premium coffee. No such luck. Burnt and rather acidic this is the kind of swill you get at Denny's. Am I being too picky if I don't like to have the little Shamrock farms containers on the table?  Fresh cream please. You are competing to be the go to breakfast place for the neighborhood.   Back to the food. My 2 eggs, over medium, were serviceable and prepared as expected.  The hash browns were super salty and even the egg yolk couldn't make them tasty. Not good at all. I had the applewood smoked bacon. I got 2 flimsy pieces that probably were cooked 4 or 5 hours ago and were burnt around the edges. They were also appeared to be about 1/2 the size of a normal piece of bacon. This is a bacon place and you serve this?  My Kirkland Signature precooked bacon at home placed in the oven for 10 minutes is way better. Seriously how can you serve this?  English muffin was OK. Everything probably sat for 5-7 minutes before it got to me. Not cold but not just off the griddle either. My son's "Pigs in a Blanket" we're worse. The pancakes were crumbly like a biscuit. They had a strange consistency that really was like a sweet biscuit. The Pigs inside of the blanket were of the Brown N Serve variety or whatever the food supply company sells as a equivalent. Really not good.   How do you call yourself The Oink Cafe and serve these pork abominations?  I know their trying to give you a quality experience but with the pork products they're serving I don't think they are going to be around.

AEzjbtlJzW9c_m6vLILdZw.text: My grandma and I come to oink all the time and Iw love it! The have the best Benedict in town!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GpNpzkDMFjSqAZvCnCtzCA.text: Wish I could comment on the food. 45 min wait. Never got seated as we were skipped several times. My wife and I didn't want to be crammed standing inside so we chose to sit outside in the heat.The staff is too lazy to check to see if people were waiting outside hence why we got skipped. Ended up walking out and they could have cared less. Got a lame ass sorry and that was it. Probably for the best. The place looked dirty anyways. Too many other clean and great places to eat that have far better customer service in the area.

71td4fGtqz54frgbpZ8V3w.text: Of course, every parent thinks their child is the cutest, smartest, best behaved and many other superlatives.  When we find a restaurant that shares our opinion of our just-turned 2 year old son, well, all the better.  If I could give them 10 stars for service, I definitely would.  We arrived at 10AM to meet our friends for Sunday brunch.  The restaurant was crowded and I was expecting a long wait for a table for 6 adults and the aforementioned toddler.  However, our wait was less than 5 minutes.  Our friends had been there before and ordered 2 flights of bacon for the table to share.  Most of the 8 varieties were good, some were OK and some were outstanding (it's bacon after all, even when it's meh, it's still pretty good).  My favorites were the jalapeno and the pecan wood.  My least favorite was the apple cider, I felt the cider just didn't add anything to the flavor experience.  I ordered the Paradise Valley omelette with fruit and an english muffin.  I thought it was a very nice extra that you got so many choices for sides with the omelettes.  The PV option comes with bacon, mushrooms, spinach and cheese.  The omelette was one of the best I have had in years.  There were two reasons for this.  First, the mushrooms and spinach, both vegetables with high water content, had been properly cooked so they didn't drown the eggs.  Secondly, the ingredients were very evenly dispersed so with each bite, I got the full combination of all the add-ins.  Here's where Oink Cafe went above and beyond, IMHO.  We had visits from a manager and a lady who I assumed was the owner.  The male manager interacted with our son, acknowledging his birthday (our friends had brought him presents) and talking with him and the adults at the table.  The waitress also interacted with our son, refilling his water when he asked for more and treating him like a welcome guest, not some nuisance.  Finally, a lady who I assumed was the manager also stopped by.  She paid special attention to our son, even asking if she could bring him some more fruit when she realized he had eaten all of my side of fruit.  So glad our friends suggested OINK and already looking forward to another visit.  I'll definitely have to take the manager's suggestion of swapping out the regular bacon for the jalapeno bacon on a sandwich.

0iVCSeHbwALJ7NOYw3BRwA.text: This place was very nice and people love it, as you'll see if you come on the weekends. The place was packed. We waited over 40 min for a table; however, the wait was worth it, because the food was awesome.  I was a little disappointed in the bloodys. I was so excited to get one, and it ended up being a little boring. But, then again, I'm into super spicy bloodys with homemade mix, so maybe I'm just a bloody snob.  Overall, I thought it was all a little spendy, but it's worth the trip and the bill for a cute breakfast place with great food.

j1ciCHXlX37qN6wUWUznaQ.text: Tried out Oink Cafe for the first time today and really wanted to love it but it started off bad with our 20 minute wait turning into atleast a 40min. There were countless numbers of tables open during our wait time. When asked when we'd be called the lady said they'd already seated us, someone took our table! They immediately sat us. Our server was fabulous and food was good but wait time for the food was a little ridiculous. The poor servers are inundated with not only serving their tables but making their own drinks... this takes away from their tables and makes the wait that much longer. The organization seems to lack. Someone needs to help with hostess, check in's and calling people to their seats, they need to hire a drink maker. Hopefully we can give it a try again but not looking good.

Uzyvjx-Zktk_Smcurqhrwg.text: Had to Give only 2 stars today...asked for eggs over medium not running and 1/2 cooked !!!! Hash Browns and Bacon were good and also warm , Sourdough Toast was just Okay seemed like Oil put on it though...Dissapointing Breakfast this morning for the Oink

t7VJSvCZoA02kPrY9BZTtA.text: Entered the establishment, was told to sit anywhere I wanted,  did so in a booth. Sat there for 15 minutes like the invisible man.even waving arms could  ot catch the attention of any waitstaff.  No coffee  no water  no menu,  nothing. I'm happy at I hop now across the street. They took 15 minutes of my life. They won't get my money.

ofVFJcI8Ru2mx7AyZsJ8nw.text: Loved every minute of being in here! I had a two-hour window between appointments in the area and decided to stop in to kill time. Thankfully, they have wifi!  I told my server upfront that I'd be hanging out for a bit and to keep the coffee coming. She did! With a name that includes "oink," you should already know that this place is centered around bacon. I however, did not partake of the bacon -- not my cup of tea. Yeah, yeah, yeah....I'm THAT girl who walks in and orders a veggie omelet with more veggies on the side. They accomodated me just fine and didn't give me any weird looks for not ordering bacon.  The gals at the table next to me ordered a bacon donut for dessert. So this is an option if your bacon appetizer and bacon entree aren't enough.  Five stahs!

ZQdzo6oAbhUlvy3oFdO6wg.text: The best place for Breakfast and Bacon in the valley! Portions are generous and filling. Never had a bad experience, staff will recognize you and acknowledge you even if you don't sit in their section. Love this place! Definitely a must visit restaurant!

jo844AzPF8nB4BBYwmIc6A.text: Always love this place - great service and feels family owned. Bacon donuts are the best - a great mix of sweet and savory and you can't beat the bacon Bloody Mary!

SjFQWlb1qP3FtPYayuKuTA.text: Exceptional service. Rachael was our waitress and she was on the ball. It was a packed house but we were seated quickly. Nice patio seating area. We had the traditional eggs Benedict and their specialty French toast. The specialty French toast had fresh berries, strawberries, fresh cream and it was to die for. I will come back just for that over and over again.

eqqPMRWukP6PKZ_9g_22JA.text: ONE star for cold breakfast food that has the potential to be much better.   The two of us took the open seats at the bar counter because the wait time for other tables was a usual 20 minutes (no, not long but we were on a schedule today so we needed to get in and out fairly quickly). As other reviewers recently posted, I'm not sure why there was much of a wait at all since there were 6 others tables open to seat customers. Strange.   We waited over 30 minutes for our food to come out only to be significantly disappointed by what we bit into. Neither of our Benedicts were even lukewarm and the bacon that is "raved" about was certainly nothing special. If you are going to feature a specialty item such as a bacon tasting board it better be something memorable! This was anything but that- very lightly flavored and pretty thin. We both said to each other that our food would have been great if it were hot. It's a shame- these foodies won't be back and certainly won't recommend Oink.   Ours weren't the only gripes- we overheard the staff quietly noting how many complaints there were today. I just don't get it. Breakfast is the easiest meal to cook. Management needs to get this place together!!!  Also was quite turned off by one of the back-of-the-house fellas that frequented the front bar area with a cigarette hanging behind the ear- SOO unappealing. What if that fell in someone's food!?!!  Noting that although we had an unfortunate experience, we appreciated that management took our concerns seriously. Thank you for that.

7c3FrKf0npmQoYO0xankOw.text: We really enjoyed our experience at Oink Cafe. We tried the Bacon Flight, which was fun and tasty and definitely solidified that I will be returning for jalapeno bacon in their mac and cheese.   They had some of the best biscuits and gravy that I've had in Phoenix!   The food was good, the atmosphere was fun, the staff was really friendly.   In fact, the only "complaint" I have is that the service was *too* friendly. We could barely take a bite without someone coming by to ask us how our experience was. It was nice to feel cared about, but could have been toned down a bit. That being said, I've always wanted to check this place out and it did not disappoint!

9LMcCpE_n1xGX2FQp1hdSg.text: I have been a years long fan of oink. The food is always amazing and the poached eggs are done to perfection. The crispest of bacon in SO many flavors! The service and management are super friendly and always remember me. I just recently had an issue with my check and they handled it with grace and a smile! This will continue to be one of my favorite places!!!! Way to go Oink!!!!

qZYo7AOKQOMfho0gxRZ2ng.text: Overall review?: go try EGGstasy.  So everything is homeade & pancakes were fluffy, the flight of bacon has 8 strips that don't have a lot of difference, you can taste the jalapeno and peppered bacon flavors but the sugar and honey cured weren't too different. The pecanwood and applewood were truly the only real flavored bacons that were different.    We ordered the florentine Benedict with honey cured bacon and strawberry pancakes, they were fluffy but not extraordinary. There was a bit of shortage on the sauce too.  Then they forgot the bacon on the Benedict so it tasted very plain until they brought the bacon which still just made it just... ok.  In summary, you could probably make a similar breakfast at home. If you want a special Benedict, do any of them from EGGstasy if you plan to wait 30-40 minutes on any day & the same goes to pancakes.  You could go to butter fields for better pancakes too.  There's just not any "you must stop here" for bacon or breakfast per the wow factor that is out there.  Not sure what they made for the guy from cnn...  The server was great but seating took quite awhile... I think that's more due to people camping out. They were busy in the beginning but there was plenty of people to ask how things were afterwards- and while we told them they said "next time we'll bring you more sauce".  I guess that's ok... Still nothing I'll be back for sadly.

MZK5yJ-zdefcWQdR4K3uUA.text: This cafe serves good brunch fare, perhaps a tad pricey but the food is definitely tasty and satisfying. The service is very friendly and the atmosphere is casual ... I was about to say relaxed, but then I remembered how crowded it gets on weekends and the wait can be quite long during those times. Unless you plan to come early on weekends, weekdays are probably the best days to try this place out.

xZBTw8jjp2v2L4SoT7H_-g.text: This place is amazing. The service today was awesome. I had pancakes and it was so yummy plus the flight of bacon- the jalapeno bacon is my favorite! My boyfriend had the California chicken sandwich which the waitress said to try it in a burrito instead of the bun, and that just made it so delicious!

aBPq_-jJD2HH87DNbmzLkw.text: I learned last time here that they offer gluten free bread so today assumed they could make GF French toast. But the server, Tami,  informed me they were too busy, since it's a weekend, to make me any. Disappointing. We left another restaurant with a long wait to come here. The other restaurant offers way more GF options. Anyway I ordered the two egg breakfast with hash browns and GF toast. My friend had biscuits and gravy. The order came out within minutes so it's clear they were not made to order. Not on a busy Saturday. I will say that the eggs were good but my hash browns were cold. The server did ask is how everything tastes but it was moments after our food came and we hadn't had time to try anything yet! I think the service is hit or miss. The food is decent. I'll probably come back but honestly a few things could be tweaked.

9Py0Ign_kpgNeKwTWqIANQ.text: Oops we ate some of them before the pic. Can't resist the bacon ! OK I get it , bacon is good in everything. BUT really get the bacon flight, that's what I said bacon FLIGHT. Many thick cut bacon's , maple , pecan, jalapeno, just to name a few   I'm kind of ashamed to say that when my hubby got a call from work I couldn't stop myself from eating his portion.   They also have the best biscuits and gravy that I've ever tasted.  The Benedict is also good as well as the pancakes.  Good coffee too.  The service has always been great even when the place is packed.  Try to get there early if your going on the weekend, that's your best bet for not waiting a long time.

The bacon was nothing special and we could not taste the different types. I was really disappointed and hoped it was better. It was also pretty expensive. I would not recommend this place.

X_kei-dggB4Tb_lBJsrIHg.text: How can you not want to eat here?! The sign says "Breakfast, Lunch, Bacon"!!!  I had a chorizo and egg burrito that was really tasty.  I also had a maple bacon donut that very nearly put me in a (delicious and satisfactory) sugar coma!  The patio was wonderful, the service punctual, and the company was the best!  I will be back!

cWCDByrCuQVioKYbvSq96Q.text: Oink Cafe is a five minute drive for pick up. The food is great, I always have the Bacon Benedict. The lemon sauce is very mild, creamy and perfect with the seasoned bacon. The Husband has the Chicken Fried Steak. It is very, very good, but the biscuits are a little baking soda-y.  So switch it for english muffin instead. French Toast is fluffy and delicious and the turn around for orders is literally ten minutes for pick up. Overall, a great value,-- I've probably eaten here about 40 times in the last two years. Never had a bad meal.

Of-nU8srVZCTH6cmm1LzwA.text: "Bippity Boppity Bacon". I wonder how Jim Gaffigan would feel about this cute 'lil joint?  When you walk in through the main entrance, you will notice the lovely patio and a walk up window (love it) where you can place a take-out order. Creative, but if you are going to wait for your order, I would recommend snagging one of the four seats at the inside counter where you can enjoy a coffee or espresso drink and salivate at the delicious-looking pastrie, some of which, are bacon flavored.  The walls are painted bright yellow, green, and orange, with fun wall art of various pigs. In addition to the four counter seats, there is plenty of seating between the green booths and tables, but if you have a party of five or larger, your only option is to push together the tables and sit in the uncomfortable looking wood chairs. Luckily, I was just there with my madre so we got to enjoy a comfy booth.  We were greeted and seated immediately by friendly staff and a few seconds later our waitress greeted us and took our drink orders. I ordered a latte that wasn't anything special (no latte art either), but hey, they don't advertise about their espresso, so no biggie. I opted for their half of sandwhich and soup or salad deal. I chose their BLT with applewood smoke bacon and a side salad, just so I don't clog up all my arteries. My mom went for the full BLT sandwhich with sweet potato fries. There area few bacon options to choose from like: applewood smoke, honey cured, sugar cured, peppered, and jalapeno bacon, but our server suggested to stay with the classic applewood smoked, so we listened. The sandwich was pretty tasty and they don't skimp on the yummy bacon, the side salad was boring and basic, but the sweet potato fries were delicious, good choice mom!  All in all, good service, decent food, reasonable prices. I would come back and try their bacon pancakes, which is what the server said they are known for, but I'm not in any rush. FYI: This place closes at 2pm everyday and isn't open at all on Tuesdays.

pWHqdrQxm8nd5BzsJvdNQQ.text: BACON...need I say more?? i enjoy the smell of the bacon as it makes it's way into the air and over to where I live. I love coming here for breakfast and lunch. All the gals there are friendly and the service is good. In fact today when I mentioned to the owner's brother that I had not tried the apple cider (it was jalapeno for me today) he went and got me some to try - that's treating the customer right!

wkTpXl0M8E0GjDId7_6PRw.text: A flight of bacon???? Whoever came up with that is a genius! I LOVE this place! I swear whoever came up with this chain had a bacon loving person like me in mind. I had the regular bacon along with the hickory smoked flavor bacon. Both were great. My boyfriend tried the jalepeno bacon as well. We were definitely happy with our selections and are looking forward to going back. It was busy, as most great places are. Expect a little wait, but I guarantee it is worth it!

3uXO_dfXWR3MqzP_NPEVBg.text: I love this place! Great food, nice servers! I wish they were open later :)

qvHm0F-MKhbLifKqb0oeaQ.text: This is 100% my new breakfast spot for quick and easy breakfast brunch. They serve breakfast all day. Nice atmosphere. Good size patio. Very nice staff and waiters. Whether your coming in for a quick bite or sitting and being served this is a great option.

6nzNcZC9bFCWj8e3cNxtIQ.text: Definitly not I would come back! Love bacon and seevice was good! Nice server too! But my biscuit and gravy looked like vomit!

M4_Wn5ghLqneylCwu4pw0w.text: My fiance and I had breakfast here. Saw a lot of great reviews and it's usually busy.  I was very disappointed.  I started with the flight of bacon.. You get to try all their flavors of bacon. To my surprise, they all tasted the same.  Half of the strips of bacon were rock hard too.  I am a bacon fanatic like most True Americans, but man I was bummed!   I also had the biscuits and gravy.  That was pretty bland.  The gravy was cold, but at least the biscuit was fluffy.    I don't think I will be returning here, nor would i recommend it.

HR8rTRS7A4z8os_mE2khfg.text: This is a new neighborhood breakfast joint in a building many think is "cursed".  The turnover for businesses at this location is high.  But I think Oink is going to make it!  They were very busy when we were there so it took a little bit to get refills on coffee (need bigger cups) and the food took a couple minutes longer, but no worries.  Who I think is the owner was not just standing by and watching everyone else run around like chickens with their heads cut off, they were serving, clearing plates, filling coffee.  Love to see that!    The menu is decent.  I'm not a huge breakfast person but there were quite a few items on the menu I was interested in.  The funny thing is my hubby and I ended up not ordering any bacon and didn't realize this until after we finished eating!  So we definitely will be going back to try the bacon they are known for....jalapeno bacon anyone!

kR7sbt-Ck7iiAeCSzoZCmw.text: The idea is great and what inevitably will get you to try Oink Cafe.  The hostess staff and most employees seem to have better things to do than be at work.  I ordered the BLT.  It is listed as one of their specialties. The waitstaff asked what type of bacon I wanted as they offer eight flavors.  I stated Applewood, but changed my mind and said, bring whatever you recommend.  The BLT came out in three layers of blah wheat bread.  I'm pretty sure it was a 99 cent loaf of bread and the bacon had no flavor at all.  The manager came around and asked how our lunch was, I told him it was okay.  He said just ok and I told him my thoughts; the meal was rather bland.  He said, hopefully, they can impress better my next visit.  They won't have that opportunity.  Where we can order bacon everything from specialty store, don't eat here if you want some Jimmy Dean packaged bacon.

Gt8TI7p4A1McxXtvy-wO7w.text: Food is usually pretty good. The jalepeno bacon is amazing if cooked right. The service is usually pretty slow though. The manager is always visible and very nice.

CNxjnw1zxcfUCSNvafrwRQ.text: This is another 3.5 rounded up to a 4. It gets the extra star because it's ranked rather low on Yelp right now. I'd avoided it before this for that reason, but one day decided to just take the plunge and check it out. After all, it specializes in bacon! Couldn't be that horrible, right?   It really is pretty decent. I went there on a Monday afternoon. The place was quiet- there were patrons, but I got seated right away. The wait staff were prompt, and my waitress was fabulous. Sweet and friendly and there with everything I needed. Very cute decor, they have that neat wood-looking tile all over, and the walls are BRIGHT chartreuse. I kid you not. Wear shades.   The menu itself is pretty simplistic. Don't expect anything revolutionary. It's got all the staples, benedicts, omelettes, chicken fried steak. I wound up going with their Denver omelette, subbing out the eggs for egg whites. They do allow you to get a pancake instead of toast. It's just one pancake, but I'm watching that waistline anyway. It was good. The Denver omelette had green peppers, spinach and bacon. Lots of bacon, they were super generous, which is awesome. The pancake was huge and fluffy- one was more than enough. They also have a drinks/cocktails menu, so I was able to indulge in a mimosa. Really nice, definitely appreciated that. They've even got a bacon bloody mary. I was tempted but stuck to my mimosa instead.  The last food item that I have to mention is their maple glazed bacon donut. Yes, you heard me right. Incredible. I brought it home for my husband and he inhaled it in foodgasmic delight. It's a deep fried cake donut with a maple glaze and tons of bacon. Tons. He gave me a bite- really quite good. So definitely get that!   All in all, a nice restaurant. I promised my husband I'd bring him back over when we can. It's not far from us, so we should be able to be by more often than some other brunch places I've reviewed.   Don't be put off by the low reviews. The service was good, the food was good, it really does deserve you stopping by at least once!

QB45C2iTdQeflqIo9cIq-w.text: This was a great place for breakfast! The bacon was particularly interesting at they had different types and you could get a "bacon flight" of all the varieties. French Toast was divine and breakfast in general was good.

0bqkxWB_EeRZ6tOY8Nl3Xw.text: I really enjoyed the breakfast.  I'll defintely will be back for the burgers and different bacon flavors. Mmmmmm

h2zwsKdI5ojeF4cx02BEgg.text: I've been going here for breakfast since they opened. Everything I've had has been really good. My favorites are the biscuits and gravy, PV omelet  with egg whites, Oink Waffle. The cafe mocha is awesome too. The service has always been friendly and fast.

9viCkVAdtNJT2luz5iBNpA.text: We came here for a late breakfast and it was great! The blood mary was AMAZING and you HAVE to order the Bacon Flight. Also get your bloody mary with the jalapeno bacon. We enjoyed our food and the service was on par with a cafe. The prices are right! :)

Ukuer7BzSSEyaqUJxmat_A.text: Oink is pretty much a standard Food Service breakfast spot. The butter comes in individual plastic cups so you need to work at it to butter your pancakes. Nothing special on the pancakes, standard batter.  The juices comes out of a Food Service dispenser which is prominently displayed behind the counter. My food was tepid and the Food Service Hash Browns were not crisped very well. Service was ok, bacon was tasty but cold. For the money, I will dine at a Mom and Pop spot instead that cares a bit more about quality ingredients.

2-FusY6koDUGLcFQmkzDaA.text: Ventured here this Sunday morning not realizing it was the opening weekend; was told they had just opened on Tuesday.  That being said, they definitely have a few kinks to work out.    They prevented customers from using the door on Cactus as an entrance (understandable to help with the traffic flow) but there was no signage indicating where the other entrance door was located.  Not a biggie, but a little strange.  After finding the sole entrance door, entered to find people standing around and no customer greeter. No seating for those waiting to be seated.  Someone eventually walked around and wrote our name on a wait list.    The place is "cozy" with several tables and booths closely located.  The decor was simple but nice.  Loved the glass garage door which I'm sure they'll open during appropriate weather.  Also noticed they had outdoor patio seating as well.  Only waited 10-15 minutes for seating, which was pretty good considering how busy they were.  Here's where things start to fail...   I ordered the signature "Oink Omelet" and the other 2 in my party ordered the pancake combo. Not sure what was happening in the kitchen but they will definitely need to work on expediting.  The waitress was nice but not very attentive.  For example, we asked for straws several times to no avail.  A young lady from the culinary school providing samples of their baked items was kind enough to finally retrieve some straws.  The waitress, understandably, looked a bit overwhelmed.  From my seat, I would see into the kitchen and see that things were somewhat amiss.  After our orders were taken, we had to wait at least 45 minutes for the food to arrive. The "Oink Omelet" consisted of 5 (yes, 5) eggs, sausage, ham and cheese... hehehe.. definitely an "oinker" and came with hash browns (or home fries) and toast (or english muffin).  I have to admit that was a very tasty omelet.  However, the pancake combos were not very impressive and almost reminded me of IHOP or Denny's.  However, I was told the pancakes were somewhat tasty but could have been better and the applewood bacon was good.  After all is said and done, I would still give this place another try again after they have been open for a while and get the kinks out...

3mPEqwLrHqsDO78DbC0_Pg.text: Great spot lovely staff and the food was delicous overall nice experience would definetly go back

H5wc0YuWh7EMOfqB8Q6tLg.text: I'm not a huge breakfast person to start with, but they had really good food. I got fresh orange juice, which was satisfying. The hash browns and grilled cheese was a good. Staff was pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hash browns !

o1gHn55ynMIgB2rKLhevOA.text: Came here as a party of 2 on Saturday at 11:45am and was seated immediately. The server was at our table within 2 minutes. We attempted to order 1 maple bacon donut, however they were out. So we ordered 3 donut holes instead. They were as sugary and as sweet expected, and served warm.  We proceeded to order a vegetable omelette nix the cheddar and a Belgium Waffle.  The omelette was sizable as was the waffle, see pictures attached. I believe the waffle was slightly lacking in quality and would have appreciated a whole wheat option.  Overall, the food was good and the service was better. The atmosphere of the place was bustling.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Maple bacon donut hole
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetable omelette nix cheddar with side of whole wheat toast and fruit
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Belgium Waffle

sVC8QRen5vKtszy1cGhsvg.text: We have been a few times over the past year or so. In the past we have stopped in for breakfast and the omelettes have been quite good. The other day we stopped in for lunch which I can only say was that is was just  "ok". My son ordered a waffle off the kids menu and they made him the adult size. I knew he couldn't eat it all but he was thrilled when it arrived. I ordered the turkey sandwich and found myself looking to make sure the turkey actually made it on to the sandwich. Had they just put on a little more I would have enjoyed it but there were sections of the sandwich that were meatless and there wasn't enough to spread out to cover the entire piece of bread. The fries were decent and the server was friendly and quick to refill our drinks when needed.  Maybe it was just an off day. Since our previous experiences have been good we will certainly give it another try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey sandwich and a waffle

YEbZ-kNIVKXG19jjH7V4mA.text: Was enticed firstly by the name, due to the fact that I am a huge fan of bacon (who isn't!)  Looks like they were short a hostess but my server who sat me (Sarah) was incredible! Energetic lady who seemed to had been taking care of most tables in the place and did an awesome job. Very nice, and very fast.  Ordered the paradise valley omelette and was decent, my hash browns were very greasy and the bread not the best quality but still was overall pretty delicious.  The oink Bloody Mary was absolutely delicious, seems like the dollar up-charge from the regular Bloody Mary was a dollar for the bacon, worth it!   The place doesn't seem to have any music playing and the lighting is a little fluorescent, but other than those few things, it's a great cafe!   4/5

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The paradise valley omelette, hash browns &amp; wheat toast
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The &#34;Oink&#34; signature Bloody Mary

PsygX522Fgtwra-8yPY9ow.text: Wow. Just amazingly wow.   Located next to Paradise Valley Mall in the target strip mall is a little gem known as oink.  The signs walking up are descriptive and making me salivate for the bacon before I even walk in the door.  Looking at the menu I see there are several different bacon options and even a "flight" of bacon!!! Now most of us over 21 know a flight as a beer sampler with 4 or 5 different beers. But a Bacon flight... genius.   So after a mad cackling fit over the bacon flight I decide at 9am I must try the 50/50 burger. 50% ground beef and 50% ground bacon. Med is the lowest they will cook it due to the pork. Ok no problem. It comes out and I'm immediately drooling. Take a bite and I'm in heaven.  I ate half and was full. Took the other half for my 21 year old to have with his lunch. While I was sad the beautiful bacon aroma had left the car, I am happy to say I am still stuffed hours later.    I can't wait to return and try something else new.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffles very good and fluffy
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The 50/50 burger
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #FlightOfBacon

cu2C-Xl2jVzxnpJeHYh91A.text: The food is awesome. The bacon flight is amazing.  But our server was literally the most miserable and inattentive woman. She spoke very condescending when speaking to me and we saw the rest of the staff more than we ever saw her. She rolled her eyes when I informed her that she over charged me on orange juice but no wonder she was confused! She never came to the table! She had short black hair, glasses and a Green Bay Packer jeweled shirt on. If you want to enjoy your amazing meal at Oink, specifically ask to avoid her section because she absolutely didn't deserve the 20% tip I left her out of courtesy because she basically made us feel like our table was a burden to her. I wish I could have tipped the nice girl who got us OJ refills and filled our waters instead. I would have rated 5 stars if she wasn't so unpleasant to deal with.

SJmSZ6304zWJG7XbhRnnIQ.text: Who doesn't love bacon? No matter what you order on this menu, it's delicious. The service is great, and the restaurant is CLEAN!

kHyf_1NdaduWqbI6WFxrFA.text: This was a pleasant find. Nothing fancy but amazing food! Nice selection of entrees. Serving breakfast and lunch only. We will definitely be going back!

lfPrlqY7WjFBbxspp541Uw.text: Great omelette, great flight of bacon, friendly staff, and fast service. I wish I could've tried all the various Benedicts or the Chimi. I had a 5 egg omelette and couldn't finish it. I don't drink these days, but the Bloody Mary flights looked awesome too!  I don't think you can go wrong here. Kid friendly too.

ZLjakhorS041huHjyoX48Q.text: Eh- went there today and stood at the front to be seated for too long with no one acknowledging me! I almost left because no one came, finally someone said she'd be right with me. The customer service was just not there today! Also my French toast combo was a little expensive for not looking like a lot of food!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not a lot of food for $10.50

7twj2k0B1YmJn8TFO_RRlw.text: Had the two egg breakfast with sugar cured bacon.  The breakfast was pretty good except for the bacon!  The hash browns actually had flavor and the eggs were cooked perfectly.  The sour dough toast was good too and not hard as a brick! The bacon was rubbery and limp, didn't even eat it.  Also ordered the "flight of bacon" which is one slice of each of the 8 flavors of bacon that they offer. Cost is $10.99 which was a waste of money.  Only 1 piece was thoroughly cooked (the jalapeno), the others were rubbery and undercooked.  Was very disappointed.  I mentioned it to the waitress and she offered to get another one, declined.  She said we should of asked for crispy bacon, that this is the way the bacon is always cooked.....hmmmmm.  Cost of entire meal was kinda high $50+ for 3 people (also we ordered the $10.99 "flight of bacon"), maybe go back for a special occasion.  Will go back, just won't have any bacon.

bIeyjn9SYGtY6fy5Y6hBfQ.text: I don't know if I'd go back. The last time we were there they told us the wait would be 20 minutes and we wait 55 minutes. I timed it because it was so, so long. They did a good job on compensating us for it but it was still really unfortunate. We've been other times and the food is just ok each time.

n_AFHaGek6Z-ug8EU8nRdQ.text: Favorite place for breakfast on the weekends for my husband and I! I always get the chorizo skillet with home fries and he gets the eggs benedict with hashbrowns. It's all so so good and the service is great every time too!  Can get kinda pricey (we usually drop close to $40 for us two) but so worth it!

6B0uqhvRn5_uBnFe5wMI5w.text: The Oink Cafe, how can you not go here with such a great name.  I ordered a boring breakfast because my stomach was upset. Egg, bacon, French toast and fruit.  It was a busy morning, but we got seated right away.  The manager came by and asked how our food was which was nice.   Can't go wrong with a breakfast cafe, wait yeah you can. But not this one!

EC9LEyzKyvcqDYN11l6Wtg.text: I have been here a few times and the food has always been delicious! Ive eaten their bacon, pancakes, waffles, and french toast. Only giving 4 stars because the hostess had a bit of an attitude, but the food made up for it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Belgium waffle combo with pepper bacon

B9vQIwzFeb3oF6tM0FzzIA.text: Good Food ...Big Portions ...Bacon choices   But .... The employees were sitting at the bar area ,  talking loudly the entire time we we're attempting to enjoy our breakfast ... Annoying and unprofessional ... A high school atomsphere that really made for a bad experience ...suggestion take all that horsing around and chatter to the break room ...

IVx5JcAKHa0mIT6crquUQg.text: We stopped in for drinks only but the Bloody Mary flight was outstanding and the prices and serve matched the drinks.  Next time we will go for the bacon flight.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary flight,  need I say more?

N4ZFDRqGwStB3L7NVkBuMA.text: I need to come back and try the other menu items.   But come on an 8 piece flight of different bacons. You can't go wrong.

Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A flight of bacon. Need I say anything more?

f-7br2DoTzJbulWo952Htg.text: I enjoyed this place. Very relaxed and the food was decent. They have an interesting take on breakfast focusing on bacon this and bacon that.   The food was about average I had biscuits and gravy, the coffee was good. To be honest it was a little in the pricy side for breakfast but the portions were large.   It's worth checking out, maybe a more bacon centric dish will rock your world.  I would have been happier with a smaller more flavorful breakfast for the price. ~personal preference~

LVRd0u08BQlCZ0HhYHg0lA.text: Excellent restaurant with a quirky name. The staff was super friendly & food delicious. I ordered the Oink French Toast combo & just had yo try the bacon. Yum!!! They have 8 different kinds of bacon to choose from but I stuck with Applewood Smoked which had a more authentic flavor than I'm used to... like it was actually smoked here, on site! By far the best I've ever eaten. The French toast with ample strawberries & blueberries was equally delicious & also one of the best in town.   I look forward to coming back again & again as I try everything on their menu. The value & quality of the food here is top notch!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I just visited The Oink Cafe &amp; had the best French Toast with signature bacon! Yummm

gsRgNgeQIH6NPO5QK7sdzg.text: I come to Oink often and always wonder why.  The good is great but today is a great example of 1 star.  The back of the house is great but the front of the house is horrible.  I get weekends are busy. I've been in Scottsdale / Paradise Valley long enough to understand weekend wait times.  Here's the deal today.  Waited twenty minutes so far for a table with a lot of other people. As I stand here, there are NINE unoccupied, unbussed tables including FOUR that needed bussing when we arrived here twenty minutes ago.  Many others in town I won't name handle a far greater Sat/Sun load without issue.  I really want to like Oink but the front end mismanagement is terrible.  I've watched five parties walk away while we've been waiting. I'll go somewhere else from now on.

IK8DrNk-IHmPj7CYQkRfIw.text: All the staff are friendly and seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs. Rachel is awesome! The food is good, too! Get the Flight of Bacon to sample all the flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight of bacon!  All are good esp sugar cured and pecanwood ... jalapeno is appropriately HOT!

Kv05ItmJGJhtE4q_mUTeRw.text: Okay, so my rating is a 3.5, and typically I round down. But for this place i rounded up because they prepared the hashbrowns how i like it. Thin and crispy.  They had delicious benedict. I love their hollandaise they used. Definitely worked its way into my top 2 of favorite hollandaise.   I really hope to try some more dishes, here.

wPkM0ajDVXaFnGKSx9yFiw.text: I really wanted to love this place and the concept is a great one but it didn't live up to its potential. The service here was sub par, it was really busy and a little longer wait is fine. Our waitress never returned to fill our drinks, never checked to see if we needed anything and had to be flagged down in order to get our check. Like I said they were busy and I'll gladly make exceptions for that but being completely ignored is unacceptable to me.   The food was only ok as well. We ordered a flight of bacon, which is supposed to be the backbone of the menu. All of the samples were good but none of them were great. In most cases I wouldn't be able to distinguish it from store bought bacon, with the peppered bacon as the exception.   Both of our breakfast items were ok, a little on the bland side. Nothing worth complaining about or sending back but also nothing that would make me come running back. Overall it reminded me of a small town greasy spoon diner that was trying desperately to be a trendy uptown bistro.

7xwFwsL3YI821cXPaN_6VQ.text: bacon, bacon, and more bacon!  If you're a fan of bacon, and love breakfasty/lunchy places, then this place is for you. The menu is chock full of all your breakfast favorites. One of us got the eggs benedict with applewood smoked bacon. It was very good, with the eggs poached flawlessly.  Another got a lunch sandwich... Turkey, lettuce, tomato, and of course, bacon! apple cider bacon to be precise. The turkey was real roast turkey, not the slimy deli stuff.  I'm definitely a fan and will certainly return!

_HXKBe_geNix2tCcWxAa7A.text: Recently moved from Columbus, Oh to Phoenix. Drove the whole way. On our second or third day here we went to The Oink for breakfast. It was the first time since leaving Ohio that we had great service. In fact our server was so good she was probably one of the best ones I've ever had. I didn't catch her name unfortunately but she was a really tall brunette.   She was so friendly right from the get go and you could tell she knows what she's doing. It was almost like she was reading my mind with the coffee I wanted, even offered to give me a cup to go. My boyfriend and I were so stressed from the road and being in a new place that we weren't that high-spirited when we came in and she made my day.  And the food was delicious! I got the oink omelette and he got the Arizona omelette and pancakes and we loved our food. The fruit was really good too. My omelette was even good reheated. I only got through 1/4 of it so I had plenty of leftovers to eat later on. The sauce on the Arizona omelette was so good that I snagged some from my boyfriend's plate to use on mine. I will definitely be back there and hopefully get that same server because she was phenomenal

MY9uTfGDFCFAN5x_w8f9mw.text: In True Reese fashion I showed up late to the breakfast club shindig. But the server only let me sit there about 12 minutes before asking me if I'd like anything to drink. "Yes please, water. Thank you. Oh, and may I have a menu please?" IMO I shouldn't have to ask for that. She should have brought it over when she realized I was new to the table. Whatever. I wasn't really, REALLY hungry yet anyway.   I looked over the menu and by the time she delivered my water I had already decided on the eggs plate with jalapeno bacon. The food was pretty bland. I doused it in pepper and chollula and a bit of salt. Also, if your gimmick is bacon, you had better be damn good at it! The jalapeno bacon was definitely nothing to write home about and a friend who had ordered the bacon flight was only moderately impressed. Definitely not worth the cost in this case. Oh well. What are ya gonna do? Oh I know. Not order that again. The French toast looked yummy and if I lived on this side of town I might bring my sonny man back for breakfast.   In conclusion I feel the entire experience was simply mediocre.

DktKRPpp9xrcQYymxTZa7w.text: This little cafe tucked in the PV mall area is cute and convenient. I love that I can come here with my dog (open patio), order a heathy breakfast without sounding like a you-know (they have an egg white/no cheese omelet option), OR just go all out on an indulgence if the mood strikes. The staff is friendly, the place is always clean, and the decor is cute (they fully embrace their inner piggly spirit animal). I've always had consistent service and quality here; I recommend.

gFfAllKnHfARCYhd3abldQ.text: To me, it doesn't matter that we didn't have a full breakfast here. Oink warrants 4 stars simply because they have 8 types of bacon and they are all delicious.  Plus: great service and a dog friendly patio!  We look forward to returning to enjoy an actual breakfast, but until then, come here if you like bacon. Oink!

U6_RF9WH_mawCTjDXSFS3g.text: I visited Oink for the first time today and I have to say the food was delicious and the service was great! I had an iced caramel latte, and the French toast combo with jalapeno bacon. The bacon was perfectly cooked and a little spicy! Some of the best bacon I've had. Great atmosphere, I highly recommend this place.

itkp0o_b6Y0rj1V1dCl0xQ.text: SUCH good food! Incredible kinds of bacon. EIGHT KINDS OF BACON. Rachel was our server and she was fantastic!!! Super friendly, and she was super prompt with getting us drinks even though the restaurant was busy! We had the chorizo and eggs, and the oink french toast. Pictures posted below!

Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oink french toast

pK3IJDd0YT2nphb6g3Xbfg.text: Fun breakfast place.  The flight of bacon is a great idea - can't have too much bacon.  Service was good on our last visit.  Good selection of breakfast items.

VIOQDmu_sSw6NVjZFh5T_A.text: They have breakfast and lunch pretty well figured out. They don't have *everything*, but what they do, they do well.  We've had the bad luck of having one certain server several times that isn't as good as the others. Doesn't ask what kind of bacon you want of the eight choices, nor which  sides for sandwiches. She couldn't figure out how to accommodate a flavored green tea.

WjRkWwrxa3Jk5oTjw5rUhw.text: Great breakfast place. Next time I am going for the flight of bacon. Friendly and courteous staff who went out of their way to make me feel comfortable and appreciated.

1NHYZXyacDzFVmO_Vc4g8w.text: This place is unique to sum it up in one word. Great, random selection of bacon goodness. I actually prefer this over the larger, chain-type cafes and diners but they're only open til 3 :/. Very good prices, great staff, great selection again, good parking and location.

qVnKoGTxk4PwWhp-aKL2SA.text: I wanted to like this place so bad!  I like the concept behind it, I like the decor, the name and the idea behind the flight of different flavored bacon.  Unfortunately, this establishment fell short of all expectations.   Went in a group of 3 on Sunday for brunch.  2 of us ordered 2 eggs any style + bacon and the third ordered a BLT.  Despite the simplicity of our orders we still had to wait 40-50 minutes for food. That's pretty much where the disappointment begins:  - several tables that were seated after us, got their food before us.  - they forgot to bring my place setting a couple of times - Ordered has browns extra crispy.  They weren't crispy, they were just cold when they arrived =( -they forgot my english muffin -the Jalepeno bacon I was super excited about, tasted like.. regular unflavored bacon.. and it was soggy =/.   For a place named Oink, at the very least you'd expect the bacon to be good right? wrong =/.  I wouldn't come here for food again, but maybe alcohol haha.  Their alcohol is pretty cheap: $4/5 mimosas and bloody maries w/ bacon, $2.50 beer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IlI7UojdyT6KnpCkX7jRWg.text: My partner and I came here today on a whim and we had a great time. Our waitress was Josie and she was super fun and informative. She asked us numerous questions as to our preference, making it very personalized. We each had different Benedicts  (bacon and turkey) and we highly recommend it. Thanks for a great breakfast and we will definitely return.

RNi7vST4tsk-e90MHL5bng.text: I was staying just down the street for a work training and arrived early so I had some time to explore. The woman at the front desk of my hotel said hands down Oink was the place to go if I wanted a good local spot. She was so right! A place with 8 types of bacon on the menu had to be at least okay, right?! The service was good, everyone was very sweet and attentive.  I got the pork confit omelet and it was good. The pork was super tender and really well seasoned. It's a ton of food, omelet toast and a side of your choice. I got the ranchero sauce on the side and I'm glad I did because it was spicy so I don't know I would have wanted it on top of all my omelet. As a sweet treat I got the maple bacon donut, woah baby! It was served nice and warm was cakey and had some nice cinnamon spicing to it, it was a little dry but I was there closer to lunch and I hadn't had a donut in a couple years so I didn't mind.  Overall good breakfast spot!

25ex6yxcBuY1lh07riC01A.text: Great service (Rachel K., Renin), great coffee & great breakfasts! Becoming my favorite breakfast destination.

UQXrmUF9Ji5KoBsLLPwBqg.text: The food is great here but the hostesses tend to underestimate the wait time. That wouldn't be so bad if the air condition temp was set lower. It feels like a sauna while you wait.

fmPaVjGoZyEUi1UjSDgn5A.text: The food here is above average & is reasonably priced. The service is is also good, it's good to see the manager so active in helping his staff busy or slow, it shows a well run operation.   The bacon doughnuts & flavored bacons stand out and are delicious.  However, one of their signature dishes, the pork confit, was very dry & bland. Other than that, I have not had a bad meal & have eating breakfast there for about a year.  If you go on a Saturday or Sunday morning, be prepared to wait 45-60 minutes for a table.

_vzV1vudCSVrn4UHremkdQ.text: This is such a unique place!  The atmosphere is fun and casual, but it's a nice enough place to take the parents to.  It's sorta like Denny's meets Starbucks as far as being nice.  I had a maple bacon donut and it was amazing.  I have never been a fan of putting bacon on pancakes, but that's precisely what this tasted like without being being overpowering in any way.  Also great cappuccinos.  The wait staff are awesome, and once I forgot to tip them but they were so graceful about it.

2vGcEUQG0MrKkfY0yoC22A.text: The wife and I decided to visit this locale this morning because it is only about a 5 minute or less walk from our Apartment. I have read every review on here pertaining to this establishment and most of it remains True despite the fact it has been almost 2 weeks since it has been open. We arrived at about 11:00am and we were seated fairly quickly. The server came pretty quickly and got us some water and I had the coffee which is just average.   It took us about 5 to 7 minutes to decide what to order and the server took our order at about 11:15am. I ordered the Pancake Combo with one egg scrambled....and turkey sausage. My wife had the Chorizo and eggs which came with home fries. So after about 30 minutes waiting for our food to arrive.....the owner or manager....which was an elderly lady... came out to each table an apologized for the long wait and offered us some oink cookies. She explained that when they were planning the business structure that she was told there would be several customers in the area that would come to this type of establishment. However there have been hundreds of people showing up and they were not prepared for that.  She also expressed there have been some issues with the cooking staff....arguing back and forth about who should be preparing what....and how it should be prepared....there are some huge communication issues that need to be worked out. Finally at about 12:05pm we finally received our food....so that means it took about an hour from the time we first ordered. Now since we live so close to this establishment I didn't mind the wait.....however had I come say 20 minutes away....I wouldn't want to wait an hour to have breakfast.   The Food was OUTSTANDING.....DELICIOUS.....AWESOME.....so there were no problems in this area at all. Now if this establishment can just get better organized....because we had to ask for silverware.....napkins....straws....and butter for my pancakes.....and get the communication issues squared away in the kitchen....this will be a guaranteed 5 star establishment. So by all means if your in the east valley and are looking for a place to have a GREAT TASTING....MADE TO ORDER breakfast....give the Oink Cafe a try. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!  NOTE: Just another FYI the elderly lady came back after we finished our breakfast and offered us a wonder piece of sour creme pecan coffee cake....so she was really trying to make customers feel comfortable and apologize for our wait. You have to appreciate that kind of service and her honesty about the situation....I truly believe this place will have great success once they fix some of there issues!!!!

oCL-9QptntfNV0ExNgJ1lg.text: Here is my pigtail. When I can, I will stop in a new restaurant, meet and greet the owners and look over the menu to see something traditional and something new. What catches my eye here is the bacon. You know bacon will never let you down. I learn from the owner that he hires the chef, over several qualifications but will have to cook one meal to get the job. So I decide to order the job winning meal. I was really not all that interested in testing chef's speed, artistry and creativity, nope I want a winter savory meal representing his interpretation of the classic Eggs Benedict $9, and a side of jalapeno bacon $3. Everybody enjoys a surprise ingredient and the jalapeno heat in the bacon was a winner. The flavor of the Hollandaise sauce was rich and buttery with that ever so slight lemon tang. The perfect poached egg too. Lunch the next day I had a club sandwich. A excellent sandwich born from the remnants of many delicious things. Three slices of thin white toast, choice of bacon and I chose honey bacon since I already enjoyed jalapeno bacon the previous day. Lettuce, tomato, honey cured ham, turkey and a little mayo and spices. There are three choices of fries, regular, thick and sweet. This meal is very large. $8. yelp.com/biz_photos/gugN... One last note, the meats are oven cooked in this kitchen, roast beef next up. The staff and the owners are kind and thoughtful. There are plenty of pros to dining here and I have yet to see a con.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Club Sandwich with honey bacon

I4GYqBJ9mXqUwJkxZKkH7w.text: Been here three weeks in a row and every time the food is consistently good! All three times it has been really busy but that never changed how good everything is! Service is great, food comes out fast, and coffee is good! If you don't like crowds and super loud environment then bring a jacket (when it's cold) and sit on the patio! Well worth the chill.   Ps skip the bacon flight and just eat the Jalapeno bacon mmmm  Pss and the poinsettia which is champs and cranberry juice

yBv0-3lHK-Yv0HYIWZXKgg.text: This place used to be packed. But now with all the new breakfast joints popping up in the same area  I can understand why it's dead on a Thursday morning. Food is mediocre at best. Reminds me of an old truck stop diner. The bacon is good though I will give them that. But was REALLY pissed me off was not telling me of the actual up charge to add an item to your order. $3 for 4 thin slices of tomato?? I mean c'mon. **It's deceptive to not disclose the actual cost of the up charge!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arizona Omelet

RGOOVEw2OYkk1KLIX-08DQ.text: I've been to Oink a couple of times .... and I really hope it pulls through and makes it.    It's in a location where 'The Eggery' was in Paradise Valley for a long, long time and they were very busy and successful.  Several places have come and gone since then... and for some reason, I'm really routing for Oink, but they have a lot of work to do.   The parking is not exactly the best.   I would HIGHLY recommend you park in the EAST parking lot rather than the SOUTH.   If you enter from the south entrance, you have to walk all the way to the back (er, um, front?) of the restaurant to only walk back where you came from to be seated.  A little awkward, but I didn't learn my lesson from the first time I was there.     There is a cute little patio area that I hope they utilize someday... love sitting outside!    The restaurant atmosphere is a little sparse, but since it's just starting out, I hope they add more to the decor- because I love nice ambiance.   Right now it's bland and boring.     The food is great!  My co-workers enjoyed piled high sandwiches and build your own omlettes which they really liked.  I've tried their bacon cheeseburger, which was so good the first time, that I ordered it again.  Yes, I'm boring.   I also ejoyed their sweet potato fries.  If you're going to try this place... be sure to go with a huge dose of patience.  These girls are REALLY trying to get it right.  They are very pleasant, but I just don't think they've gotten their groove yet on service.      Ladies, work smarter, not harder.  For instance, grab silverware when you grab the menus, so you're not back and forth and running over yourself.    Maybe even have a service station closer to the back (er, um, front?) of the restaurant.  It's a long jaunt back and forth.   Anyways, I wish you the best of luck.  It has a great food with great potential!

3VteQexflPEZl5wOa7qZCQ.text: Staying at my sister's place while visiting the Valley for Thanksgiving, and of course she didn't have any food, certainly no breakfast grub.  Google Maps tells me that one of the nearest breakfast joints is Oink Cafe, and based on the name alone, I felt we should try it out.  Since it was a nice morning, my lady and I walked the relatively short distance to give it a shot.    It was a lot bigger than I expected, I guess I was picturing some little hole-in-the-wall with grease everywhere and some grumpy old lady slinging bacon everywhere in an effort to appease the hungry masses crammed into the place.  No, it was spacious and clean.  The menu was typical, except for the flight of bacon.  I love beer, and routinely get flights of beer when they are available, but I am not a huge fan of bacon and don't feel the need to try all 10 (or whatever) varieties of bacon this place has.  I'm sure plenty of people do, but I felt it was a silly novelty.    I ordered the chorizo and eggs, my lady had a ranchero omelet.  She ordered it without onions, it came out with hella onions, but the server was very friendly and attentive and took it back and it was quickly replaced with the correct version without the evil onions.  My fiancee also had a Bloody Mary (with bacon) and raved about it.  I don't dig on Bloody Mary's so I was unimpressed, but she said it was one of the best she's had in a long time.  My food was delicious, especially the side of jalapeno bacon I ordered.  Yeah, I know, I said I don't love bacon, but I figured I had to try one of the flavors.  Good God, the jalapeno bacon was incredible.  It was just the right amount of spice to liven up an otherwise drab piece of fatty meat.  It almost made wish that I had ordered the flight, just to see if the other flavors were as delicious.  Almost.    The service was friendly, quick, and attentive.  The atmosphere was a little bit stale because it lacked intimacy, but there is plenty of hand-colored pig art adorning the walls to occupy your time.  Overall, it was a very pleasant breakfast experience, much better than finishing off the stale box of cereal at my sister's place.

jcG9UmZlcWx3GQhaLNQriA.text: Great way to celebrate International Bacon Day! Started with their signature Bacon Bloody Mary which could be a meal all on its own. My table shared the flight of bacon. So good! I order the Stuffed Pork Loin Benedict special. AMAZING! A delicous and very creative way to present a benedict. Service at the Oink is always very friendly. If you haven't been yet you should..... Go get your Oink on!

dA4ABJALXLa-zzIV6qXmwg.text: We love Oink. Reminds me of Iowa. I even wore my Iowa shirt today with a pig on it that says "bacon is our second language." Love everything about Oink. Bacon, bacon and more bacon I say! Never had bad service like some of the reviews. Yes it gets busy but that is what happens when a place is popular. Eggs Benedict is the best!! I wish I lived closer so I could eat here every weekend! My review is 5 strips if bacon...or stars if you must.

qHRZhHuxrXzJ7_8cjLfKeg.text: First time here today!   Service was great! Our server was very chipper!  Clean and open atmosphere.   I enjoyed the bacon pancakes and home fries. Lots of food and super filling! Also sipped on a Cafe Mocha which hit the saturday morning spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. yummy cappuccino!

J2j2h4RoyE8pehjmBU9MMQ.text: From the moment you walk in the door it's a great experience happy efficient staff and awesome food!  What more can you ask for!! A definite first choice!!

FfuJpyN17KeQQYu3wM4dmw.text: Three stars because it was average.  I loved the idea of this place, and thought it would be fun to try. Well, it was average.  I got a half flight of bacon (4 pieces - applewood, honey, sugar and apple cider). The only one that tasted any different from its brothers was the apple cider. I'm not sure if I actually liked it or just likes the fact it didn't taste the same.  I got the bacon benedict. It looked good, and the hash towns weren't bad (if very plain). The bacon was very hard, and the sauce was way too thick. It was also honestly kind of tasteless. My mother and daughter both had French toast and enjoyed it, however.  Just for fun we ordered a bacon donut on our way out. Granted I didn't eat it until a few hours after we'd left (kids, whatcha gonna do?), but I didn't find it very good either. Not much taste, very dense.

ty8UvyKtSIJg7n_KTTzy2A.text: Got a flight of bacon and a cheeseburger. 8 different types of bacon ranging from spicy to sweet, burger was big and juicy. I went with two kids and they ate all of their food which is always a challenge!

99TmNA_f5h34usTTUGW70A.text: Let's start with that I love this place.  The only reason I give it 4 stars is that there is a serious lack of staff. It's either not enough wait staff or not enough cooking staff. I'm not really sure. This place is always packed. It's always a minimum 20 minute wait to get seated and then when you're seated, it takes another 10 to get your drink and then another 10 for your order.   Personally they need to add wait staff. They are working far too many tables per waiter/waitress. If they added 2 to a shift, they could churn people in and out of here. Bus boys wouldn't hurt either.   Overall great food, great location and great setting but too understaffed for the amount of business they get.

qAQvFFtni4aqo45pGHS8uQ.text: Great management here. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming, waitresses hostesses and even the managers. Love it! Yummy food too!!!

nMHeEwVa73A9J49_gCQPuA.text: We celebrated my birthday at Oink Cafe today.  Our first time so we shared the flight of  bacon which was enjoyable.  I ordered the blueberry pancakes which were plentiful and juicy.  Quality of tuna in daughter's sandwich was high.  Mimosa was ok but not something I would want to repeat.  Biggest challenge is that I am a short person and the tables are too high.  As a result I had some major spillage on my clothing.  After brunch we had to run to Ross and purchase a replacement blouse so I could continue my Bday activities.

3gaEoqZbQp2suiEP6Y6DRw.text: I thought I should write an update, as since my first visit 4 months ago I have dined there abput 8 times.  My experiences have never been as good as my first visit.  The omelet has not once been fluffy like the first time.  Since I cook a lot, cooking a flat omelet isn't a challenge so I'd just as soon keep the $20 in my pocket.  In addition, the last time I visited I ordered a side of bacon and it was delivered cold - not warm, cold, cooked but cold.  The restaurant was not busy, perhaps 35% capacity.  Flat omelets and cold bacon isn't worth the price.  I don't think I'll return, too many other places to try.

bE3uFkVyOPXPtlz9GusfDw.text: Best eggs benedict ever! Service is always great home fries are delicious bacon Bloody Marys are great as well. I have brought my family from out of town to the Oink and everyone loves it every time!  The manager Sean is always coming around to make sure all guests  are having a great experience!

-sSx0CaijkgIcgpRpetfWQ.text: Pretty standard breakfast fare, I'd say. So the prices might be too high for the type of food you'd expect.   I got the pulled pork benedict which was good. It was very tender but the sauce was pretty limiting.   Bf had omelette. It was the five egg omelette which was huge but it looked pretty sparse to me in toppings. We also has a bacon donut which is really crunchy but wasn't warmed or anything so that kind of fell flat. Way too sweet. Skip the syrup with it but it might be too dry otherwise.

zyigBAt0asg50uho9AUXvA.text: Our breakfasts at The Oink Cafe (Paradise Valley) were delicious and accompanied by super tasty bacon and sausage sides. I wanted to sample a variety of their bacons, so I ordered a basic breakfast of two eggs with hash browns, then added a half-flight (4 pieces) of bacon, and 2 sausage links.  I was in Heaven! My wife ordered the Oink French Toast Combo with a sweet crumb crust topped with whipped cream and strawberry sauce, berries and sugar, plus an egg with bacon. She savored every bite!  They also serve espresso drinks, premium beer, and cocktails - especially Bloody Marys. Everything is fresh and service is very good.  Definitely recommended.
