I9T4HJ9zTUcabUqO99hfEw.text: American Breakfast Food With Good Service  We popped in here for a little brunch after visiting REI nearby... This place was super packed and I must say it was good food.   I had the chicken fried chicken with gravy and it was good...   The manager lady was super friendly and made sure she stopped by to make sure we were happy mid meal...   Not much else to say but if you need a good feeding this may just be your spot....

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0rTqE4mofDl5Rxhp8zu4MA.text: We have been wanting to come here for quite some time now! So with us being able to squeeze in a Sunday brunch, we were finally able to come here. The wait was long and I believe we were quoted 20 minutes but I believe it was closer to 30 minutes. Once seated we were taken very good care of by our waitress. And, with that said that is my biggest complaint! If you have read any of my reviews in the past then you know I don't like to waste calories on bad food. Lucky for me this was a winning meal all around. Unbutton your top button on your pants and enjoy the ride. Eat like a pig if you want! You only live once! With that in mind, we went full fledge into the menu! We ordered the 10 piece bacon flight that featured 10 different bacon slices. Ok, we shared it! My absolute favorites were the Jalapeno, apple cider and the pecan wood slices. Hubby was a fan of the hickory. Pass the bacon, please! I also ordered the raspberry latte which was quite tasty. On to the main course: Hubby ordered the Oink Omelet with potatoes and toast. The omelet was a great size and quite enjoyable, although I wasn't given a bite I can attest to his enjoyment of it. I ordered the biscuits and gravy because that is something I would never make at home. It was without a doubt the best I've ever had and a great size portion. I loved the freshness of the biscuits! No salt or pepper needed.The potatoes were wonderful as well. Neither of us was able to complete our meal! That usually doesn't happen at breakfast. The bill was over $45 so it was a definite splurge in every sense of the word, but for the portion size and quality of the food, I feel it was worth it. The biggest thing they could improve on is wait time and opening up the patio area to diners who might not mind sitting outside in our AZ heat.

Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My favorites were the jalapeño, apple cider and pecan wood. Mike&#39;s was the hickory.

tSUx-c6vfaZwF5Nl9E4cUw.text: Chicken fried steak is very good biscuits and Granny are awesome cuz sausage gravy is good pepper gravy is awesome bacon donut is very very awesome the service is very good I recommend everybody to come check it out

5FWgVmTrXIeIZRFjBRsvFA.text: Went for brunch, ordered the Chimi. So good!!   Would I come back? YES!  Food: 4  Service: 5+ (wonderful waitress)  I ordered the CHIMI,if you come here you must order. Sooo friggen good and HUGE.   The bacon donut was the SHIT. They warm it up for you!   Other food was okay: - bacon tasting, they all tasted the same  - southwest omelette was good - chicken fried steak was a little chewy

K9nIlXUooFIXc3lxQuXhxA.text: Holy smoke. Where do I begin. I had the breakfast chimichanga, and it was amazing. Also my wife had traditional breakfast with ham egg and potatoes. She loved it. My wife also had a mimosa flight and it was incredible. We will be back.

f67z4g4wHYIIHT0k0s_yaw.text: Sunday morning around 10am, first time here. I've been meaning to come here for years. It was a full house but we got a booth right away. I ordered the Flight of bacon and Chicken California omelette with English muffin, hash brown potatoes and coffee. Our waitress was friendly and service was very fast. The omelette was very good. The Flight of bacon was 8 strips of all their flavors of bacon. I thought 5 out of the 8 strips of bacon tasted the same. The jalapeno, pepper and pecanwood bacon were distinguishable and tasty. The rest were just bacon flavored to me. It was all good, will have to come back again to sample more of the menu.       Came back a second time for lunch. This time it was about 1:15, they close at 2. The place was half full. I ordered the 50/50 burger with cheese and sweet potato fries. It took little longer for our food this time. The burger and fries were very good.The burger was flavorful and the sweet potato fries were salted just right and crispy. Decent service

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oink oink

AyuSaNP1iM_AnyRatUy9MQ.text: This place is delicious! The pumpkin pancakes are the perfect amount of pumpkin flavor, and the bacon is tasty. Don't let the 3 star reviews fool you, we live in the neighborhood now and will be coming back often.

h0iHiwR7_yzEYrerjaPPIQ.text: My wife and I have been coming here since it opened and we absolutely love this place. I have never had a bad meal here and the huevos rancheros with chorizo is the best IMO. The service is always good and the people very friendly. We moved to the west side a few years ago and don't make it over as much but when we're in the area we always stop by. Any plans of possibly open up on the west side?

qnvxnvWnL-GNe3f3fPPe2Q.text: I've literally been wanting to try this place for years, and I finally convinced people to go with me last weekend. It sounds like my experience was different from some of the other reviewers, but Oink Cafe did not disappoint! I got the breakfast sandwich on a biscuit with cheese and hash browns for $6.49 and a side of mac n cheese for $3.99. My husband got the breakfast nachos, which was one of the specials of the day. The portions were huge! I ate half my sandwich, all of the mac n cheese, and maybe 1/3 of the hash browns and took the rest to go. I don't even think my husband ate half of his nachos, and he can eat. We got our food in less than ten minutes. I felt that my biscuit could've been more buttery and flaky, but everything else was great. The eggs were nice and fluffy, the bacon was awesome, and the hash browns were perfectly seasoned. Full disclosure: I had originally ordered the mac n cheese for my daughter but she was too busy drawing on the table so I ended up eating all of it. It was so good! The cheese was creamy and the pasta was al dente to withstand the weight of the cheese. I didn't have any of the breakfast nachos but for the rest of the day, my husband kept talking about how yummy the carnitas that was sprinkled over it was. He was also pleasantly surprised to find that the chips rested on a bed of hash browns.   I found Oink Cafe to be extremely reasonably priced and delicious. I'm so glad I got to check it out!

I8xF1SzvroHqaSFvHXKKUg.text: Breakfast was tasty with eggs cooked to order and the hash browns were cooked beautifully with nice not overwhelming flavor of onions.    We also got half a flight of bacon with different flavors.   Honey glazed, applewood smoked apple cider and jalapenos.  I wanted a crisper bacon bite and more flavor.   Especially for a place called oink.    3.5 stars is where this place rates.  We will come back for the breakfast and fun but not for the bacon.

eyja8BRM8eahSkt0rH6q9Q.text: They chose the appropriate name for this cafe!!   Oink is accurately descriptive for how I felt trying to consume half my meal!!  The waitress even asked me if there were enough hash browns if you can believe that!!  Perfectly poached eggs and the bacon variety was surprising.  Jalapeno is my favorite kind of bacon now and will try to find my own to make my own BLT with avocado for lunch!!   Love the availability of getting local brews for breakfast.   Incredibly kind wait staff.   A great place to have breakfast.  I will definitely return for lunch soon.   Great cafe!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yflaI3LOt9rksgSkF7Jvhg.text: Place was really good and met all expectations, probably wouldn't wait that long again as I personally didn't feel they are offering something so great I couldn't get it somewhere else. That's no knock against the place, they have good food and service, I just haven't had the urge to go back.

tEoG3nFQGobf_Wb7OeqLfA.text: We went on a busy day and the wait was going to be 40 minutes. After seeing us with two kids and our willingness to sit outside on a sunny day, the staff pushed tables together for us and helped us arrange the umbrellas to make shade. They were helpful and patient through the ordering process. The food was good too!!

szixeaZDUrAeVXb_SDm54Q.text: Loved the bacon flight and bloody mary flight. Pancakes were nice and delicious. Definitely recommend to anyone just for the flights. I love that idea

QNe2KXsAHXVWeA_PA6HdaQ.text: Tasty food and a good assortment of mimosas! Wish they had a mimosa special though. I need to come again to try out the flight of bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

haNK7N4Vl8jZYwuZ-BwQ1g.text: Terrible service. Just stood waiting to be seated for 10 minutes with 4 waitresses/hostesses and a half full restaurant. Lady before me was seated promptly. I stood around like an idiot for 10 minutes just waiting to be acknowledged and...crickets. Will never go again. IHOP is right across the street and they ALWAYS at least seat you immediately. This was pathetic and will discourage others from even going to a place with such unprofessional service. Severely disappointed. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!

7MoACBXHY0DD7oSG79hyAg.text: Every time I visit the Valley Oink is a must stop for breakfast...PERIOD! My go to dish is the blueberry pancake combo...BOMB! Two pancakes, egg whites, and apple wood beacon...I high recommend this spot

OD6J9LGF3tP4BEe8pNlJSA.text: Be prepare to wait over 20 minutes for service or not be served at all!! Have enjoyed this place a couple times in the past but on the morning of November 6th, after being seated I waited with my sister for 20 minutes with no one coming up to our table. We were totally ignored the whole time. It was a Tuesday morning and it was not busy and there were three servers walking around that passed our table more than once. We informed the manager and left. Will not be back and will make sure to tell our friends. Hopefully they get better service staff.

sbTkEc-JlZ9AmsOwQuA4Ug.text: Extremely disappointed. We waited for 20 minutes with no service. No one came to take our drink or food order. The couple next to us came in after us, waited 3 minutes, and got waited on. That's when we got up and left, after informing the manager of the horrible "service". I understand that when a business is busy things can get overlooked. However, this happened on a Tuesday morning. There were very little people there and three servers... There was absolutely no reason why we would have been forgotten.

Xw9kPUOn0gNg4Fd5cX5Hpg.text: Its ok.. love the bacon.. for sure -- other then just another normal breakfast place.. really packed ! great servers!

2DoscrOso5jNxkNHwy19KA.text: It was good, not the best or the worst - just good. I wouldn't mind going there again. My dad was disappointed by the bacon, seemed more like something you would pick up from the local grocery store.

1cIPy8az2eAANTJLSd_kcQ.text: It was a Monday at 10 am. We were seated outside. Another couple was seated after us right next to us.  After 15  minutes they had water/coffee and ordered. We didn't even have the server that sat us ever come back and a knowledge our presence.  We simply got up and left, I mean what's the point of complaining when people are making your food??

W7TtrdqC1kP4RbxRvE0RTg.text: First and last time here... hostesses were rude. Especially the elderly woman who was presumably supervising was rude,  and although Sundays are understandably busy, I don't think she should let her frustrations translate through to her guests.  We were quoted us the wrong wait time of 25 min after 39min when we asked were advised of would be another 35 min in a very abrasive manner.  We left and we won't find out if the food was worth the wait because of the rudeness of the host staff.  When spending $ service is almost as important as the food

rwChe2dPoPX8L5GRbVvcVQ.text: Kitschy name, cute concept, a little indie place in an area consumed by monolithic chains -- Oink really had all the potential in the world.   The space is simple, open, and clean, although very sparse --  what some may interpret as modern simply reeked of half-assedness to me. "Hey, let's throw some pink paint on one wall and call it a day!" The bathrooms had fancy schmancy modern sinks and fixtures, although the weekly cleaning form on the back of the door was, disconcertingly, completely blank.  The service was super average, better than I expected considering I had heard it was atrocious. My breakfast-loving SO and I did our usual, each of us getting our own separate egg things followed by a shared short stack of blueberry pancakes. My omelet was nice, steaming hot and full of nice fresh veggies. The home fries on the side, though, were cold. The English muffin was barely toasted, also cold, and so slathered in butter it was slippery. My SO inhaled most of his Hollandaise-slathered Benedict, but let's face it, he'd slurp down a dog turd if it was drenched in Hollandaise. The pancakes were completely and utterly unremarkable, as was the OJ (watery and bitter) and coffee.   The sucker punch was the bill: with tip, over $40 for two for breakfast. If I wanted to shell out $40 for breakfast, I would stay in my own hood and go to Taylor's where I know the food will be spectacular and the service top-notch. Alternatively, I could go to IHOP across the street, where I know the food will be reliably above average for half the price.  Sorry, Oink, your prices make you little piggies. You've gotta step up your game, because no one wants to pay Paradise Valley prices for a Glendale experience.

rHOIhdFLWNbBgNU67fcPjw.text: Can't speak to the food, because we decided to leave after waiting 20 minutes without being greeted or getting a drinks order, while watching multiple tables around us get served first, despite arriving after us. There only seemed to be one server for a section of 12 tables. The ambiance wasn't great - it was extremely loud and chaotic. Not a good spot for a relaxing breakfast or brunch.

975Og0I3CXygm-otG6z11w.text: Sometimes, I feel cheated by salads at restaurants, because I figure, I could buy a bag of lettuce, dump it on a plate and call it a day for a third of the price! I had a really satisfying strawberry and chicken salad  ($8.99)  here recently and will definitely go back next time I'm in the market for a healthy lunch out: 4 ounces of grilled chicken on a generous heap of salad, topped with blue cheese and fresh strawberries.

RYBQgBpVpFFe0dX7x11L0g.text: I was really looking forward to this place.... Won't be back. We ordered biscuits and gravy and chorizo and eggs with a side of turkey and bacon. It took 50 min for the food to come out and when it did everything was cold. The sparse sausage gravy  was lumpy and bland, and the biscuits were dry.   On the chorizo and eggs, my dining companion said they were 'okay' mind you that the waitress had said that the reason for the wait on the food was because they were making "fresh Chorizo'' we wondered if they meant they were mid slaughter being as it took so long to arrive. But then it was just OKAY? yeah, not good enough.   When the food came out the waitress dropped the side of turkey sausage, which ended up being a blessing because, though it took 10 more minutes to get a new order, at least it was hot.   We won't be going back.

Neb5npWegXJYMj4kEqraFg.text: Very good! We live nearby. We got the pork confit Benedict and the strawberry cheesecake pancakes. They were delicious. I was worried the strawberry sauce would be goopy red sugar syrup like from IHOP but it was fresh pureed .

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. strawberry cheesecake pancakes.

I7HyeCCUj3FcSM6fa4-HSg.text: Was hoping to be blown away by the maple bacon donut, but it was dry and lacking in maple flavor. Had a couple good bites but other bites not. The other more standard fare items were enjoyed. Pancakes, omelettes, etc were good. Little slow on the service with one large table of single checks slowing things up.

bMb5_ZeWh6hBBB2CHKWydQ.text: Sadly, not the best breakfast.   The interior is very cute and they carry about their pig theme very tastefully (meaning the place isn't covered from head to toe pigs). Our waitress, Tammy, was extremely quick and friendly. And other waitstaff would buzz by with the coffee carafe for refills.  My husband's pancakes were undercooked in the center and had to be refired. I had the eggs Benedict. The sauce is extremely thick and a bit salty and the eggs were over poached and looked like hard little balls smothered in sauce. My applewood smocked bacon I ordered on the side was so hard it was difficult to eat.  But it's really the little details, like the not completely full chai tea and the discovery of dirty silverware rolled up in my napkin that leaves me with an ugh feeling.  Don't get me wrong, I was immediately brought new silverware, but the lack of attention to catch that before rolling it up in a napkin makes me wonder what else gets over looked.  I'll give it another try before completely washing my hands over it, but it is going to have to work a little harder to change my mind completely.

2-g6J_MGmm1n8K1tssphtA.text: Bacon madness! Huge french toast! Cute little piggies decorating the orange walls!  Oink is a friendly, peppy place to go for breakfast. The food is pretty good, the place is happy, all-in-all I would say this is the perfect place to wake up in the morning!  The only irksome quality was our server, who seemed very nervous, checked on us at weird times, and said "you're welcome" too often (I didn't know that was possible, but it was).   I enjoyed the jalapeno (!) bacon and the oink french toast. The cinnamon rolls were also tasty, but my group was disappointed by the eggs benedict. I would say the food could be better, but it's just awesome to have a local breakfast place somewhere in my neighborhood now!

k22oSOTiZOutOKNR3WNxgA.text: Several visits...I REALLY wanted to like this place because it us close by , and good breakfast places are hard to come by.  The hostesses are blase about  their jobs. Even with dozens of people waiting, they have no sense of urgency about getting people seated.  On our LAST (read: FINAL) visit, we asked to be seated outside. The hostess started to seat us at a table with splats of bird poop on the table. I told her no thank you, I did not wish to be seated at a table with bird doo on it. No apology. Just, "So you want to go inside then?"  We did. I asked to speak with the manager. He was just full of excuses.  "They get busy" is what we were told. BY THE MANAGER!  ???????? That's disgusting. I understand the birds are not trained. I understand it is outside. But to actually be willing to SEAT someone at a TABLE covered in bird poop makes me wonder what the kitchen is like.  Does the kitchen staff get too busy to wash their hands? Too busy to clean the pans?  Too busy to remember not to put the cooked bacon where the raw bacon has been? No thank you.

ZofWaNUd5pPhYvvOQL1t_g.text: Food always good here & servers are friendly but I wish they had a someone to buss tables. Seems like the servers can't keep up with it any time I'm here. It's gross walking by dirty table after dirty table. This would detract from a 4 star review but my server was so nice I had to up from 3 to 4 stars.

bESC2iUb74fEAEDTWJ2dNQ.text: This is a great place. Always make sure to bring the family all 26 of us when in town!   They have Great service . All it takes is a call and they can find room! We try to go early because we have such a good time here!  Who Doesn't Love Bacon 7 different kinds! and their  food is wonderfull!!  Fluffy pancakes, Crispy Bacon, Great Eggs Benedict! and I caould go on you just have to try it to believe it.  and did I mention 7 different kinds of bacon love it

P1OPXTMO8oR1ufgW6ZgTSQ.text: Bacon cooked perfectly. Eggs cooked perfect. I ordered the bacon Benedict and I always ask for the eggs to be cooked well. Awesome Bacon Bloody Mary! Very friendly staff.

JYmmq4erGbKbtVtnFNWJcg.text: We had a great late lunch last week at Oink. Arrived about 30 minutes before their 2:00 closing but that made no difference. Our server, Suzie was wonderful.  Oink burger was HUGE, cooked to perfection topped with cheese, bacon (of course!) lettuce and tomato and served with a ridiculous amount of fries. My chicken wrap was amazing! We will be back!!!

O4IwBieKB1mA2z8m7OcZ6Q.text: Great breakfast. And if you like bacon...they have 8...yes 8 flavors!  You can get a flight and try them all! Everything was very fresh and served timely and correctly. Also, the cinnamon roll with bacon on top ( check the display of baked goods)

Ztp8c5B8xtPPXTgooYREBw.text: OMG- I LOVE Oink. And I hate breakfast restaurants. So I guess that says a lot.   Tried it out on a whim one day and now I crave it- they have the BEST french toast. My husband rotates between pigs in a blanket and bacon pancakes. I initially was skeptical, especially after reading reviews. But, it's right across the street from an IHOP so I figured that they probably had something unique going on if they have been able to keep their lights on.   Once we decided to go in there and give Oink a try, I knew that we'd make a good choice. The pastry case with the bacon-maple donuts caught my attention, and It kept getting better- we received excellent service and ate excellent food. I'm really not sure why there aren't more 5 star reviews. One of these days, I'm going to have to be bad and get one of those donuts. Their pastry case seriously looks amazing, if you're trying to become a diabetic at breakfast.   We travel with a 1-year-old, so eating out is hard. Oink is the perfect place for us to go grab breakfast because it's noisy (read, always full), so I don't worry about my loud and messy baby, and it's fast (we have never been there more than 45 minutes from beginning to end.) It's always busy when we're there, but not too busy- longest wait I've had has been 5 minutes. We've gone there a handful of times since the first, and have never had the bad service people talk about, but maybe that's because we go early, closer to 8 (and we miss the after church crowd.) If you go in the winter months, be sure to sit on the patio- not much to look at (in the Target parking lot) but much more quiet.

9it2Mgohx9RE31pHfc6Gtw.text: Slightly above average breakfast joint with a few distinctive items.  The servings are more generous than average and service is good.  They have a full bar and of course you have to try the bacon bloody mary!  Would definitely eat here again.

Gtqics-g-2y0dw2JFVsWEQ.text: This was the first breakfast place we tried after moving to our house and it did NOT disappoint. I think we made it our weekly go to and every time we have a guest or family come from out of town we take them here! If you like bacon, (which funny enough I don't) I hear from all my family and friends it's top notch and they have such a variety to try! I love walking over and sitting on their patio with my fur-baby and enjoying a nice breakfast and coffee! Staff is always so nice and never disappoints.

TlXbSDa585XX3m87Wt9Gvg.text: I needed a quick place to stop for coffee before a work obligation and saw Oink from the street. Always looking to throw money anywhere but Starbucks, I made both a sharp turn and new enemies in traffic to get my ass there.   No wait to be seated, I took a seat out on the shaded patio and grabbed a maple bacon donut and a latte. Donut was warm and covered with a Ron Swanson worthy amount of the crispy bacon. Latte was yummy!  They showed me a menu and it all escalated so quickly ... suddenly I found myself in front of eggs, home fries, and two strips of the monthly special, Pecanwood Glazed Bacon.  I would put a baby in that bacon. I'd make an honest woman out of that bacon. You get the idea.   Order your home fries extra hot as tiny potatoes don't insulate themselves very well. The food was awesome and the service was CRAZY FRIENDLY: warm, but without the zeal of a used car salesman.  Eat here! Get bacon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really nice shaded outdoor patio!

ZZi_qSrNTGlxozinZiQdVA.text: I've been eagerly awaiting a good time to try this place out because, well, BACON! It's got a nice layout and the wait staff was extremely friendly. When I go to a place for breakfast one of the key factors to a good experience is if the wait staff can keep my coffee cup filled. Yeah for Autumn, our server. She did this for our whole table. I honestly could not decide on what to get so I told her to "Surprise me". Sometimes not a good idea, but I was pleasantly surprised. I was served the breakfast burger. Big hunk of meat and cheese with pepper bacon on a wheat bun. I was impressed at it's size however they forgot the egg on the burger and brought it on a separate plate a minute later. One of our party tried the "flight" of bacon and stated it was pretty good. I tried a piece of the Applewood and I liked it better than the pepper.   So my overall impression of Oink Cafe was good but not over the top. Forgetting an ingredient on a menu item is a no-no in any restaurant but I am glad they brought it. I would have never known. The coffee was good and the servers excellent. A little on the pricey side for breakfast for my taste. Over $80 for 5 of us. I'd like to go back and try lunch. Maybe I will do that soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee!!!!! Not bacon flavored

L2o49tkc2G8_Se4biu5-ng.text: What a fun breakfast experience.  Not a typical "cookie cutter" breakfast joint.  Nice variety on the menu and the bacon...oh my, the bacon. We'll be back.

l7KsLpRkN381tvZeOgX9rQ.text: We waited 45 minutes for our food to arrive and our waitress wouldn't even come to our table to get our check when we were finished. We had to go inside to find someone to pay. They only took $5 off our bill!! Totally ridiculous to wait this long for eggs with no apology from our waitress!!! The manager was nice and the food was decent but very annoyed at this experience!

eDcBf327uon5QAz_3U5NrQ.text: This was a huge letdown! After seeing the menu and reading the reviews, we had high hopes for this restaurant.  Upon arrival, we were not greeted. We waited for almost ten minutes to be seated while the hostess was wrapping silverware instead of seating customers. When we were finally seated, they took our drink order and we waited for at least 10 minutes before we were allowed to order. We asked someone who walked by if she would take our order and she said "Your waitress will be over soon." So we waited...and waited...  At last, we were able to place our order. We ordered a chicken wrap, a pulled pork sandwich, chicken fried steak, and the California Mac and cheese. With the chicken fried steak, I order Mac and cheese on the side. Which I was assured would be the best Mac and cheese I'd ever eaten...needless to say, it wasn't (but I'll get to that later). Thus began the long process of waiting for our food.   We waited for (no exaggeration) 45 minutes for our food to come. During that 45 minutes our water and tea was only refilled once--when we told the waitress we were ready to walk out. After she assured us it would be 5 more minutes for food, we decided to give it a chance--we were invested at this point.  Then our food came... Firstly, the wrap had onion (which was not something we were told it came with) and the chicken was very cold. Second, the chicken fried steak came with a biscuit--according to the menu--but we had to ask for it to get it. Thirdly, the Mac and cheese I promised I'd tell you about: it was dry, cold, and tasted like it'd been under a heating lamp while the rest of the food was being made.  Let's just say, we will not return!

Nh-ClWOeuQlysRpIOI6znA.text: There was a wait and that's to be expected. 40 minutes. The part that took just as long was to get our food. -1 star. We had 3 kids so after sitting out side waiting and coming in and waiting... Just not fun. -1 more star for very ordinary food all around the table. I do however regret not getting a bacon flight! I just might have to come back and give it another shot. But if your in the mood for an ordinary breakfast joint I say you will be pleased! I did love the Pigs colored by kids posted on the wall! Gave us something to look at! (Also has a decent patio. I love patios ;) )

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced coffee is bottomless! Ask for some vanilla creamer!
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pigs in a blanket!

ALNMzBOUFDMAp0eDeSg6KQ.text: I like the place but can't say it's anything to write home about as a breakfast joint. I will say the Mac n cheese is amazing though. I like that they have different bacon flavors, but for a place that focuses on bacon it seems low quality. I was expecting thick and yummy, just seems skinny and meh.

ZU9VYP_WLHlR-dFAfJj4dA.text: I had the best Eggs Benedict ever!!  Their hollandaise sauce was unbelievable.  Our server, I believe her name was Natalie was fantastic. She put up with the antics of my friend.  Our food came out within minutes of ordering, and it is a great little neighborhood find!  I will be back!

tvQ6sRVT1aDU2F877Zy7dg.text: Their French Toast is Awesome , their bloody marry is Awesome, the California omelette is Great the homefries are actually a bit crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside which is in my opinion perfect. BUT ..... their ham steak is more like a ham strip and the staff could be more informed of the menu and what the ingredients are in each plate and maybe pay more attention when taking the order in the first place. Most of the girls are attentive to other table besides their own which was good in our case or we would've sat with half our meal eaten and empty glasses.  All in all I would love to come back if we happen to be in the are again, but without pork chops on the menu and the ham steak being so thin we may decide on another place for lunch. Thanks to the floor manager for being so attentive when her server wasn't.  I am giving 5 stars because one server and a long wait time shouldn't shame a business that has such an AWESOME COOK , and Staff that does care.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The California omelette is AWESOME

oEX1Ul0B9pUiIsNHl00_JQ.text: It's all about the bacon at The Oink Cafe. You have to try the bacon flight on your first visit, a serving of eight distinctively flavored slices of bacon. It's really the only way to know which bacon you like best. You can then select your favorite with any future breakfast entree. The flight is also fun to share with friends. The only downside is that it essentially adds the cost of another breakfast to your tab.   Oink is very kid friendly, with a "Little Piggies" menu for them to color while you wait. The restaurant actually has a notebook full of completed "Piggie" masterpieces for you to browse through if you like. Or to which your little master can make an addition to it. There's also a small outdoor patio which is dog friendly.   The rest of the menu, outside of bacon, is solid enough. They have a diverse, yet pretty typical, assortment of breakfast offerings. Also burgers and sandwiches for lunch. The star, however, what makes Oink unique, is the bacon.  I understand this is one of just two locations, with the other being in Tucson.

p-2ok2Dwkun79ovW4Lm1fQ.text: I was really excited about eating here as I am crazy for bacon. That being said, I was disappointed with my visit. For a place that markets itself as a premier bacon spot, the bacon is average-at-best. While the bacon flavors offered were good, it was very thin and overcooked to a crisp. I'm okay with crispy bacon but not when you take a bite and it crumbles into small pieces. The hash browns I received were not only cold, they were over cooked with black burn char all over them. Our waitress was super nice but was covering a large section and we had to flag her down in order to get her to come to our table. Great idea, poor execution and we won't be back.

mO2somEaICjf7e96iXhOXA.text: I enjoyed this place very much! Every time I go, it's always busy and there's usually a wait. Sometimes the wait isn't long and some times it is... but i definitely feel like the wait is worth it.  Everything revolves around bacon... I mean who doesn't love bacon right!? I tend to find myself always ordering their Oink French toast. And can I just say, how DELICIOUS AND OMG!!! Their French toast is!?!!! It's coated with this golden brown deliciousness... (I know what it's coated with but I'll have y'all figure that one out...) and it's covered with blueberries and topped with whipped cream. Definitely no syrup needed because it is perfectly sweet all on its own.

Y_Je59LAN5qL0Zkp9pXOgg.text: Delicious.  Especially the "oink". Did not sample all the bacon flavors but did enjoy the one I tried, apple wood.  Wife could not consume all her biscuits and gravy, even with helping her do so.  Yes that was yummy as well.  Thank goodness for "doggy bags" . Wasn't too busy it seemed, but did have to request a re-fill even  when a server passed our table with a pot in her hand. Found it a bit pricey, but what isn't these days.

27yTbGyhAMtaQXkAGqrLNw.text: Well we could hardly wait to try this place that promised all these kinds of bacon and new flavors. Well we went the place was packed we ordered two different plates with two flavors of bacon on them.  Well we could not discern any difference in flavor. In fact both were near flavorless. It appeared the bacon had been in the deep fryer. The eggs were overlooked as well.   All in all passable and we will pass it up.  If you are in a hurry it is ok. But if not head to BoBo's

7xd5hOIRcYLK5jldO-MRcA.text: Food is awesome... Service was really bad and that was disappointing.  We didn't even get our coffee or waters until the food arrived.  I had an omelet and it was great.  My kids love the pigs in a blanket.  Only concern was 10 minutes to be greeted and 20 for our drinks!?!

aDKURlaIMO1xpTFBPRY7zw.text: Eh. Food is bad quality cooked with to much butter or the eggs are just cheap not much taste service is decent staff are friendly and nice but sometimes over talkative when I'm trying to eat my food I've been there more than once I liked it the first time then slowly realized the quality of the food really sucks!

Okx_e8bB5iC5Qr4yNeV41A.text: Awesome place... My wife brought some of their bacon home and it was delicious (recommend the jalapeno bacon). We were seated quickly and our server (Nikol) got our coffees right away. BTW they do carry heavy cream for us fat connoisseurs. I ordered the Oink omelette, a 5-egg bacon sausage filled monster (see pic). Great food, great service. Give them a try if your by PV mall...

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-V9WeL2AA_MkTUqI6JCLkQ.text: One of the best breakfasts in town. Had the pork confit Benedict and it was perfect. The ambiance is bright and the staff friendly. If you are looking for a treat at moderate price, this is a place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The staff are on top of things.

V99fQCyhaHyhAnBfzosZTA.text: I absolutely love bacon so I had the try the different types they offer here. I got the biscuit breakfast sandwich with hash browns and the half flight of bacon with applewood smoked, apple cider, sugar, honey, and hickory. Given that this is a bacon place, you expect it to be a bit of a greasy spoon, but this was way over the top. The hashbrowns were dripping in grease and were a little flat. My biscuit was tasteless unless you count baking powder as a flavour, Pillsbury from a can would be a better option. The bacon was good but inconsistent in how it was cooked - some pieces were overdone and some were under and fatty. I liked all the different flavours but honey and applewood smoked were my favourites. I liked the pig serving plate and that we were given a guide to which pieces were which flavour. The coffee was good, which was a nice surprise, and service was very fast and friendly. Overall, a fun place to try but I couldn't make it my go-to without a bit of improvement from the kitchen.

sVPgA9086OaiuSYpSmLKGQ.text: This is our favorite breakfast place! I love the pork confit benedict is top notch. We have done the flight of bacon more then once and it's always the jalapeno smoked that wins. The service is always lovely!

LLRBl7MmnpYV43eEipFJ-Q.text: Average.  I had the Arizona omelette and it was smothered a little too much, couldn't even taste the omelette.   The potatoes tasted like something you could buy at a hospital cafeteria.  The coffee was hot and decent.   There is nothing special about this place and would rather have home-cooked  and tasty, unique food than a bright atmosphere with a trendy name.

wK8zDBE3qbW9Kg69Us5CCQ.text: We came on a Saturday morning for brunch. The place was packed but we waited only about 20 minutes. We ordered the Mac and Cheese with jalapeno and jalapeno bacon and the 50/50 burger. The Mac and cheese was delicious and perfect for sharing. The burger was amazing and had a great flavor, seemed like something every bacon lover would enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That&#39;s a bacon doughnut in his belly ;)

6DGrVXgfZoH3fw4twIfeIg.text: Flight of Bacon. Bomb! When in Rome...Loved trying different flavors and such a cool presentation! Other menu selections: Mac and Cheese w applewood bacon (normally jalapeno bacon is served in it but somebody does not like spicy...yet. ) I had a few bites thought way too heavy. 50/50 burger w fries. Nothing special there. Dry and flavorless :( I did Pork Confit Benny and it was okay. Kiddo said my pulled pork is way better at home :) but still enjoyed eating it. Home fries were cooked nice and I liked peppers and onions in it. Don't live in the area so doubtful we would make a special trip back here.

8TGoQsAu02K57_YkiOTmrQ.text: After passing this place numerous times, I finally had a chance to visit for brunch. It's a basic breakfast cafe. Nothing too fancy but not divey either. A perfect place to meet friends for a quiet lunch or breakfast. It's also very child friendly. I had the california chicken sandwich and it was very good! It was a nice sized chicken breast , with bacon, cheese, and green chile. I've never had green chile on a chicken sandwich and it was sooo good!  I couldn't eat it fast enough. I ordered my son the chicken fingers which were the right amount of chicken and breading. My companions both had french toast and were very happy. The service was prompt and friendly. Overall a fun experience that I will definitely try out again.

uhQFe7SAJKV9fiVqKihQKw.text: We had the Bacon Flight which was an awesome start. Then I had the Oink loaded French toast which was fantastic. Attentive service and not too long a wait to be seated today. Looking forward to my next visit already with a full and happy belly.

ZTEzRJxVahyTP9xKYsMHcA.text: Bacon flight and bacon crusted donuts were incredible.  Service was fast and friendly!!  A must visit. Especially if you like bacon. Who doesn't??

_Z68RGOHkIJEF44kkQmgyA.text: First time here...love their motto..."Breakfast, Lunch and Bacon". Visited with my boyfriend and his 2 children. Enjoyed the food a lot. Had breakfast of an omlette filled with spinich, red and green bell peppers and turkey sausage. It was quite yummy.  Also tried their maple glazed bacon doughnut....talk about sinful! It was so wonderful. They had run out, but had made more just for us. That was worth the wait.  Service was pretty good with just a few mess  ups....but when I asked for a special order it was granted without fuss. Overall it was a good experience and I will go again.

aC5Rl61lFdh6veYnynq_lQ.text: An absolute favorite for breakfast. Where else can you try a bacon flight with 8 different varieties made in-house and served on a pig-shaped platter? The BLT is outstanding. And don't forget the bacon donut to finish off the meal. Oink is a can't-miss if you want a unique breakfast experience...and lots of bacon!

_Fx87jP9Xyjv4-jxRC072Q.text: Love it, the food is always good, takes a bit of time but that's normal, definitely worth the wait and the different bacon they have is great. Very artistic and different! The bacon donuts are authentic, bacon bites are definitely better! The jalapeno bacon is my favorite and goes with most anything!

VheDTZXa8vZvFmt6yWhiug.text: It was super busy when we got there, but we were seated quickly and the service was pretty good. Granted, we went on a Sunday morning, so I shouldn't have been surprised at how busy it was. The food was great and the poinsettia (drink) was awesome. Overall, it was a good experience and I would definitely go back there in the future.

2q-v53wa34KbqIok7MICyg.text: I actually ended up here because it's right next to a Subway so I thought I'd give it a try. Plus I make an effort supporting small business. We've actually been there about 3 times.  Atmosphere wise, I really enjoy going there in the morning with my kids. The large windows let in a lot of light.   Service wise, never had an issue.  Food wise, it's alright. I'm not going to complain because it's not bad at all. I seem to always lean toward the Country Fried Steak and it's great. Their bacon? Not worth the extra cost.

Z0FkEFvY7ww4of4vyK-M_g.text: I've eaten breakfast at Oink several times and had a great meal and comfortable experience every time.  I love eggs benedict and their menu contains several versions of it. The maple-bacon donut is fantastic, too, but this place obviously isn't much for vege choices. Other than that, I like this restaurant for the diversity of customers it attracts from the local area. I think my only complaint is that each dish on their menu seems overpriced by a dollar or two, considering the average sized portions they serve. Overall this is a casual, top-notch place for breakfast but a little pricey compared to, say, the I-HOP right across the street.

mdtA0t6m18Uzjt0J356xAQ.text: My favorite local huevos rancheros! My family likes the chicken fried steak. Coffee is excellent. Get there before 9am on weekend or you'll wait 45 minutes.

VkryOgetKuShdD53RPTMIQ.text: Who doesn't like bacon? Been coming here for almost two years now and it's fairly consistent. The bacon is ok, but nothing that has me doing backflips. Service is usually very good, as we've learned to request Autumn if she's working. The restaurant is very clean and the food is good during off-peak times. When it's busy, forget it... break out the dice, because it's hit and miss when it comes to quality. Neat niche though.

3JAoAS6L5puZPqjlcqzf1Q.text: Extremely rude host staff.  Very surprised at the way I was spoken to.  Food was average,  not a place I would visit again.

q3GfTNGNzoxHZNeFtmVTIg.text: There aren't a ton of non-chain breakfast places in that area, so this fits the bill if you're looking for a standard breakfast/brunch. The restaurant is a lot larger than it appears from the outside, and there entrance is actually on the backside of the building. The bacon flight wasn't as awesome as we were hoping for, but overall, a decent option if you're in the neighborhood and sick of Chompie's.

Upg9bs9OZatqDdDF_UjIig.text: Delicious! Long wait but was worth it.We grabbed drinks & bacon doughnut holes from the coffee bar while waiting. Love their vanilla lattes, amazing omelets, and you have not lived until you've had a flight of bacon.

B0UaN2OCwVt0Njg92IJGGA.text: Had a wonderful breakfast today.  Pecan wood smoked bacon, eggs and a biscuit.  Next time I want to try the bacon sampler platter.  I must have seen 10 of them go out today while e were there.

ck83DCmG4_58ykNgSACL6A.text: I always loved going into the oink. Your food is amazing! But the service was horrible. Kristen was rude, took forever to ring in our food, and bring us our tab. I then waited 15 mins to get my card back. I do not think i would come back into the oink.

jq0JIIjMfBGXuB7tSNEfMg.text: This place is a decent breakfast joint, but the only thing that really makes it stand out are the bacon flights, as the rest of the menu covers the basics you can find just about anywhere else. With that said the apple cider bacon is soooooo so good!  My visit was a combination of decent food and spotty service which amounted to quite the average meal. My dad and I came in for lunch during the week and waited a few minutes to be seated, which is no big deal. However once we were seated we waited, and waited, and waited until my dad finally got a servers attention and asked if we could place our order. I think there was some confusion around who was supposed to take our table, but the waitress helped us. She was nice but definitely a little busy with all of her tables. We asked for two waters, and only got one, then asked for the second and still had to flag someone else down to finally get it. After our food arrived it took awhile to get our bill too. Again, it just seemed like maybe a lack of clear coordination among the entire floor as our waitress was nice herself.   For the food, I got the California omelette with a side of fruit and toast and my dad got a bacon flight and eggs. The omelette was a good size and filling, but there wasn't really anything that stood out about my meal. The bacon flight was of course cool and my dad enjoyed the selection but that was about the only highlight of the meal.   Again, you can get a filling breakfast and try out some different kinds of bacon, but unfortunately overall nothing about this place is really calling me back.

DQ6YAfY9tHJ2gqv3H-MGWQ.text: Decided to stop by for lunch today. Not many people inside but thought to give a try. Friendly service. Ordered half turkey sandwich and salad. The salad with balsamic vinegar was terrible. Huge croutons that were hard as a rock and tasted weird. The dressing was very sour tasting. The half turkey sandwich hardly had any turkey and came with tomato slices and limp lettuce. There was a little slimy green thing on the turkey as I began to investigate the sandwich. The server was ok and apologized. We left a tip and were on our way.

ZOMqZIRDlb6rRx0YVJe8og.text: Love love loved everything about this super-cute establishment.  My Bloody Mary was to die for and the sweet sticky bacon in it was yummy.  My eggs Benedict were the best I  have had in a long time.  Please do yourself a favor and go have " breakfast lunch or bacon" here!  It doesn't get much better than this.  Oh and the caramel mocha Frappuccino that I took to go was the cherry on top of this cake!!!!! Thank you to our sweet server and all the friendly faces who work there! A Delicious experience

0n7-yQULoYWmSpPwdVJh5Q.text: I didn't expect to be wowed, and I was wrong. It's incredible. There is a chorizo-queso sauce that might be one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten, poured on eggs, etc. Life changing. Bacon flights are unreal, and whether you're getting savory or sweet breakfast options, you cannot go wrong. Don't be fooled by the shopping center location, this place is worth a trip and you will not regret it.

EBt2oKaWEPd4OhYzDH5JHA.text: I had high hopes for this place! Bacon makes everything better, right? Food was pretty good. I had the chicken sandwich. We did the flight of bacon as an "app."  I was assuming a flight of bacon would be those thick sliced pieces but they weren't.... such a bummer.

DCzWAxNI7fBxnUCrcvy29A.text: The Oink Cafe offers delicious food at very reasonable prices. My friend and I split an eggs benefit, 1/2 flight of bacon, and waffles for $30-$35. I love that they had so much variety with the bacon. Doing 1/2 a flight, I tasted 4 different kinds of bacon with my favorite being the jalapeno bacon. The waiters/waitresses had great attitudes and helped me pick the items off the menu.   The food was amazing as well. The eggs benedict had the perfect poached egg on top with a side of hash browns/potatoes. The waffle was very fluffy and a good amount of sweet. The strawberries on top were very fresh as well. 10/10 would come back

nWvpMI2Vj79bPyBBKBF4Gw.text: very very average, and for the price it's a no-go for me. I'm glad we called ahead to reserve a table, because it was packed on memorial day. Because of this, we had to be seated outside, which I usually am not a fan of this time of year, but the area was nicely shaded and it was around 10:30am when we stopped by. $12 for a below par burger that left me disappointed is why I'm not likely to stop by again. It was edible, but a little dry and the bun they served it on was on the dry side too. The menu claimed that they were 1/2 pound but I highly doubt that; it was closer to 1/3 lb. I was hoping the french fries would save the day, but again they were lacking in flavor (and salt). Sorry to say, I had more fun feeding them to Ilean (the bird with one leg that hangs around the patio). My sister ordered the pulled pork sandwich and halfway through she tossed out the bottom bun as it was soaked in oil. We hadn't checked any reviews before stopping by because she had chosen; she said their breakfast menu is better, but based on today, I might just pass...

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $12 burger w/ fries; didn&#39;t taste like much :/

rOAM5NsS1Jnyk_XB-wrsPg.text: Great Service but Really Mediocre Food  We had lunch with the family this morning and we had high hopes for this unique restaurant. M ordered the yogurt parfait, A ordered the breakfast sandwich, D ordered the french toast sandwich and I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries and coleslaw.  While the others entrees were fine, mine was a major disappointment.  The pulled pork was clearly reheated to the point that it was charred AND extra dry.  In addition, the sweet potato fries were way overcooked.  It's a sad commentary when the coleslaw was the best thing on my plate.  This disappointment cost me $11.95 plus tax and tip.  If you are going to have your restaurant specialize in pork, you would think the pulled pork would be superlative.  I could not finish the plate.  While our server was first class, good service just doesn't overcome lousy, overcooked food.  It's unlikely we would return despite the fact our daughter lives within walking distance of the restaurant.

i-3KKntpAwA88viTFDXUGA.text: The Boy and I decided to try The Oink after another breakfast place was closed for the holiday and had a Meh experience.  The food was very good.  I enjoyed my Two Egg Plus combo, it was a large amount of food if you find yourself hungry.  I chose scrambled eggs and they were fluffy and buttery.  I chose a biscuit option instead of toast and it was HUGE.  If you are a biscuit and gravy fan, I would suggest going ala cart from the sides menu (one biscuit vs two) as one biscuit split in half would fill and entire plate.    The boy had Huevos Rancheros and was very happy.  He especially liked the ranchero sauce, I had a taste and likened it more to a mole, super dark yet sweet with a hint of heat.  I also tried their classic bloody mary which had more heat than spice.    Where our experience was lacking was the service.  Our server did not check on us once after we got our food and we had to flag her down to get to go box after she dropped the check and left while I was asking for a box.  My two egg plus combo came with choice of bacon but my server didn't ask what kind I wanted and I forgot it was an option. Seems like this would be front and center for a server since the 8 kinds of bacon are listed all over the menu and walls.  We also weren't given straws for our drinks (including the bloody mary) while all other tables had them in all their drinks. Our drinks were never refilled and one attempt was made to refill my coffee five minutes after I got it.   The hostess and busser staff needs some training.  During our 20 min wait at any given time, there were 4 or 5 tables empty waiting to be seated or waiting to be cleared.  There was a wait-list of 8 parties waiting to be seated during that time with open tables so revenue was being missed with that many open tables.  I also saw hostesses walk by tables full of dirty dishes and not touch a single dish.   I do want to give props to the patrons.  A gentleman was going to eat breakfast alone and was waiting for a table when a table of two asked if he wanted to join them instead of waiting and dining alone.  Awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Giant celery stalk in my bloody, silverware for size

3YKq6AkBzk7iBeDVhoer7g.text: Great Breakfast!! the Eggs Benedict with shredded pork was amazing oh and the biscuits were like grandmas homemade biscuits flaky and not dry. Little bit of a wait to be seated but definitely worth the wait.

oyEEtQnD2YDXr6HMUaFBSg.text: I ordered the Arizona Omelet with a side of house fries which was absolutely delicious! The plate was executed beautifully.  My waitress, Taylor, was friendly, attentive, and patient. She suggested I try the hazelnut latte, which was also very good while making sure my water was full at all times.   I will definitely be coming back!

KHF0Ze10OlSEWXvxTwlorg.text: My girl friend was talking about going here. So we decided to make it a choice after a 5K marathon.  Hungry and tired we decided to stop my Oink.... they bragged about having 8 different types of bacon.   So let's see....  As we walked in  there was a cute waitress who made  sure to tell us there is a 20 mins wait....  not bad on a brunch Sunday!   We finally got seated and I grabbed the menu.  Let's see... I need a cup of coffee first....  now let's order.    I decided to get the classic home fries, eggs and their famous peppered bacon. Of course I ordered the butter milk biscuit.  The price was great.... that plate was $7.99. Perfect price if you have a large family.   I turned to see the waitress heading towards me with a tray full of goodness. As she placed the plate in front of me. I was completely DISAPPOINTED the bacon was so thin and  wilted.  I imagined thick slices of pepper dipped bacon....   SORRY.... I received the saddest looking bacon in all of bacon land. Let's not start on the home fries which were hard and burnt.   I moved all of my food around to make it look like I ate something.  I was so hungry I just had to eat it.  As tears were welling up in my eyes.  I began to eat the worse breakfast I have had in about a year.  Look advertising bacon should mean I'm in bacon heaven not BACON HELL....   I wouldn't return for there breakfast maybe their sandwiches are better but I don't think I would try that either.    Walking down disappointed lane!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect price for a big family!

by5HgirqxItha4fBs1tkXw.text: The wait was very long due to the fact they have one person cleaning tables by himself. The atmosphere is just a normal breakfast joint.We finally sat and it was 10 minutes before being approached by our server. She took our orders. We waited 20 minutes or longer for our food. Mine came out and it was wrong I only wanted regular French toast and she had brought me one with a bunch of berries and other stuff. I also got a strip of the pecan wood bacon that is the chefs choice it was cold and tastes like regular bacon. Our meals were not that good. My boyfriend said his waffle tasted different. And now he has food poisoning and is being a crybaby so thank you oink for making me deal with him like this. I will not be coming back.

CEwOQpwC-HlUwVyd3-62Zg.text: We came specifically for the lattes and bacon because I love bacon and hubby loves lattes. We go there on a weekday morning and surprisingly, they were pretty busy. We were told to seat ourselves and so once we did, it took some time to be greeted  by our server.   I ordered a hot hazelnut latte and hubby ordered an iced vanilla latte. The server dropped off two hot lattes and so I told him one was iced. The hazelnut latte was okay but the vanilla latte was pretty good. We decided to share the Paradise Valley omelet (spinach, mushrooms, bacon and cheddar cheese). The omelet came with hash browns and wheat toast. Then, we ordered 1/2 bacon flight: apple cider, applewood smoked, jalapeno and hickory.   Between the both of us, the omelet entree portion was generous and we couldn't even finish. The omelet was really good- big slices of mushrooms and lots of cheese! I think the whole bacon flight thing is a little overrated. The jalapeno bacon and applewood smoked was good, but $4.99 for four slices and they weren't even crunchy?! Maybe they should add the bacon to an entree or something instead and then you choose which ones you want.   Our server was pretty slow in getting us our check and checking us out, but our bill was inexpensive and we really enjoyed our meal and lattes.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My hazelnut latte
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paradise Valley omelet with hash browns and wheat toast, 1/2 bacon flight

cUH6phhwZg2-_I-t1twaBQ.text: Omg. Bacon. Is there a better word in the English language? No. No there is not. The bacon at The Oink Cafe is heavenly. If you're in to sampling, get the bacon flight, 8 different flavors of bacon to tickle your taste buds. My personal favorite is the apple cider closely followed by the sugar cured. I drive 30 min quite frequently for one menu item though...the California Macaroni and Cheese. Green chilis, chicken and the creamiest macaroni and cheese with a delicious blend of cheeses. Try it, you won't be sorry.

goh8mvITDpURUqq7Bs8AKA.text: Nice neighborhood vibe. They have Bacon Flights and Beer Flights. The hamburger will rival any popular burger joint! Staff is nice and friendly! They should include spoons in their place settings. Good for kids with a wall of fame coloring contest. Nice bathrooms. They have Bloody Mary's. Patio seating. You can walk 1minute to Target if you need to run errands.

d0XreHqaNdtqj-x7c9Z1UA.text: Two words: Bacon.Flight.  The food is spectacular, drinks are delicious, and service is absolutely amazing

xa7lZFtGVPBtb5BEkb_w0A.text: This I place is really cute and has the nicest staff!  The food here is delicious, especially the pancakes or French toast. Service is quick, friendly and professional and prices are decent. I highly recommend this place!

N1gAAkL70pl7UcUdho01nw.text: I had an amazing brunch with a friend from out of town here. We had the Bloody Mary flight and the bacon flight. It was Delicious, and fun. This place is clean and the food comes out fast. Also the food and drinks are amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone the wants breakfast or brunch. Bacon for days here. The jalapeno bacon is
