A0Nm_S3cWjvv91oHkGESjw.text: This used to be a wonderful place to go. Food is still good but the service is now just plain bad. Be ready to  order and try not to ask questions.  They are way too rushed. But there was no wait on a Sunday late morning. Don't ask for extra syrup.

rh6WdYJyrO1fCW93unphlA.text: Wasn't very impressed with the pancake combo bacon was normal, pancakes bland, eggs were like I went to a buffet and had been sitting out for a while. Overall I'd say if you don't have taste buds or your a horrible cook at home then you should go here if you actually like what your eating and appreciate quality food don't bother. I think there's an ihop across the street that could do a much better job than these folks

fjdlipgv2H29nsgKYj0QeQ.text: Brunch...not much can go wrong at a place called Oink.  Standard food, it was good and as expected.  I did quite enjoy their fruit compote as an alternative to syrup. Portions on what my family ordered were huge.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oink french toast with strawberry/blueberry sauce.

qqzoADNEvgpFBYIBKq1pWw.text: Good breakfast items but the bacon is clearly the star in this place.  I love jalapeno bacon and this place does it up right.  The flight of bacon is a great idea.  Maple and bacon donuts?  Heck yeah.

sL9YCciNy7LCYNGPWUzV0g.text: Died. and. gone. to. heaven.  Bacon sampler, sublime. The only way this place could possibly be better is if you could buy their bacon by the pound and bring it home to cook. Because I would live on a steady diet of their honey bacon.   They have a lot of other delicious food, too. But I don't care. Because flights of bacon. OMG.

7BvzCAT1jjeGOIINrvgybg.text: Finally tried this place and overall enjoyed the experience. We went on a Sunday morning and it was busy. Good sign and even better, it didn't effect our brunch.  Our party of  6 was seated almost immediately. We had two young kids so it was great that we were.  Our server was helpful despite the rush and our food arrived   quickly.   Now the menu lived up to its namesake. Bacon was omnipresent! Bacon scones, bacon pancakes, a bacon sampler to name a few. The bacon items were great yet outside of them the rest of the food was rather ordinary, typical breakfast fare.  It was good yet nothing different if it wasn't bacon centered.  All in all good time and would come back to enjoy the bacon goodies. Maybe the rest of the menu will catch up with its star.

8s16i9y0W2TgrvFCVC4E2w.text: If I could I wouldn't even give them one star. Waitress came out took our order. I ordered bacon and eggs and a bacon donut. My girlfriend ordered the paradise valley omelet. Our order was brought out by another waitress, I informed that waitress that I had also ordered the bacon donut and she just looked at me. For twenty minutes I repeatedly tried to flag down our waitress. To sum it up I finally got my donut when I asked for it as she brought the check.  So my bacon on the meal was barely cooked and the toast was burnt, no butter on the toast at all. I won't be returning to this place. If you have a chance,  pass. I'm sure the IHOP across the street would be a lot better.

8rv5PRaeXmY4vF215Fmb9Q.text: I love oink cafe!! I've been there many times and always had amazing service and great servers. I have also suggested this breakfast place to several of my friends who love it also. The service is always very quick and the food amazing this is my weekend breakfast place for sure!

iUe0YCidKNeE2wUPgu8tUg.text: The food was really good and decently priced..... All the way up until 2 sides of gravy like 1/3 cup each and 1/4 cup hollindaise sauce costed over 10$ alone. Didn't tip much due to that over priced surprise. Was nice for a 1 time thing. But prolly won't come back.

D5hi3xRtkxWDNpFFnIG7NQ.text: I just recently checked this place out and I fell in love with their applewood bacon and the chorizo scrambled eggs! The service was fabulous!!! My new favorite breakfast place! ;)

G0MFcbt2M_eu1btuRjuL9Q.text: Based on the name and outside advertisements, you'd assume that this was some sort of pork style specialty house. Once inside you'd assume that it would smell like pork. You'd assume there would be pictures of swine everywhere. And you'd assume that not only will the menu be pork heavy, but that also the server would promote and encourage pork. So imagine my surprise when none of these things were True.  It wasn't a big deal though that it seems they were trying real hard to be a classy restaurant. But its an oink cafe. That means pig coffee to me. I want Bacon and an espresso. It should smell like Bacon and coffee. Or Bacon or coffee. It was more of a chemical smell.   The layout was odd too. There were apparently two entrances. What I thought was the front which is located street side might have been the back because when you walk in, its a weird long hallway type room filled with tables. (BTW it was packed) The other side had what looked like a main counter with a menu but we never got that far because this was a be seated by server place.  Decorations were odd too. There were SOME artsy pictures of swine. But mostly random pictures of art. I love art but it didn't fit.   Our server must have been a rookie. Not very attentive. She kind of just threw the crayons in front of my daughter. She didn't explain the menu at all. It took her forever to bring our drinks. And I even tried to break the ice by asking the standard "what would you get?" question. Her response, "I'm not really sure. I think everything's good."  Ok when I hear that I get annoyed. Humuor me at least. Also know you product and services. And if your going to promote a "classy" resturant, then don't wear short shorts. Nothing made sense. On to the menu:  Basically the menu is basic items like sanwhiches and salads that have one or two Bacon strips. Ok. Well I got the salad. And to my surprise it was pretty good.  It was a fresh spinach salad with an assortment of seeds and fruit and Bacon bits. Also they had a custom dressing called Bacon dressing. Now it tasted nothing like Bacon. It was more of a sweet vinagerette of sort. It was good. The salad though was amazing. it wasn't over filled with everything. It was mostly spinach. And again very fresh.   Salad was good enough to give a three star. Also it wasn't a bad experience, just dissapointing. And the only reason I factor in the poor server is because the owner himself was walking around greeting people and when he got to us, he wasn't really engaged or genuine. So perhaps a lack of customer service training could be the reason for our poor service.   If your in the area and you want a salad for lunch, I'd recommend them.

NmnvK4Pd4vjmK4GtWg3EsQ.text: I liked the atmosphere but the food was very average. I got the donut for dessert but it was really dry, and more like a coffee cake.

0XefW97WLFXXb-auMwC2Fw.text: Love the bacon varieties; jalapeno is my favorite! Waffles are wonderful. House potatoes are grand. Service is prompt, polite and servers don't interrupt your conversation to ask if you need anything else!

WkxWKT-jfQd5tnAhdkKP-A.text: Love this place!! I recommend the Oink Bloody Mary if you like bacon in your Bloody Mary. However, the Oink omelette is a pork overload that any pork lover can handle.  One of my favorite places to eat breakfast since moving to Phoenix, Az.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oink Bloody Marry!!
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Try the Bacon!!

cugN1ZftaES_bMjccgAZ5A.text: Amazing French toast. It's seriously the best French toast I've ever had. I don't even care about anything else. The service was good. The French toast was great. My friend had the pork Benedict. She loved it.

5teqx5iBt7JDYZQwjjj1bQ.text: Their devotion to the pork isn't quite what I anticipated, but The Oink Cafe has some pretty solid breakfast food. A group of us went here because my friend CJ said he thought of me every time he passed this restaurant on his way home from work. [For whatever reason, I've become synonymous with pigs and their meat. Go figure.]  I ordered the pancakes with a side of bacon. Both were really good. As a goof, I showed our server my bacon armband tattoo and she immediately brought the owner over to see it. She took a picture of it and our group, then ordered a flight of bacon for us, on the house. I especially like the jalapeno bacon. But, let's face it. Bacon is like sex: even if you don't think you want it, it's still good; you can almost certainly make time for it; and it's best when enjoyed in the company of friends.

jGxCHjWp7jvh4-a3WezIcA.text: Wow & Yummers......cute little place out by Paradise Valley Mall stumble across when I was visiting a Target over that way. Stopped in with my daughter we need to order breakfast obviously but we also ordered a sampler of the bacon can I say wow wow wow. I would most definitely recommend this place to anybody the service was great. We even took a sampler platter back home for my two sons to try and can I just say it was devoured really quick. and it's not your thin sliced bacon it's thick it's Hardy and its meaty not fatty.

Mhf35ai-8V9UJHJB9O2CfA.text: Friendly, attentive staff. Above average food. Consistent experience. These are the kinds of places we need. I've been here 10 times and look forward to coming here again.

dvlpY0S0aof9DtawsoI4-g.text: The food here is good, but the service has been great every time I've eaten here.  I'm not as big on their bacon, but they make great eggs and French toast :)  When looking for a nice place to meet a friend for breakfast or lunch, I've always enjoyed this cafe (and even though the patio outside is small, it's always good to be able to eat outside and enjoy the weather on a nice day).

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cinnamon roll was large enough to share with four people while waiting for breakfast :)

Rop-GiXztNKH0xeaL1NlZg.text: Don't judge this place from the outside, it is really bigger than you think. They do not take reservations for party's less than 5. On the weekends it gets pretty busy so be prepared to wait if there is just 2.  This is our 2nd time here and even though we had to wait it was not too bad. You can get your coffee or other drink while you wait but I highly recommend getting a maple bacon covered donut or donut bite. Makes any amount of waiting seem worth it!!  On this visit we ordered the Pork Confit Omelette and AZ omelette. Both had their ranchero sauce on top of the omelets but it was best on the AZ.    The atmosphere is busy but still enjoyable and they have a great outdoor eating area. We will be back as the location to stores makes it easy for us to stop & grab a bite!

squZmGWZmO3K3kn6dJctkA.text: We have since been back a couple more times.  They've got it together now. Solid breakfast spot...  Good service, good food, good prices.

u1eoWTojZd6tOOdvX4IIWg.text: Had the bacon tray, who knew there were 8 different types of bacon.  I made a pig out of myself.   I just pigged out.

zULCr1-jZ_Fv0CjpZkebfw.text: I'm really not the type to want to go out for breakfast, I'd rather save my dining money for lunch or dinner because I figure I can usually make just as good of a breakfast at home.  However, there is no way I could match their french toast, it is just outstanding.  We have been twice and I ordered that both times.  The first time, I told the waitress to put the berry sauce on the side because I usually don't like fruit toppings, they are too sweet and fake tasting.   But this sauce is delicious! It is homemade and very natural tasting, I ate every bit of it.  We also loved the jalepeno bacon.  My kids loved the pigs in a blanket.  We had very nice service both times, we will definitely be back!

Y-BKx3dmoOlmErXbm_s_Dg.text: Went on a sun morning. Short wait before being seated. Fun atmosphere and theme. Expected more bacon or pork themed items. Ordered chicken fried steak based on another review here. Very good, Highly recommend! Finished with a maple/bacon doughnut, pretty good. Will return

I0EPy90gRlT_2IeuuvM9gg.text: Maybe a busy Saturday morning is not The Oink Cafe at its best...but then it should be at its best on a busy Saturday. Yes, they have 8 varieties of bacon. Mine was no bigger or better than the bacon I had earlier in the week at Wendy's. The potatoes were dry and tasted like frozen from the bag. Coffee was good. One of my guests ordered a Bloody Mary--I couldn't help but notice that she only drank half, too polite to say anything negative. Waitress was friendly.

gnVgdeoZWCnMKICvNc0_DQ.text: The caramel bacon glazed donut was awesome!

K9plghLijHfUmi8bYsQDXQ.text: Yum! I have been here a few times now and I have not been disappointed. The specialty coffees are great. I had a latte and it came out piping hot. I've had an omelet and the eggs Benedict and both were very good. Last time I was here I saw someone with an awesome looking Bloody Mary that had strips of bacon garnish which I will definitely try next time.

oqXTEa4kIs095U53eLbUHw.text: All the people who've complained are just snobby cry babies who were more than likely that kid who screamed in the parking lot at their parents for the $300 pink pony to match his/her purple, orange, yellow, green, and blue ones that already reside in their bedroom windowsill.  Service? Seen way worse..Food? I'm the biggest skeptic when it comes to getting your money's worth and tend to complian like the pony girl/guy. Nitpick at everything. Ok hypocrisy, yes. Be that as it may, I still have to admit that their bacon cheese burger has to be by far the best I have had in a long long time.  Keep it up guys. Wish you had dinner hours. Let's get rid of Denny's and IHOP crap.  P.S. They do have alcohol

f4HkVLkPP1NKbUQwgzPfbw.text: This is my favorite breakfast joint - we live 10 miles away but this is always where we go.  Oink Cafe French Toast is my favorite.  They also have a plate of 8 kinds of bacon which my husband loves.  I have not had anything here that I have not liked, I do want to try more items but always crave the French toast when I walk in, the sweet potato fries are also great - sometimes I get a side with my French Toast.  They are only open for breakfast and lunch which is a downside for me as I would have no problem going more than once in a day.  The hostess on the weekend, a young girl is pretty slow but the food is beyond worth it.  I have recommended this place to everyone I know.

4Q4jUqbWB5OTcR-jhFjQMA.text: I seriously love this place.  The only thing that stinks is the french dip is off the menu.  But today I ordered a bbq sandwich.  BBQ sandwiches are tricky, you seriously have to get every bit right, juicy but not so much that my bread is like mush, pork with a strong enough flavor I can taste it through the sauce, and bread I can chew!  Well, they nailed it.  They also put the cole slaw on the side for me since I'm weirded out by cole slaw on a sandwich.  Oh, and I have mentioned the sweet potato fries....oh ya! They don't salt them so you will have to do so but that's ok because I can go either way with these tasty morsels :)  Did I say that I got all this while walking in 10 minutes before they closed and they were so sweet to me and didn't complain, at least while I was in earshot....thanks guys!

JSOURcR5RQ2E-uqb4XUWsg.text: Took 3 kids for breakfast, 2 boys had pigs in a blanket. Pancakes fine but sausage was soaked in grease. Nice location, Nice servers, not impressed with food. Only open for breakfast and lunch.

5K1-jEdrDpWyFoxi9HBxxg.text: Went here on a business lunch meeting. And it was perfect atmosphere; quiet and large tables to able us to review work. But besides that.....I can not say enough about their Macaroni & Cheese with jalapenos and jalapeno bacon! Yes, that is right JALAPENO BACON!! OMG!! This is the bomb!  I am definitely coming back for breakfast during the weekend. I spyed some killer looking drinks like the Bacon Bloody Mary!  So YUMMY!!!!

ypuaIoC1nWBcFTqeOKsTiQ.text: Food here is fantastic, service needs a lot of help.  From the hostess who doesn't have control to servers who aren't managing their tables.  That said, if you are looking for good food and have an hour or so for breakfast or lunch, this is a don't miss in the east valley.  The bonus is patio seating.  Just bring your patience.

62B-DZWjLL6qADUBJPgdLA.text: Horrible service.  We had waited 45 minutes and still didn't have our food. The table next to us came in 20 minutes after us, ate their food, and left.  At one point the server brought us our drinks and said "let me go put down my tray and I will come right back to take your order".  It took her 15 minutes to put down her tray.  She also said "sorry your food isn't up yet, we had a large table ahead of yours", she was saying this as another table next to us, who had ordered after us was receiving their food.  I am sure she took our order and had to "put down her tray" before she sent the order to the kitchen.  We left without eating.

n1iRT2yACe-SBK22CJJyZQ.text: My Fiancee and I love trying new local places for breakfast/brunch every weekend, it's become some what of a ritual for us and something I look forward to during the week. We love supporting local businesses so we were excited to give Oink a shot.  When we arrived at Oink, the Hostess seemed to be a bit flustered and didn't initially greet us and check us in... This was not a bad sign to me, just a new business still trying to work out the qinks.  Once we were seated, the menu looked great. I decided to go for my breakfast favorite, Eggs Benedict (listed as a 'specialty item' on their menu). My Fiancee ordered the French toast and we also ordered a side of bisquits & gravy and sausage. What a DISPAPPOINTMENT! You would think with a name like 'Oink' you would be getting the best breakfast meats one could imagine, this was not the case. The ham on my Eggs Benedict was as thin as a piece of pepporoni (no joke!), our side of breakfast links looked like they were microwaved and tasted like it too. The Eggs Benedict was by far the most disgusting dish I think I have ever ordered, when it first came out, the eggs were clearly over done- more like hard boiled then poached.  However, what made the dish disgusting was the 'hollandaise sauce', it was not hollandaise sauce. It was the color of milk and had the constinancy of half and half and there was so much on my plate that it became Eggs Benedict cereal, literally. The english muffins were soaking in this thin liquid that gave off the smell of yogurt, eww. Even though it looked appalling, I decided to try it. Just to give you an idea, I had to plug my nose in order to chew and swallow it! It was AWFUL. My Fiancee's french toast was good and so was the coffee but thats it. The bisquits and gravy weren't anything special and I was only happy we ordered it because of how completely inedible the Eggs Benedict were. Long story short, if Oink plans on succeeding, they need Gordon Ramsey to come in and help them out. Sorry Oink, I really did want to love you :(  I will NOT be visiting again.

aJjNfvw9BP_Ry6QqS0wPsw.text: We've been wanting to try The Oink for a while now.  We meet some friends there for breakfast.  We were all disappointed. Service was terrible, we had to ask for coffee several times, the coffee had no taste. One person ordered a waffle and when it was served it was so cold the butter wouldn't even melt, we had to send it back. The food took a long time to be served. The waitress was polite but looked unkept about her appearance.  I don't think a person waiting on you should be wearing a sweatshirt.  What happened to looking good at your job no matter what it is.  It would be nice having a person serving your food to look presentable. All five of us decided we will not be returning to this restaurant.

7d38yW2fiona4_GkYGOQAg.text: Food is pretty decent.  I am with all of the other reviewers on the service aspect of this place.  It is SO unorganized here.  The people aren't mean to the customers but it's insane how chaotic it is at such a small establishment.  The old lady is weird and creepy.   There is a strange hostess table in the center of the restaurant that none of the signs tell you to go to.   I see a bunch of staff talking to each other and arguing. They all look so confused its sad.   I wish the restaurant impossible guy would come here and tell these people how to run a restaurant.   Again the food was tasty but the basic functionality customers expect restaurants to have is not there.   I hope they get help because it would be nice to see this place survive.

L2a0AzUfG1YJW8H_yVRgeQ.text: The service was great and the ambience was good.  We didnt feel rushed and enjoyed our long breakfast/lunch.  The people were so nice not to rush us out, it wasn't until I noticed the open sign facing our way did we think to ask them what time they close.  Apparenlty, it was an hour past the point I noticed.  They let us hang out, even gave us a free brownie and chocolate chip cookie which was to live for!.  The owners are very nice.  I ordered half a club sandwich and tortilla soup with sweet potato fries.  The sandwich much bigger than my bite could handle but delish! My boyfriend had a huge breakfast burrito.  The portions are massive!!!! The only thing is that we were expecting more pork options..at least pork chop or pulled pork items on the menu. But, it is definitely a place we will go back to.

8xsR49KvE9RvEg2NJfGGSQ.text: Good food.  Great service. The chicken strawberry salad is my favorite.

73YiZ5wS_Mb5iPxVn1PN4w.text: Been here a couple times, Food has never been great just good breakfast dining. I do feel that it has dropped a little in quality management as my hash browns were over cooked and the bacon was a little soggy.  Service was fast and friendly and responsive to questions.

DZyQk7i96P13_oX5_oh-Pw.text: Loved this place so much.  I was there with my husband, 4 year old and three 8 yr old girls. We were there on a friday afternoon and had no wait. I ordered the special french toast ( guess what its crusted in). It was so good, everyone tried a piece and I still had leftovers. The portion sizes are huge! (a good thing). My husband got the Huevos rancheros and they were spicy and greasy just the way they should be. I can't wait to go back and try the bacon pancakes!! Oh and my favorite was the cute menu with tiny pink pigs showing what has bacon in it.

R-HqNZ8nzr8jZYHUDEV3kA.text: So unimpressed by this place and the menu. Considering the name I was expecting a great breakfast pork selection. Not so much. Pork chop I got was tough. My brother had pork sausage links I swear are the same frozen ones the lame breakfast chains use.   I won't be back. I would  give 2.5 stars if I could because our service was excellent on a very busy Saturday morning.

COgBL49PdrIXyQegJIhGdA.text: We live in Colorado but visit Oink every trip to Phoenix!!!! Their bacon (all flavors) is the bomb!

nPc2qbf2EhHE4NoidHFq6g.text: On Sundays, get here early. Food is good. Staff is very nice and friendly.

A8Nsmzbad9oLlGN6una5qA.text: We were visiting Phoenix and some friends insisted that we stop & try the 'Flight of Bacon'.  We did, and sadly we were 'underwhelmed'.  Service was good, but I thought the Flight was just over-hyped (and overpriced).

kEaRon9lU5nKgWzXw2srbg.text: I took my son for breakfast as he's a big meat eater, and the name of the cafe alone piqued our interest. We went just after noon on Sunday. I ordered the standard fare of 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and biscuit with gravy, and of course applewood smoked bacon. Meh. Honestly, I think the problem was it was late in the day, nearly closing time, and it appeared that everything had been under warmers for a while. I'm not going to completely condemn the place until I go back early in the morning and see if I can get a fresh meal. I think the place has potential but my first outing was not so great.  My son had a burger (I don't remember which one) and he was pretty happy with that.  Oh, and as several have mentioned already, service was slow as molasses. Eggs, hashbrowns/bacon and biscuits/gravy don't take 30 minutes.

oPmk9T9REl1jGdw1pi2Smw.text: Have been here twice now for breakfast. I've had the blueberry pancakes and huevos rancheros. I love all of their different options for bacon. My favorites are the jalepeno and the apple cider! Friendly staff, good food, and fast service. All in all a good experience! I will be returning!

5TrxcW0sNgt0Vjlv4GBwfg.text: Excellent choice if you want a good hearty breakfast. Don't come here to eat healthy, there are too many yummy distractions. Had the eggs benedict and a side of pancakes that were tasty and very filling!!

bjZlVvsnqCa-T3_2ynE6wQ.text: Love this place.  And being kid friendly is a huge plus for us.  We have had the pleasure of eating here several times and have never been disappointed.  Wait staff has always been friendly and pleasant.  We do not  mind waiting on average 20-30 minutes.  It is worth it.  Love this neighborhood cafe.

sHGAm2cvf8N9n-s8WqdJbw.text: So very tasty!  I had the paradise valley omelet with potatoes and I loved how crisp the home potatoes were, they were also well seasoned.  Don't remember much bacon in the omelet but still was yummy.

lGY59cS389mASvSzs14d0g.text: Tried The Oink Cafe for the first time this morning, and we're glad we did.   We were seated promptly by a waitress in an extremely good mood. Noticed the other waitresses also seemed happy to be serving customers. Nice to see.   The menu isn't extensive, but has enough options to satisfy most anyone. They serve alcohol, which is nice for someone that wants a Bloody with their breakfast.   Food was hot and well done. The hash browns were crispy on the outside. After asking for "crispy" bacon, it was nice to actually receive crispy bacon. Too many places haven't figured out how to do that yet. Our Iced Teas were refilled without having to ask.   Even though places like Chompies have a lot to choose from and the food is good, I really enjoy smaller neighborhood or Mom and Pop places like Oink. Will definitely go back for breakfast and am curious to try them for lunch.

Zsrvm7Coe-rK63W1QAHDyg.text: Super nice staff. My latte was barely warm and not much to wrote home about. The bacon donut was good. Like pancakes and bacon had a baby!

Ngo-GS53kPLqdfzQCmODpg.text: My kids say this is the happiest place on earth! I'll have to admit its awesome. No better place to have the best breakfast in PV!!

JGlERWb-XGLA8rltACU4aA.text: This is where you go to get yer pig on, I'm talking bacon mania.  A wide variety of delicious breakfast plates, most of which feature that crispy delight, will satisfy ANY appetite. This place proves the old adage that 'bacon makes everything better'.

WwcTUJxpscnVuEKehdyF4w.text: For a business that is all about their bacon, it is rather disappointing!  The atmosphere is great and fun.  The service was decent, it was moderately busy, but the waitresses seemed overworked and not very enthusiastic.  But the bacon is what I had a problem with most!!  The signs all around the business talk about bacon and how they have 8 different flavors to try.  So, I ordered a full flight of bacon, one piece of all 8 flavors.  To say it was impressive would be a lie.  Most of the flavors tasted very similar, while a couple of them had no taste at all.  I did like the flavors of the Jalapeno and Apple Cider bacon, but the rest were rather "run of the mill".  The biggest turn-off was the size of the bacon, it was so small and not worth the value!  For an 8-piece plate, it costs $8.99!  That's over $1 a slice and they were so small!  I was expecting some thick cuts of bacon, something that would be a mouthful and give you a full sense of their quality food, but it was rather the opposite.  I don't think I will be going back there again.  For the same price, I could have ordered an entire meal, instead what I got was a medium-sized snack.

rnnJNA7CDdM184Q9LQV1Fw.text: I LOVE BACON!! So of course when I heard of this place, I couldn't wait to go. We got there and the greeting was lukewarm. We had to wait a little while before we were seated. Once we were seated it took quite awhile before anyone took our drink order. We had the bacon topped doughnut which I actually didn't expect to like. It was delicious!! Unfortunately, that is the only thing I can rave about. We ordered the bacon flight. At a placed called Oink, you would think the bacon would be exceptional; not so. It was over-cooked and thin :-(. My omelette was nothing special. It wasn't terrible, just something you can get at any breakfast chain. With a name like Oink, I thought I was going to have an exceptional breakfast experience. It was just mediocre at best and the service was not good at all. Definitely not worth going if you have to go out of your way to get there.

bXKvcbxNdQLp5AMeQUOvIg.text: I saw several health code violations in the 45 min I had the misfortune to eat here. Our waitress used a dirty glass to scoop ice out of the ice bin. The cook came out with his gloves on to speak to the table next to us, touched the table and walked right back into the kitchen. The waitress greeted our table with an armload full of dirty dishes. The bathroom was dirty, with no paper, and hadn't been checked (by the chart on the door) in 5 hours. This all on top of slow and rude staff made the visit not worth it. Entirely different from the same place in Tucson.

lIATb_fc_CrYqZ0ADhJhkA.text: Ok so I have had some good and some bad.  The last couple times were not so good.  The food is good and the restaurant is clean but you gotta get better wait staff.  They tend to be disorganized and forget things.  There seems to always be confusion on who's table it is.  The biggest thing though... Stop with the gossiping!! I really don't need to hear about your personal and work problems as I eat.  Serving 101 tells you not to complain and gossip anywhere near ear shot of the guest.  It would be really easy for me to give this place 4 stars if it was more consistent. Undercooked eggs one time, perfect eggs the next etc

2UqNdVGEWiLhexIn-2MweA.text: The concept is promising, the execution is disappointing. The interior lacks character. The placard on the table looked like someone just dashed it off on their inkjet printer and I can't recall for sure at this moment, but I'm pretty sure there were misspellings. It's as if they didn't have the funds to decorate or add all the little touches that identify the restaurant in the diner's mind. Overall it could use a graphic designer to do the menus and table cards. A visit with an imaginative friend to some store like Z Gallerie or Marshalls Home Store where you can get ready-made framed posters,  canvas prints and such could remedy the bland walls. This is a nice area, between Phoenix, Scottsdale and Paradise Valley. People expect a restaurant to have an identity. Your food has to be crazy good for people to want to return to a place which has all the character of a school cafeteria.  OK so who cares about my aesthetic sense; what about the food, right? Well I've only been there once (a 2nd trip planned shortly). My bacon flight was disappointing; a couple of the slices were overcooked and had the consistency of beef jerky. My dining partner's eggs benedict were well-done. That's bad. I talked to another friend who went here and they said the same thing happened to their eggs benedict. The service was OK. I'll give it another try but I doubt this is a place I'll want to make a regular stop. I think I gave it one star too many because  I just wanted so bad for it to be good.  UPDATE:  went here recently for a 2nd time. Better experience but I'm not changing the 3-star rating. The burgers were very good. The website menu and the physical menu show a discrepancy in the size of the Oink burger patty. The site says 1/3 lb (while all others are 1/2 lb), the menu says 1/2 lb. Pretty sure the actual burger was 1/2 lb. Waitress was a little slow refreshing the teas but she did do it and they were both very good. I hate it when I get stale icky iced tea at a restaurant. It is very inexpensive to keep fresh tea around. It's just water and a tea bag.  Unsolicited advice to the owner:  1) the concept needs better execution so that your restaurant's concept is 'sticky' in the mind of the diner. They remember it and go back.  a) the menus do not really sell the concept and are printed on plain old office paper on an inkjet printer. Hire or finagle a graphic designer to design new menus that better reflect the theme of the restaurant. If you don't want to go for professional-looking laminated menus, at least go to Kelly Paper and get a ream of heavy card stock to print them on so they don't look so cheap.  b) the walls need help.  2) The table card also needs a graphic designer's touch. What's more, I would not have assumed that a breakfast place - yes I know they serve lunch too but in my mind and most people's, it's a breakfast place - would serve booze yet that is what is on the card, the adult drinks. They have beer and wine and hard drinks too. Some people would like a Bloody Mary with breakfast, I bet they'd order one if you let them know it's available.  3) Speaking of Bloody Marys, did you know that there is bacon-flavored vodka? Why are you not pushing Oink Bloody Mary's or something like that? Missing the boat here.  4) If I were designing your menus, I would have on every page in big bold type: "SAUSAGE SIZE IT! ADD BACON OR SAUSAGE TO ANY ITEM FOR $1/SLICE" or something like that.  5) My friend raved about the bacon maple frosted donut. I did not see it anywhere on the menu. I had to ask the waitress and she said, "oh it's there under 'donuts' on the back page'. All it said was , 'donuts' or whatever. THIS THING WAS ON THE COVER OF NEW TIMES!!! Why aren't you pimping the sht out of it? You might even have some other awesome donuts but you're not trying very hard to sell it to me.

n5Lgl4T4Z3_dBociybe3ag.text: Bacon flight is a must. The bacon maple donut was surprisingly good. It was served warm and we cut it in 5 as a appy for breakfast. Servers were overwhelmed with a huge Sunday crowd but still kept things moving. The shape of the space and decor is off-putting, others in my party loved it. The omelet was great, hash browns were a bit salty, greasy and room temperature The coffee was S+*^bucks type of "over strong", the current trend but not my fav. I'll take a smooth cup o joe any day. The bacon alone is worth the trip.

YMxJFqNmMsLHeZNQtL2uaQ.text: Visited on a Sunday Morning and it was busy. 25 minute wait. Service was ok as was the food. Strip mall atmosphere and Perkins food quality. The place is busy so it is a good value, just nothing special about it.

veW3EOyKE82DgTwTEnL3Cg.text: I was looking forward to try The Oink Cafe for a while, as we like to support our local businesses.  We got a coupon on the mail and went there for breakfast a couple of weeks ago. Our server Heather was nice, she was very patient as we had a mix up with the coupon and she helped us.  We liked the idea of flavored bacon, we tried the jalapeno and it was very tasty, however, they didn't pass the crispy bacon test... we always make sure to say 'very crispy'...  I ordered 'huevos rancheros' and didn't like them much... they had some sort of red enchilada sauce, which it would have been OK, but it was kind of sweet and I didn't like it.  Hubby ordered an omelette with chorizo an it was ok, it had the red sauce too.  Beans and potatoes were very good, I ended up making my own breakfast burrito at home with them : )  Oh, if you access through the Cactus entrance, make sure to go to the other door as the hostess is there... they do have a sign by the door but  I missed it...

qoUmz242hPW0tp0wXca3Zw.text: We love Oink! Sunday breakfast is always great here. We hate to wait to be seated but who doesn't.  You know it's good, that's why you wait. Usually only 15/20 mins. Food is always yummy and the kids enjoy the food too. Ok to take the toddler also, who looooves their maple bacon donut holes! Lol...

i7El6BwByNmgptewD6xyig.text: After eating at the place couple of times, I'd figure to write a review on this place.  Overall this place is pretty good for breakfast.  The food was pretty good, but our service every time is pretty slow.  I usually get standard breakfast, eggs, sausage, and hashbrown.  I also have tried their biscuits and gravy.  All were pretty good.  My girlfriend is a huge fan of bacon and really enjoys the different types of bacon.  All and All, this place is pretty good.  It gets pretty busy in the morning, so expect a little wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy, French toast and flight of bacon

r_2W86T2I8KfE9ULyRjKBw.text: Great place for breakfast. Staff is always friendly and the food is always good. This is one of our go to places when in Phoenix.

K7tzRtTRNzBX0TKIq_YJxA.text: Was in the area for vacation, July 2015. It was okay, not a knockout, although the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. Bacon was not what you would expect from a establishment specializing in America's favorite meat!   Taste like slices you could get at any diner or restaurant around the country.

-qElmi7d3v9zl_Z-x6mxEA.text: We felt that the yelp reviews underrated this place. Been three times now. Service is a little slow because they're very busy. The food is good! Lots of bacon everything including different flavors of bacon. We like the applewood the best. Go Eat Here!

b9hdPnX7c-f8O3b0Iq2vQw.text: This place has been wonderful for the many years I've been coming here. Great breakfast, unparalleled bacon and the best mac and cheese ever. Today however, I feel empty inside as I sit here waiting for a 50/50 burger... They were out of noodles... I shouldn't be as upset as I am, but I am. I have been craving that delectable plate of oozey mac and cheese for a couple days now. I won't rant, I'll just leave you with this.... If their mac and cheese  (with the jalapenos and jalapeno bacon.) can devastate me so much, you should probably give it a try and see why..

4uRqXtBANUqdXjwKh0eaLQ.text: Had a few good meals there, but I had to update my review though from 4 stars to 2, we won't be back. We sat there for over 30 minutes with no food, people that arrived after us were eating and the waitress only acknowledged that our food wasn't ready yet, but it was obvious we were forgotten about.  Since we only had waters and no one was around for us to ask about the status of the meal we just left. Hungry and frustrated with wasting 45 minutes we will have to find a new breakfast place. I work in a restaurant and i know that stuff happens, some communication could have made a world of difference.

1x9wfygx3ywmrIAVD3L-lQ.text: Everyone was def right about trying the bacon flavor sampler with 8 different flavors. I loved jalapeno and maple, but they were all very good. In addition, we had great service . The manager came around and checked on everyone including us. She was delightful and made great conversation. Perfect mixture between amazing food and great service. Also- she told us one is opening in Tucson if you live there!

mQlN0Euxfllvnv_9S9xgHA.text: BACON! I thought the "bacon flight" was the greatest dish ever.  Eight pieces of perfectly cooked bacon, one each of: applewood smoked, sugar cured, honey cured, peppered, cherrywood, apple cider, hickory and jalapeno.  The bacon comes on a plate of lettuce, which as a bonus turns into a mini-salad with bacon flavored dressing, after you eat the bacon (at least it does, if you are a pig like me and my sister, no pun intended).  They also have a half-flight (four pieces of bacon, in flavors of your choice), but the full flight is so much better, IMO, especially the first time eating there.  EGGS! Besides the bacon flights, I'm also still in amazement over my scrambled egg. I really don't like eggs that much, so for me to LOVE a scrambled egg is just odd, and to crave a scrambled egg the way I crave a pumpkin frappe or a filet mignon is beyond bizarre.  However, that's how good the egg was.  I cannot stop thinking about it.  Yes - one silly little egg!!!  I suppose that my lack of egg expertise should be taken into consideration, as it is not my usual area of foodie-ness.  However, I may be a convert now after my encounter with the world's most perfect scrambled egg at Oink.  My mom ordered the yogurt parfait with granola and fruit.  I did not try it, but it was full of really big fruit, that was fresh, not runny, and the most amazing granola I have ever seen.  When I see giant, whole almonds crowning a tower of fluffy yogurt - I get a little happy.  Too many places give you watery yogurt, with powdery granola and mushy fruit.  But my mom ate the whole thing, so I am assuming it tasted as good as it looked.  SERVICE - so mostly good points and a possible negative point.  Our waitress was awesome - she even let me know that the bacon flavored coffee is more of a novelty, which most people try but don't usually ask for refills.  That was nice, since I wasn't in the mood for a novelty.  I ordered an almond latte instead (which was really good), and am going to try the bacon flavored coffee next time.  She also double checked that I said almond and not hazelnut, which I appreciated.  A lot of times people forget and just hope it turns out okay, rather than checking.    The only reason I mention a possible negative point, is because it is more of a relaxed environment, so if you are in a hurry or one of those moody people that expects a certain type of "dining experience" - make sure you sit at the counter I'm guessing.  It's definitely not a matter of "bad" service or "slow" service, or "inattentive" staff.....it is just a relaxed, happy, good mood sort of place.  Maybe I've been living in Boston for too long, if I am even making a note of this?  I cannot wait to go back this week, and try more of the menu.  Definitely a five star place.

rzkXfs_dwH0qS7-jKRvbqg.text: Ate here for the first time today after living right around the corner for months. I had the pork benedict with home fries and a side of bacon while my friend got the denver omelette. The pork was dry, I was given the wrong kind of bacon. His omelette was ok but the biscuit on the side was so stale we joked about throwing it against a wall. I really don't understand how this place has 3.5 stars. PPY3nXjj6scnfE4x9Lyl_w.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in Phoenix!  Bacon and sausage are just below filet mignon on my list of favorites.  Oink has several different sausage varieties, a few different types of bacon and everything else is delicious too!  I have had the pigs in a blanket, omelets, French toast... they were all excellent.  This is one of the spots we take guests when they visit.  You wont leave hungry and it's got some character which really sets it apart from your average corporate chain restaurant!

yo2W4Y4p7wzsgCPa6gd8uw.text: This place is awesome! My boyfriend and I have been going there for the last 6 months and absolutely love it  we have never had a bad experience there. The food is amazing and I can't even talk about the bacon without my mouth watering! Anne the manager is so nice and always takes care of the customers! We had stepped away from the restaurant to go to the book store while we waited to get sat and when we came back they had already called our name. So when I asked them, they said they would seat us at the next avaliable table. I didn't expect them to do this for us but no more than that minutes later we were being sat! My boyfriend ordered the Oink omelet and I had the egg breakfast. It was so good! Can't rave more about this place and the staff! Such a great atmosphere!

LSYAvI73bi6ABVVXj3n7iA.text: I love Oink!! The pork confit burrito/chimi with queso on top is delicious, and their French toast is out of this world. Oh and their mimosa flights are a must!   Thank you, Oink, for the effort you make for an excellent experience!

No one was frazzled or rude- I ordered the pancake combo. Homemade pancake batter daily and it does taste like mammas kitchen. 6i9WF_z5vNSG2qi8fX4OUw.text: Been waiting for a table for 25 minutes, not a big deal, but there are several tables available. 4 tops seating 2. The exterior coffee bar isn't open and the restaurant is packed, people could eat at that bar. You are loosing minimum $150/hr and inconveniencing everyone who wants to eat here. A woman waiting left to get coffee from Target. That shouldn't happen if you have a coffee bar. Utilize your space, because you are losing money and testing patience.

219cHiIIg3PoIE5JOR-hfw.text: Breakfast was delish!  I had the Oink Chimi with a side of hash browns (see pic). It came hot and I actually had to wait a bit to eat (I love that - nothing worse than paying for Luke warm food). The portions were so big I could only eat half. The pork inside was very good (slow cooked in bacon grease - c'mon man!) and the chorizo sauce on top added a lot of flavor. My wife had the Oink French toast and also could only eat half. The raspberry and blueberry sauce was a perfect topping.   One minor thing:  We ordered half a 'flight' (lol) and picked the applewood, pepper and sugar bacon. The bacon was very good but...Both my wife and I could barely tell a difference between the flavors. Thought there would be a noticeable difference especially when you have sugar and pepper.   Service was friendly, fast and consistent. Ambience was casual and clean.   Would definitely come back!

ijDscGbJC-_4Hi6ywYPhCg.text: I wish I could give them ZERO stars. The food took what seemed to be an eternity to come out. Before that our server [Taylor] made an inappropriate comment that made me want to get up and leave right away [being mean to people and making "funny" comments that hurt people's feelings is not my idea of FUNNY]; but since it was Saturday AM and we were seated front and center I didn't want to make a scene- which I now [honestly] regret. The food we ordered was brought out by another server. I took a bite and the sweet potato fries were cold. I checked the rest of the fries and they were cold too. Taylor popped up and was informed that the food was cold and that we dont have the time to wait for fresh ones. I didn't expect her to comp the meal but she could have comped the cold fries. Taylor was the worst server I ever had. Part of me wanted to run off without paying for this horrible meal. I am never coming here again. I've been to The Oink before and even if some things were not perfect the servers were always sweet and tried to make up for it. A lady approached as I was placing money on the table and asked if I needed a box for the rest of the food- being on the verge of tears and quite frankly wanting to give Miss Taylor a piece of my mind I was short and said "we are leaving thank you". I hope Taylor reads this. How you treat people matters. Don't be a snooty snob. #45centTip #shouldHaveLeft0 #theNOink #prettyButMean #rudePeopleStink #getSomeMannersGirl #done

6e8RUVaQo31DZMlLhw03Rw.text: First off I'm trying to be more adventurous with my food choices and was in the area and decided to come here for lunch with my babe..she wasn't so sure about it as she's not big on meat and bacon to be exact   Came during the last hour that they were open and the place was still packed and very busy. If I hadn't notice the sign that said it closes at 2 pm, I wouldn't have known that this place could be cleared out in an hour!! Anyways, decided to see how long the wait would be and was seated immediately.   The waitress came over shortly after being seated and took our order. The wait between ordering and our food coming out was close to 20 minutes! I guess not too bad, but we noticed that people that came in after us were getting their orders much sooner then us. Maybe it was because of my order. Anyways, food finally came out and was much larger in size then I had expected. Babe didn't enjoy her food, even though it was just a turkey sandwich. She said it was very plain and had no flavor to it. I on the other hand ordered the Ranchero Chimichanga which was delicious. It was VERY filling tho and felt like I overate when I was done. I didn't even get around to eating my side of fries (came with the order).   This place is very popular and tables were always filling up as soon as someone left. Good thing the tables were cleaned immediately and floors swept as soon as someone left. Our waitress seemed to have half the tables, so she didn't come around to us but one time. Was very friendly though.   May try this place out again if in the area and hungry.

They did give me another coffee but not the sugar so I borrowed from a neighboring table. Probably not going to go there again....

Sd4df9BWdWqilG4-nGIBHA.text: We thought this was a great restaurant!  It's family-owned and verrry friendly.  We went on a Saturday for lunch.  We didn't have to wait at all for a table  Our waitress was Heather and she did an excellent job.  We're low carb and they were very accommodating to our needs (no bread, no potatoes).  I had a make-your-own omelette and my husband had the five egg omelette.  They use fresh, real eggs (not one of those powdered mixes).  They were delicious and filling.  We plan to go back, for sure!

uTRvknnLWyKoTtUJGl2YNA.text: I really enjoy going to the Oink Cafe for breakfast. They have a few dishes that I really like, especially the Arizona Omelette. That one is a little spicy and really good. The service is usually really good, sometimes a little slow if they're really busy. But that's to be expected anywhere you go. After some recent disappointments with other breakfast places, finally a restaurant where everything is just right. Keep it up, I'll be back for more.

XgmkAl3SnRmG84eTZlNqQQ.text: There was hardly anyone in the restaurant on 12/23/2013 and we waited 45 minutes for our food.  When it came out it was cold and the cheese was congealed on our sandwiches as it appeared it was kept under the heating lamp.  The waitress never removed our plates after the meal and we didn't receive our salads prior to the meal.  If you go here you have to be prepared to let your expectations of good service go. We heard about this joint from the food network prior to going and it didn't meet our exceptions on both food quality and service.  Sometimes I can overlook some food quality issues if the service is good but this place has neither.

xnJv_7a4jqxiFRNpCx1GrA.text: Loved the Oink Cafe!  My friend and I enjoyed a long breakfast, great food, great service.  I will go back for sure!  Lynn T

AYxEVmpnM30l_nUz4rDkxw.text: WARNING: My family and I never got to try the food.  I have never written a negative review and I am sad that a new place has to be my first.  So my husband has been waiting for this place to open for a month.  He booked opening weekend on the calendar and invited the whole family.  The four of us (toddler and teen as well) arrived about 10am.  There was no one to greet us and looked like they had a number (maybe 6) of families waiting.  After a few minutes a (teen?) girl came over and kind of took our name.  No information, no wait time, no menus (which we took to look over ourselves).  Noticed tables sitting empty but not cleared.  Another couple waiting next to us for 10 minutes ended up finally having their server come over and hand them their bill.  Interesting...  We waited for over a hour.  In that time no one saw a bus boy.  The two tables were never cleared of their slowly rotting food in that entire time (though the "greeter" girl came over to the same table twice, clearing 1-2 cups each time...).  A few groups were slowly seated as we waited, but we also noticed the outside tables were empty but no one was being asked to sit outside.  About 30 mins in, the greeter girl came over to see if anyone wanted to sit outside (should have been done from the start.).  As she looked for people, she rolled her eyes when she couldn't find the name from her list.  When we were finally seated (by the same greeter...), the table soaking wet.  She grabbed some paper towels and handed them to my son, who dried the table himself.  No silverware was on the table so a few minutes later, one of the owners/managers put some down.  He half-heartedly (and inappropriately if I may add) said "Guess you waited awhile?".  I said it looked like their were some logistics issues and he immediately shot back that "No, we are very busy".  Um, if you cannot handle your shop being busy, than yes - you have logistics issues.  My husband asked if there were any busboys and he said there were three and they were all working.  Wrong attitude all around - this is not how to endear your customer base.  After he walked off, my son noticed the silverware had dried egg on several pieces and that the 5-6 tables nearest to us had NO food on them - all the families were waiting without menus.  That was the last straw.  As the waitress came over for the first time to ask for our drink requests, I explained it was not needed as we were leaving.  It sounds like the food here could be excellent.  But they need someone with major restaurant management experience to get these things ironed out immediately.  Additionally, management needs to realize that their attitudes can make or break their business.  I love supporting local shops and I wish them the best.  However, I will wait for more yelp feedback to determine if we will ever return.  P.S.  In going over my review with my husband and son, he said he has a few friends that went over the weekend with their families as well.  One said they waited over 1.5 hrs only to get the wrong items delivered to their table, with no explanation of what happened or apology.  Very disappointing...

WpLTffVo2-OHxiwBogAO9w.text: Not really impressed. I ordered bacon pancakes...right... they had jalapeno bacon in them and not just a little. There was too much to finish. If that was the way they served them they should have said so. Server apologized that everything took so long and then disappeared. I finally went up and got more coffee myself. They did not appear that busy and there were 3 servers on but everyone got crappy service as far as I could see. Maybe they have another dining room I don't know about that they all went to. When I complained about the jalapenos (she should have asked why I only ate half) she took it off the bill. The manager never came out, no one said anything when I got up to get more coffee. They might need to hire more help.

ZYAk9b7vG5wZ2ydVXV7H8w.text: One of my favorite places for breakfast or lunch in the area! Others have mentioned the noisey atmosphere, but I appreciate it since I have a little one that can be a bit on the noisey side herself and here she blends in.  I highly recommend stopping in on a week day for lunch if you are looking for it to be much quieter.  The manager is great. He is always working the room and stopping at tables to chat. The food is always great! If you are lucky enough to stop in when they have beer cheese soup it is a must to get. I have never had such delicious soup. A must try!

NF0YmAOTwI91aYdEM0_hFA.text: We live in the area and were pleased to see a new breakfast place opening. It seems to be a locally owned small business and we find the best food and service in this type of establishment. To borrow from William S. Burroughs writing about the Rio Grande Valley; ""In the Valley, restaurants are not operated by people who are cookers and purveyors of food. They are opened by somebody who decides that "people always eat" so a restaurant is a "good deal".""  The owners may have restaurant experience, but it's not apparent. The staff is young, and doesn't  seem to know how sit-down breakfast works. They probably grew up eating from the McDonalds drive-up window. We got coffee and placed our order, and never saw the waitress again until she was ready to give us the bill. Our coffee was gone long before the food came, someone in a black uniform (one of the owners?)  brought the food to us, but didn't see our coffee cups were empty. The waitress never came over to ask us if everything was OK. She did ask if we wanted the check when she saw our plates were empty. At that point she asked if we wanted more coffee. A quick fix would be to take the owners and waitstaff across the street to I-HOP for breakfast so they could see what they should be doing.

JtMcLtrsYPc7u0PyILBWtQ.text: We had been there for lunch a few months ago and it was average in service but high in price. We tried again yesterday for lunch. Arrived at 12:30, was seated right away and the place was busy with a good lunch/breakfast crowd. My ordered a Denver omelet with the home fries that were suppose to be with onions and bell peppers. I ordered a burger and sweet potato fries. Reasonable time passed and out came by burger no Denver omelet. They said it would be right out. My wife at some of my burger and I ate some too. The server came by said any minute now. Finally her Omelet arrived. My wife ask the server where are the bell peppers and onions on the potatoes? The server says, they are in the potatoes. My wife ask her to show her and the server picked through them and agreed, no bell peppers or onions. So, back to the kitchen. Why would one need to fight to get whats right? Meantime a man who i think was a floor MGR was cruising around not really doing anything. He finally came to our table after our bill arrived and ask how things were. My said below average and he said thank and come back again. NOT! My wife and agreed the next time any restaurant comes out of the kitchen with half the order, we are leaving. Its in-excusable.

snQDtnV5C8AEz-SHZ-1K-g.text: I don't get how people are giving this place negative reviews, their food is very fresh and absolutely delicious! They cure their own bacon 8 different ways and offer a sampler dish. We tried 4 different kinds and they were all amazing. I had the eggs Benedict, and for the first time since I moved to Phoenix 15 years ago, actually got a properly poached egg. And the hollandaise tasted like it was made from scratch rather than some powder in a package. My husband ordered an omelet which he devoured, and seemed to thoroughly enjoy, I opted not to taste it since it was more spicy than I was in the mood for. We decided to top off our brunch with a maple bacon glazed doughnut which was still warm and made onsite, it was absolutely melt in your mouth delicious!  I will admit our over all meal was a little pricey, but I would eat there again in a heartbeat! Where else can you get  jalapeno bacon for breakfast?

uJJh1J092RRmdc2DO4t5vQ.text: It could not possibly have been worse. Stay away from this place at all costs. Pity there isn't a zero stars option. I bet it won't be there in 12 months - just like everything else that has tried the same location in the past 20 years. Went there for breakfast last Sunday 3/25/12. It was half full. Ordered a vegetable omelet and a pancake. How hard is that? After 30 minutes I asked where the food was. Without checking, the waitress told me it would still be a few minutes as there 'were a lot of tickets in the kitchen'. In a half full restaurant after 30 minutes of waiting? One omelet? It gets worse .. much worse.  The chef came out to apologize. Told me that their system somehow was not entering the tickets of our waitress but that he would personally make it immediately. He didn't check my order with me.. remember it was lost. Amazing how two tables behind us got food from the same waitress. Their tickets did not get 'lost'. I know garbage when I hear it. He should just have been honest.,  Then the omelet came out  10 minutes later sans pancake (40 mins now).  I ate the slice of toast which was not toast but warm bread .. I hate that. The omelet looked peculiar and seemed burned.  Then I took a bite of the omelet and out popped a pink piece of ham. I was livid. It is completely against my religion and they had served me ham. I think they took the first omelet off the grill. He had no idea what my order was and did not ask. I screamed at the manager but I don't think he got it. I should have made a lot bigger scene but my wife stopped me. Take my advice .. stay away. Everybody complains about the service for a good reason.  Oink stands for a pig of a restaurant.  Let's hope Yelp lets this review stand.

0kSYOuH4IzwWW0i7Lj8n9A.text: We were excited to try this place out after seeing the reviews. Specializing in bacon? How can anything be wrong with that? We walked in on a Friday morning, around 10 am, and 90's rap was blaring through the empty restaurant. I mean LOUD. So, a little strange, but no big deal, we decided to sit outside. We looked at the menu and decided. I ordered the PV omelet and my husband chose the Belgian waffles. The food came out quickly and everything was really good. As we sat outside, we noticed broken glass at our feet. When the server came over to check on us, we told her about the glass, and she told us that it had been there since the previous morning. This made me a bit nervous--I worked at a corporate restaurant for many years and broken glass was like a 5 alarm fire. Also, I am very pregnant, so the glass at my sandaled feet made my husband nervous. After we told the server about the glass, she sent a kitchen guy out with a broom, but he swept the other side of the patio, no where near the glass. She said he would clean up the glass once we left, but then quickly sat the table next to us, also surrounded by glass. This in not a huge deal, but oversights such as this at a new restaurant make me a bit nervous about what else might be overlooked.  The food and service was good, and we may return.

sx3QrxZG4b469Dq7A4zn2Q.text: Great brunch or breakfast place. Went with husband and kids and they loved it, I had their battered French toast, which has a unique sweet crunch to it, and their bacon is flawless. Last time I went I got a veggie omelette. It was good, but I wish there were other types of veggies to add to set it apart from a general veggie omelette. It was still very good, just one of the very few menu items that was not unique. The bakery also is stellar.

jjEFw8p3hpHpqgcUrr93_Q.text: I wish I could give no stars. This was the worst service I have ever had in my life. Took 30 minutes just to take our order, messed up the order twice. The waitress then took my plate while I was still eating. I will never eat there again.

-k_AgH6bT37DQ_jZlfeIlQ.text: was there for the first time and my impression was very neutral. It is a cute place, was busy , but to the point it took way too long for the food, l think they had problems in the kitchen. The worst hashbrowns i had ever  eaten. The pancakes were ok.  They have a chance to be good, i hope they correct their problems and get good quality food.

2sBLK8v1dN8RYQvfpoOUSw.text: All I can say is YUMMMM! We wondered in here with not to many expectations... but the service was awesome, food was great, and prices very reasonable. We will be back!

fYlQ8LyZHylIfZ8Ew80vAg.text: I love this place. Evey time we go the staff is terrific and the food of great. And the bacon donuts don't disappoint. For me, Oink is great alternative to IHOP (meh) and Chompie's (good, but overwhelming). It's a locally-owned neighborhood spot for a good breakfast in an intimate setting. We've never had an issue with the food or the service. When we were there last month the owner was walking to each table, talking to customers, and just making sure they/we were ok. This morning we went with friends and the GM was doing the same thing. He stopped at our table, made a genuine effort to talk to us and our kids (making a big to-do about hanging their pig pictures on the wall), and made sure we were well taken care of. Stuff like this goes a long way with me, and is a big reason why I will keep coming back. I always order the Pig in a Blanket which never disappoints. Love this place! There have been so many restaurants come and go in this space over the years. . . .I hope this one stays for a while.

6l8Ah-7-xsNkZN7beOxCpw.text: My husband and I have eaten at Oink Cafe twice. First time was the week they opened, early on a Thursday morning. Food was good, service was fine, but there was only one other customer besides us. Today we went there at 7:30 on Saturday, the place was almost empty when we got there but quickly filled up. First off, they were out of their homemade turkey sausage, that I wanted to try. I changed my order to Huevos Rancheros, and was really disappointed. The eggs were fine, but the beans were greasy, I could see a layer of lard floating on top of them. At $8.99 I thought it was really over priced. My husband had the pancake combo with bacon, he thought the bacon was over cooked, and the pancakes were almost raw, they were gummy and severly undercooked. As for service, our coffee was never refilled, once our food was dropped off we were completely ignored until the check was left. Customers around us were complaining, the woman behind us had to order her tea 3 times before it arrived, the man behind us complained that his order was wrong, many customers seemed unhappy with the wait and the service. I was really disappointed, I realize that they have only been open a couple of weeks, so we might return in a few months, if they survive that long. It's really too bad, I like small, locally owned restaurants, but the experience today was so bad that I'm not in any hurry to return. They got 2 stars, because our first visit was fine.

OgvfIDxYh96KLYbKWej2CA.text: Always has been a great place for food.  After a 10 mile run, I was famished.  The Arizona Omelette (Chorizo, Cheese, Avocado; substituted Salsa for Ranchero Sauce) hit the spot!  Great service, reasonable prices....I love this neighborhood spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arizona Omelette - HITS THE SPOT!!

E7gdrgPKKe4pzlqam4xkzg.text: I have been meaning to stop in to Oink Cafe for sometime now and I am happy to say it was just as i expected. The Bacon flight was delicious and juicy! I oredered the biscuits and gravy along with the flight for a amazing breakfast the portions are exceptionally big and come with plenty of food! i will of course come back! I had the pleasure of meeting the owner who checked on me a couple of times to ask what i thought of the food. Great staff all around wish only the best for the busnies.

e3DWccDjKVhr11klsuF54g.text: My go to spot for sweet and savory breakfast. You can't beat their French Toast paired with one of the many bacon flavors. Bacon is obviously king at Oink and the jalapeno bacon is great. Once we went and they had a mango habanero bacon that was some of the best bacon I've ever eaten. If you're in the area and in the mood for some amazing pancakes, delicious french toast, or a phenomenal waffle, I highly recommend you stop by.

eBd1ZzuiziFypPlQ3oWsNw.text: Nice place to get some Breakfast or Lunch in the PV Mall area. Inside is somewhat simple with the basic PIG theme (Oink). They have both booths and tables that you can request. Gets really busy and you will probably have to wait a bit. So get there a little early and get your name on the list. We went shopping next door and got back right when they called our name. Perfect timing.  The menu has a large selection of most of your favorite breakfast dishes as well as a lunch menu with burgers and sandwiches. They also serve soup, an array of salads, oatmeal, yogurt with granola, mac and cheese, chicken, fish and chips, and even chicken fried steak.  Today my Yelp friend and I did the breakfast dance. I ordered the The OINK Omelette which has 5 eggs and is stuffed with a bunch of the meat group covered with cheddar cheese. Had to try a side of the Half Flight of Bacon which is 4 out of the 8 choices of flavored Bacon strips and a side of what they call ranchero sauce for my omelette.  Our server Cheyenne was both friendly and most accommodating even though the restaurant was totally packed. She made sure that we had everything we needed and then some.  The food was tasty yet somewhat average and the bacon was a little pricey. Would have liked a thicker cut of the Bacon as well as it being cooked a little slower to prevent shrinkage. After all it is served on a butcher block. Thick BABY! The Omelette was tasty and quite filling. What they call ranchero sauce is really more of a New Mexico style enchilada sauce. Ranchero sauce is usually more of a fresh sauce cooked with tomatoes, onion, peppers, garlic and herbs. I bet their version would taste great on one of their burrito options. Hmm?  Definitely worth a visit when you are shopping and getting ready to drop. Open every day from 7 am to 2pm. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 4 out of 8 different types of Bacon.
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Oink 5 egg Omelette. Huge!

DpF3QnWmHb4enGxeCEfU2Q.text: Oink how we love you. Let us count the way... 1. Bacon. 2. More bacon. 3. A great place to dine with your furry family members. I usually meet here with friends and family twice a month.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Benedict on tomatoes instead of English muffin. Apple cider bacon is amazing!

B4malD24q4ZkHmyhFbYuxg.text: One of my favorite places near my work. I go here for my work meetings, and love it. Food is great, staff is great, and the location is great. I can't wait for them to open one in south chandler near my house, I ask each time I go in so far no go! But love it and recommend this place!

mWWUr5h_rNv_u0oHVsiHkQ.text: Loved the Place! Everything Bacon! Try the Paradise Valley Omelette or the Eggs-Benedict...  its worth it!!!

HxLDpRB6G-OINfJ-ffptLA.text: We enjoy breakfast here every Saturday morning. Delicious food, consistent staff and we feel like family here. Shout outs to Anne, Josie, Rachel, Sarah, Gabriel, Nikol and the whole delightful staff for terrific, caring service. And Lana, now in Tucson...we miss you!

akCPmgGA8eTajC1Ydvnb7g.text: What happened? This place was so great a couple years ago.. now the staff leaves something to be desired... Still like the food, hope staff gets a rearrangement.

VlShQlAcc1C6FmpQOQzpYQ.text: Had the biscuit and gravy with eggs! OMG... the best ever. Wife had the blueberry pancakes... love them!!

jcKuQ8orH7fos-7mUB73Tw.text: Had a breakfast meeting here once and never decided to go back. Service was great but the food wasn't worth it. The eggs felt like it was made out of a microwave and the gravy just wasn't to my standards. Let's just say I wont be trying this place again.

53Bln4oUgmbGcKiPSXHFHQ.text: Oink oink!! That's what I was thinking as I saw the pigs on the walls, on the coffee mugs, and elsewhere around the Oink Cafe. Not to mention the five different ways that bacon is prepared (applewood smoked, honey cured, sugar cured, peppered, jalapeno). I found my experience very pleasant as I parked, sat down with no waiting late on a Saturday morning, and was greeting almost right away. Don't get me wrong...there were still a lot of people in the restaurant, and it appeared that everyone was enjoying themselves. The service was outstanding as my waitress was very pleasant and helpful and continued to stop by to check on my father and me. The food itself was very good. Both my father and I ordered traditional breakfasts (to keep it simple for our first time at the Oink Cafe). He ordered applewood smoked bacon, extra crispy while I ordered honey cured bacon. Both orders were delicious! The rest of the breakfast resembled any other breakfast restaurant though the dishes were still good. As an entire package (the food, service, wait, atmosphere), it was definitely worth the trip. Plus, there are some coupons online for 15% off your bill, $1 off any gourmet drink, or a free maple bacon donut (at 8coupons.com/discounts/t...). Oh, and if you're not a fan of bacon, there are plenty of non-bacon breakfast and lunch dishes, too!

9GfWhfdylp1C8wE1uE2FFA.text: We had wanted to try the Oink Cafe for a long time. Unfortunately, we tried it today.  We went late, our fault, and there was a wait. Only about 20 min and they were accurate in their estimate of the wait. The decor is, I don't know, off. There are large images of pigs on the wall in some places and big expanses of empty wall in others. Oh, and the colors are a little much for a breakfast restaurant.  Initially the service was good, but that deteriorated too.  The worst part was the food. I ordered a build your own omelette and my partner had Ham Steak and eggs with a tortilla. He's on a low carb regimen right now. He enjoyed his, but the presentation was lackluster at best. Two eggs (ordered over medium and cooked over easy) the ham steak and a tortilla all on a white plate. No garnish, just white eggs, a slightly pink piece of ham and a beige totilla on a white plate. Not very appetizing at all! I felt sorry for him.  I ordered an egg white omlette with spinach, tomatoes and cheddar. I would have preferred Feta, but they don't have it on the menu. Mine came with home fries and an English Muffin. Oh, and the omellette I received was regular eggs not egg whites. Yes, I could have said something, but I was starving at that point and just wanted to eat. The weirdest part of the omlette was the cheese on the outside. Who the heck puts cheese on the outside of an omlette?  For $25 bucks for two I would have expected more food and better quality.  After brunch we made a quick stop at Target, but then we had to run home as the meal made me ill.   Sorry Oink, we won't be back.

SuW6OOcvCvLeoj0H5tJ9-g.text: One of my favorite places to eat breakfast. They get very busy so be prepared for a bit of a wait. But half the time they over estimate your wait time. Great variety on the menu and always great service. However depending on who is working the patio it tends to get forgotten and sometimes there has been confusion on who is actually waiting on us. Management is on top of it and has always noticed before we waited too long but I have had to point out to them one time when they seated two ladies on the patio on a rather hot day and 10 minutes went by before they were even offered water. But they made up for it with very quick playing. The flight of bacon is my favorite!

BluHX38Zo3E50vqUpoGQQg.text: Chose this restaurant because I like the name. Service was great but food was just ok. I had the Huevos Ranchero. The red sauce was overwhelming with chili powder flavor and salt. Waffle good. Husbands omelet was greasy and salty.

-44lmleuG1U2_Enld63VTA.text: I went here for the first time on Father's Day and had a wonderful experience! The waitress had a bright and welcoming personality, the coffee was fresh, my breakfast was kept simple, though flavorful...everything was lovely! I really enjoy the fact they offer gluten free items because it's a real pain finding restaurants that have those options! The waitress was helpful in catering to my food allergy needs with patience and I greatly appreciated that. I definitely recommend stopping in for breakfast if you're ever in the area!

vLp8jkHenxv6K3N79wXbTA.text: Not very good. Bacon was a complete let down. Hash browns were oily and too crunchy.   Way too much butter/ oil on it. It was soggy from it. Service was quick and polite. Nothing special here. Kid friendly and has a patio.

76XEJziULHqPZ9Sjl66fbg.text: Had an amazing time at the oink cafe.  Amazing food and had the best waitress named Emma.  She was so on top of everything, got our food to us fast, and had an amazing personality that brightened my day.  We will definitely be returning.

gN3R9otA92eL0yu8lqAzSA.text: A flight of bacon, pigs can fly. Yummy, it was 8 different types of bacon.  My 11 year old son claimed it was the best Hot Chocolate Ever, he is hard to please. The staff was friendly and professional, moderate pricing for a great breakfast. I just moved into the area, I shall return often. Closes at 2:30pm, no late lunches.

FZmpEuRfazMxfCHx4x_6Wg.text: I've been to this location twice. The first time was pretty good, but the second time all of the food at my table was significantly overdone. First time here would have ranked 4 stars, and the second time here ranks 2 stars. I figured I would average it out at 3 stars overall. Not too bad, but consider trying Snooze AM if you are looking for a place to grab brunch.

eU_u_LIcZXBAJBN4ly19zA.text: This is my place. My kids practically grew up in a lime-colored booth. It's all great. Considering that we have frequented this place for five years at least twice a month the consistency is impressive. Perfect? No. But, a cool and delicious place to hang with your family and have terrific food.   BTW, THEIR HOMEMADE RANCHERO SAUCE, HOMEMADE SALSA, AND CHORIZO are WHAT DREAMS ARE MADE OF. Does not matter what to order... it's all yummy.  This is my yum, get your own. Huevos Rancheros (poached medium) with Chorizo, avocado, house potatoes with salsa and a side spinach salad with hot bacon dressing. I get the quad shot whole milk latte with extra foam and a soda water with lime. Now they will know who I am...wait staff are the best in the biz folks.
