Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hair of the dog
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot chocolate and foolishness

YKZPbDyb1JtZtql3LbdyvQ.text: Wow has this place gone down hill. This was our fav place. Took forever to get me and my moms beer flight to come out. Then the waitress JEN  assumed my husband was the other drinker.  Once we got the flight the beer order was completely wrong based on the list we got. We had to switch them around to the correct order. Food too long to come out. People who sat down long after we ordered got food first. When I said something to our waitress she was pretty kurt w us.  Finally got our food and my moms burger was well done, yet asked for med rare. Again waitress was kurt. Manager never came by to check after the mistake. And when my mom went to say something to the manger she was kurt and just brushed everything off by saying "yep" and "ok" to everything.  So disappointed.

vf74G8_p8GsttybHUM-lDg.text: This is the third time I've been here, each and every time I've been happy walking out the door.  The staff is extremely friendly. I was greeted promptly, I only waited under 10 minutes to get a booth on a busy Saturday morning.   Our server was quick to come over and take our order. I had the Sunrise Benedict. The flavors meshed perfectly together. I added avocado, and I'm glad that I did. The eggs were poached perfectly, the chorizo patties were the amount of spice the dish needed. I'm very picky about hash browns, and these cake out exactly how I liked them.   Try the bacon maple donut, it's delicious. They want it up before serving, it melts in your mouth.   Coffee is fresh, water is ice cold and food is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunrise Benedict

XAPb-Vi4-ow1hEWi08_sLA.text: I have passed by the Oink Cafe hundreds of times and finally got the chance to stop in this past weekend. Not even a greeting as we waiting at the front host stand and the staff were not very friendly on this Saturday morning.. I could understand if it was 7am when they were just opening but our time in was 9:15am. A smile goes a long way at a breakfast restaurant!  Everything I ordered from here included Bacon. Started with the Maple Bacon Donut and Bacon Flight (which was my favorite part of the morning). I recommend the Jalapeno, Honey Cured, and Pecanwood flavors if you are only ordering the 3 piece. Finished with a Grilled Cheese Sandwich w/ Applewood Bacon and Sweet Potato Fries. Everything I enjoyed this morning I could have made at home except for the donut. Very good meal overall but they need to improve on their Staff and friendliness.

Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon-Grilled Cheese w/ Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Flight

guSf5FHQnbexF7IhOWbnUA.text: Our first time here and we had a great time. Saturday Mid Morning, didn't haven't to wait too long for a table.  Our server was busy, but she made it a point to touch our table and acknowledge us and let us know she'd be with us in just a minute. Appreciated the acknowledgement.   We split the Arizona Omelette with fruit and hash browns and 1/3 flight of bacon. And OJ.   Recommend Sour Cream with Arizona Omelette. Just needs it.   1/2 Flight of bacon we chose 2 sides of the Pecan, the chef special, a jalapeno bacon and apple wood.  Applewood was the favorite.   Hash browns we're good, not exceptional.  Fruit was a little mushy, so not much was eaten but it's all good.   Food took a little longer, but to be expected because of a busy morning.   Will definitely be back when in the area.

Jen was our server and she was great. Very attentive and entertaining.  If the Oink management reads this make sure to let Jen know congrats on her "promotion " LOL!  We were so hungry, we forgot to take pix of the bacon flight and the rest of the food.

oEybxb8o8f6LGr1K_NiA-Q.text: Two words: bacon flight. That's really all you need to know. The food and service are great, as well. I wish they took reservations for smaller parties, but, that's life. They get a full 5 stars for the next part:  This place has a great kids menu and coloring pages for the kids. They didn't freak out when my one year old needed to get down and wander around for a bit, but when they decided they preferred him in his seat, they offered him a bowl of blueberries as bribery. A million thanks for people who know how to handle little kids in a restaurant for the parents insane enough to try to bring them out every so often.

uuxFXe7xVmb2Kp3LUoK9hw.text: There was hair in my food. Asked to speak to the manager and was told by the waitress that he was busy "on the line". I told her there was hair in my food, she offered no apology (the way she treated the situation it's like it is a common thing). She did offer to have something else made, nope I lost my appetite.  1st and last time here.   Walt said his biscuits and gravy were good and hair free

Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hair, there is hair in my food

_B1gycrG5oMVhMvXmRSjrg.text: I ordered food to-go.   I got the Breakfast Chimi. Glad I got the cheese sauce on the side, because it was too much for me. I wish it came with a red chili sauce instead, personally. I tried it with salsa and it was better but still not really what I had hoped for. The pork was super dry and the ratio of pork and egg/potato was 80/20. I didn't really want a pork burrito, I wanted an egg burrito.   Macchiato: DELICIOUS!!!!!!!! I loved every second of it! Will get one every time, should I go back!   Bacon Donut: I read reviews online that said to heat it up, so I did warm it up for 30 seconds, and I'm glad I did! So warm, sweet, salty and delicious. This donut made up for the meal not being good.   I'd go back for a donut and coffee, to-go, if I was in the area. I probably would not stop in for a meal.

V72TsYYM-stl0myyOCZ9aQ.text: I'm a creature of habit and I ate here for a week straight while visiting the Paradise Valley area. The staff is wonderful and the food was great! Healthy choices like turkey sausage, bacon with very little fat and lite-oil are available. They're selection of plates and bacon was impressive. Yeah - guilt-free bacon is a thing! Check these guys out!

BK8ECwkDtfrhO_aHt7cQSQ.text: I'm not sure why the complaints of this place are so harsh. Granted, I've never been here on a busy time, like say, a weekend morning. I'm sure it's much busier than a Thursday at 12:00. But the service was fairly quick, the food tasted great. It wasn't overly greasy or salty which I like. Great little place for breakfast! The bacon was definitely delicious! And I was impressed with the large portions.

bzYRqL7C1PARczgUXhpgCQ.text: A day out with the kiddos is fun. Beforehand, L pointed out that she loves Oink Cafe, and that the home fries and bacon are amazing. Well then! Don't threaten me with a good time! Bring on the bacon!  At the south end of a strip mall, this place has an awkward entrance to the north, where I almost ate pavement when there was a step up that wasn't marked, and I was too busy ogling bacon paraphernalia in the windows. There was a good line, but we learned that one was a party of 5, and the other two parties of 2. So, a 10 minute wait...not bad. The gal at the reception was learning, and it was a bit jumbled. There was an older gal barking at her in front of the patrons, which was also a little awkward for everyone around.   There was so much porkaphernalia to see! Toys and bakery items, chalkboard menus with specials and pictures everywhere. There was a bar, but I noticed only coffee items. The sandwich boards came from the likes of Four Peaks and San Tan, so I'm guessing they serve beer as well?  L ordered a half flight of bacon and some home fries. The bacon she chose was sugar-cured. J chose some eggs and toast. He wasn't feeling well, but I saw him steal a half-piece of bacon. I opted for the bacon and egg sandwich, sugar-cured bacon, on a homemade biscuit. We also shared a maple bacon donut. I ordered an iced chai as well.  The home fries were so small, that the frying made them hard. The bacon wasn't anything to write home about. The chai was watery and not at all flavorful. The menu had a blatant lack of pork. Ok, so you have some bacon. No pork belly? No sausage specialties? No pork sandwiches or steaks? Hmm. Ok. Also, walking past the kitchen, I didn't notice a full kitchen. So, how are these things being made? Are you just spraying flavor on pieces of bacon?   Staff was inattentive, and the bill exorbitant for what we ordered. The wait exceeded the stars on this one. I wouldn't return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Maple bacon donut!
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced chai latte
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes, yes it is.

t-wRX-b7p1aXkY7bOrxZBg.text: Went first in Tucson and had to try the one nearest home. I loved the mimosa flight at both places. Make sure to ask what the seasonal flavors are! Food is also very good. I had pancakes, partner had eggs Benedict and liked hers, especially the bacon on the side- pecan wood smoked. Very nice service and not too busy even on Saturday morning. Can't wait to come back.

KhDWGqzL99TPiOSlB6Q6RQ.text: I've dined twice here and both times have been a good experience.  The staff is friendly and the food has been pretty good with a few minor issues. I've always had to wait to be seated mainly because weekend mornings are exceptionally busy. This also means waiting for your food for up to 20 mins. The only things is have the complain about are the occasional raw bacon. Now this place is known for the various types of bacon which is why the chef should be well aware of the implications of not completely frying a piece or placing raw bacon on a burger to cook. The ice tea tastes old also. Aside for these issues it was a good experience.

Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon soda

8ow3evVXU_NFTK59XH1z9g.text: I was hesitant to try this place out because they only had 3.5 stars on Yelp, but it looked like their more recent reviews were pretty good, so we decided to give it a shot. Honestly, everything was delicious & everyone we encountered was super friendly! They were busy when we arrived, but it was still only about a 5 min wait. I ordered the biscuits & gravy which was delicious & more than enough. I also added 2 eggs. The hash browns are simple, but good. My husband ordered the pork confit benedict. The hollandaise sauce is one of my favorite that I've encountered-great tang to it. The eggs were a little bit too raw, but not bad for us (but we like over easy/medium eggs). The coffee was strong, but good & our waitress was extremely helpful

GDcW-d-OmURmKYNxYRXWgA.text: Yum! This brunch joint is a good spot to have tasty breakfast or lunch with a tasty bloody. They have a spicy tai bloody that is absolutely delicious. The coffee is very good, and I don't like to drink coffee a lot... the food is fair portioned and they have a large breakfast menu to pick from. I love coming here!   The Thai Bloody Mary is perfection!

J2BK1Zm37dGIsVK41ruMUQ.text: I didn't actually go inside but I had food delivered from here on Postmates. I ordered the Pork confit Benedict & omg was it AMAZING!!! I ate every bite! Will definitely be in to try the rest of their menu.

Ku3rozAdN1T60Kf0XAU1FQ.text: Worst breakfast experience of my life. I come from the restaurant industry and usually cut people a good deal of slack. After my breakfast being prepared incorrectly 4 times the owner refused to apologize and said that my breakfast only went back to the kitchen twice. I will not be going back.

6HlThiJ65s6lH5wb2sP7yQ.text: The Oink omelette and bacon glazed doughnuts are really good. Service is top notch.  A bonus is that the owner has experience with peanut allergies and is really conscious of avoiding peanuts in his restaurant.  I have a family member that is allergic to peanuts so the owner's assurances are a bonus.

yOKZhEJ-pbYUlI8mQhSe4Q.text: Great place. The bacon flight is a must try and good bloody Mary's. Friendly staff too

UPN6ry9n8Tjs5mUYIUuGMA.text: Decided to eat breakfast out, wife away and daughter at school.  this place is not to bad.  Came her with brother-in-law who loves all things bacon.  Menu was decent, but not an over abundance of options.  Service was fine for a Thursday morning.  Tried a few different bacon flavors and they were good, but nothing to make me come back on a regular basis.

JcqgSkDZP5bzMRJiYYlNSg.text: Poor service and soggy food.  I waited over 15 minutes just to get someone to my table.  Then i had to wait another 10 minute to order.  When the food finally arrived, the bun on the burger was soggy.  When I said I thought the service and food was terrible, they said "sorry."    So if this is what you like, enjoy.

t1-SC_b35b8Mb8P1__ZYPg.text: Unique place! Great service. Had the chicken salad...YUM! Topped off with a bacon donut....different.

WsAuM3siUXAGQ4-XpRM8Nw.text: I went during the week with my two young children. We met a friend who also has a young child. Nice use of space. We didn't watch television, but it does have a few flat panel TVs that would be nice during football season on a weekend.  The space was child friendly - nice menu although they didn't offer crayons to kids, which they said they were in the process of incorporating.    Menu was huge and offered lots of traditional breakfast combinations. I had the waffle with eggs and sausage. I ordered the pigs in a blanket for my children. It is prepared with sausage that was fantastic. The perfect amount of spice and wrapped in pancakes that were also really good. My waffle was wonderful.  Really light and fluffy but with the perfect amount of crunch on the outside.  My friend ordered the French Toast, which was coated in captain crunch cereal (this sounds odd, but it was incredibly good and the bacon served with it balanced out the sweetness) and served with her choice of bacon. She ordered the applewood smoked bacon. It was excellent. They have five different types of bacon, including one infused with jalapeno, which I will try next time.   The service was a bit slow, but understandable given it was the first week of opening.  The staff was very friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back and would recommend to anyone for a nice neighborhood breakfast spot!

9754A7RkTarofeI_2hegIQ.text: If you want a good breakfast in Phoenix don't go to the Oink Cafe. Go to the Butterfield Restaurant on 7388 E. Shea Blvd in Scottsdale, AZ about seven minutes away.  Had breakfast at the Oink Cafe got lousy service,  greasy link sausages and hash browns,  and mmisoma made with cheap Cupcake champagne. I had ordered patties sausages and got links. My wife ordered mmisoma so I asked for one too. Lucky the server forgot mines. My wife had barely drunk hers and offered me to taste it. The mmisoma was bitter due to the champagne. The server brought us our bill, first time returning after bringing our breakfast. I told her about the sausage, hash browns, mmisoma, etc. She spoke with her manager and took 10% off the bill. That was a joke! It was coded military/senior. I'll over 60 and look every bit. I was already entitled to a 10% discount. Just go to Butterfield Restaurant for a superb breakfast and fantastic service.

ivxEko-c01H_1DvR6lmvJw.text: We went right after they opened which probably was a mistake. Our waitress explained that some of the staff had not shown up for work so it mostly family members working that day. It took a long time to get our food other tables that were seated after us got there food before we did. When the food arrived it was not very bland and tasted a little strange. I really want this place to succeed, so I will try it again once the grease has built up on the grill.

9EzsDTAw4GPqNG5eexYm9Q.text: The bacon is phenomenal! It was literally the best bacon I've ever had. I also ordered a Belgian waffle, which was fluffy and flavorful. I think they sprinkle pumpkin pie spices on top as well. Everything was really good but I can't get over how amazing the Apple smoked bacon was.

6RP4WX5nZEvu9INFYdVHoQ.text: As my grandson says "Oink is the happiest place on earth"!  Great food and great service.  It's where to go to get a great breakfast in a hip & happening place.  Have you ever had bacon donut?  Have you ever had 8 favors of bacon?  This is the place.  The staff is friendly and efficient!

WNxHf5QRp5KK8MSssX4qRA.text: We really enjoyed the bacon flight, the coffee, the Oink French toast. Definitely will return.

MFQy6xqQpNgKfllCVw7qmA.text: I work a few doors down and have been waiting for them to open for months! Today was my first visit and I wasn't disappointed!  The owner and servers were friendly and the food was fantastic! I will definitely come back.

R8YSKVNWpNpHLtMgnQzz0g.text: Good breakfast place. Open, bright space with friendly staff. Good healthy choice omelette and wonderful biscuits and gravy.

tUMpWXqER1EwpbfGKmPnsw.text: My friends and I went to The Oink Cafe for an impromptu birthday breakfast. To their credit, we were pleasantly surprised. We were sat in a timely fashion and the server steered us towards ordering macchiatos instead of just coffees. The bacon platter was awesome. My favorite were the jalapeno bacon strips. The country fried steak came highly recommended, and it did not disappoint. Their staff was friendly, the restaurant was clean, and the food and service was terrific! This place is worth every penny!

TTNCG89bQAWNwFPg7zY6ng.text: Took a group of 8 here this morning for brunch. Our server was great. I had my usual strawberry chicken salad and it was delicious! Others had breakfast items. We all left full and happy. Will definitely come back.

evyfSAHiE9JcYP-HcytLyQ.text: If you want a good, big breakfast this is the place. I've had every one of their omelets and liked or loved each one. When they first opened the service was good and the staff was friendly. The past 6 times visits the service got progressively worse. The past 2 trips were especially bad. I only got 3 cups of coffee because our waitress disappeared. We won't go back because the service was so bad. Again the food is great but the horrible service will keep us away.

L_pcIYYUiZYwDA97PMtjrw.text: The service was friendly but VERY poor.  We had to ask for water 4 times.  My friend ordered the Southwest omelette scrambled.  I created my own egg white scramble with spinach, tomato, jalapeno, pepper jack cheese and avocado.  We both ordered wheat toast and hash browns well done.  A different waiter brought us our breakfast. His was an omelet not scrambled but ate it anyway.  My was egg omelet not egg white scrambled no avocado, raw hash browns and no toast.  We sent it back but before we received it our original waiter brought us the check without checking on us and made a comment how I ate mine pretty fast.  The order came out again without the avocado, wheat toast and no jelly.  We had to ask twice for the bacon donut  holes (Yum!) which he finally brought but seemed a little confused as to what exactly they were.  He did have the manager remove our two Bloody Mary's.  We did noticed two other tables that this waiter had also had problems.  We will try this place again as the food was pretty good once we got it but hopefully we will get the right food at the same time and better service.

y0OSGvyK_ja357gDpvRI-Q.text: This is one of our favorite places to go.  Good food, love the omelets and of course the bacon.  Good coffee.  Service can depend on who's area you are seated in, but over all we haven't had a bad experience.  Make sure if you go at lunch that you order before any big groups, it can take a while.

7IRDs4xBaAV2Ni6YwCnVUA.text: Excellent food & service to match. Clean restaurant & bathrooms too....that says something!

rVnSw6L4M1y68i--aE7Meg.text: My friend and I were very excited to try this place only to be disappointed. Horrible experience. We waited over 10 minutes to give our drink order. I had to ask for silver ware and we waited over 40 minutes for our breakfast only for it to not be cooked. We ended up walking out. They seemed very disorganized. I hope they work out their issues and this business can start running well. I wish I could have tried the food but after getting batter for pancakes we were not hungry.

BDM7Taf-OcJaMmWatI3hZw.text: First off, the food was excellent. However, the service almost made me leave before I even ordered. Granted, I went in on a Sunday morning and it was busy. When I approached the hostess stand I asked how I could order takeout. Before the hostess answered we were interrupted by a man who was possibly the owner or manager. He sent her to take care of something and walked away also leaving me standing there by myself. So I next approached the register where a cashier appeared to be either cashing out an order or entering an order. The only greeting I received after standing there was when the server held up her finger as a gesture to tell me to wait but she said nothing. After I patiently waited for about two minutes I moved over to the counter and waited until the owner/mgr took my order. After giving my order I left for a few minutes to shop while my order cooked. When I returned it was difficult to find someone to help me pick up my order. There was a very nice, but busy lady helping at the counter. I overheard her say she was a school teacher helping the family out and she was kind and helpful. I had the biscuits and gravy which were great, my daughters ate up all of their bacon pancakes, and my husband enjoyed an omelette.   My family has lived in Phoenix for about 4 years and we have seen 3 restaurants open and close in that location since then. We are really hoping that the Oink Cafe is able to make something out of the location. I will probably return when things get settled because the food was good but if the service and apathy toward customers is a similar experience I won't likely give it a 2nd try.

hUfFXGBy7fyNX7Zmahp3UQ.text: Very disappointing. I ordered the pepper bacon and expected thick strips of bacon but instead I got 2 strips of thin, nearly meatless, bacon. Don't waste your time or $.

t95mlqjUuiw5XHOYF741nA.text: I had the Denver Omelet with a side of biscuits and gravy, wow, it was fantastic! They are very reasonably priced and the staff are all very friendly. You have to try this place.

7rKnomiQ9yxG9LceKQf1ZQ.text: First time here....we live within 5 minutes but have waited to visit to allow them some time to work out the initial kinks of a new restaurant based on previous Yelp reviews.  We got there around 10:00'ish on a Sunday morning.  We were seated right away and got our drinks right away.  Restaurant did not seem overly busy to me. We had some questions about the menu, got them answered and placed our order.  We ordered the Paradise Valley Omelette and the Steak and Eggs.  It took 27 minutes for them to deliver our first entree'. The omelette was hot off the press, steaming and had some really nice hot, stringy cheese.  The Steak and Eggs was a completely different story.  The steak was cold, overcooked and tough.  Enough said so I sent it back. My next entree' (Eggs Benedict) came out in 5 minutes and it looked great.  However, the English Muffin was barely toasted, the ham was super thin, and the Hollandaise was tasty but it basically formed a pool on the plate.  There were some positives.  We ordered a side of the Jalepeno Bacon and it was really good.  I had the side of Biscuits and Gravy on the Steak and Eggs entree and the biscuits were good.  You could tell they were homemade.  Also, the homemade sausage gravy was great.  Our waitress was really great and really seemed to know the menu well.  She did comp the Eggs Benedict entree after we talked about how weak the Steak and Eggs came out from the kitchen.  The food runner needed some help in a big way....I just kept seeing him flash in and out of the kitchen and running through the dining room.   The bakery items looked really good so I might go back to try them sometime in the future.   Overall, I'd say about 2.5 stars but I've definitely had better breakfasts at other restaurants in the area.  I'm not completely convinced that I'd go back unless I knew it was going to be a better overall experience.

1KMmZnXOj9ATPAcYclJh7g.text: Love the premise of the restaurant: Breakfast, Lunch, Bacon.  Service was poor. We were there the week it opened and were told that we could sit but it would be an hour before we got food. We were not able to stay so we left. I appreciate them giving us a head's up. Then we tried again a week or so later and were seated- no warning about the length of time to be served and it was over an hour before we and several tables around us were served. They offered us a free pastry but did not comp anything off of the bill. That was disappointing. Food was ok. Hopefully they will get it together because I would love to make this place a regular stop. I can see them really making something of the theme buy selling bacon themed items like bacon popcorn, bacon band aides, bacon scarves, bacon wallets, bacon lamps, etc...a little bacon shop within the place.

lDvFT_0eHQzPR3UkAPYDsQ.text: Great service and excellent place to get breakfast. The eggs Benedict were made perfect! You won't be disappointed by their omelettes either

XPWZ0OIcC6dpRXm46snZLQ.text: I love breakfast and really wanted to like this place. I ordered eggs and peppered bacon. Bacon was not impressive for a place that specoalizes in bacon,     the hash browns were under cooked and the toast was a bit burnt. My husband had the biscuits and gravy and it was bland. I also thought it was expensive. $ 2.50 for a cup of coffee. It was 3 of us and the check was $37 for a basic breakfast and a coffe. I will not go back. Not worth it.

RnuUuwcgrwGw49-NSJeUtQ.text: Ate here last Sunday for brunch... They were busy but screwed up our order not once, not twice but 3 times. Never did get what we ordered. Then they brought the check before we even got our food. Tried to stand behind their mistakes but did a half hearted effort by only comping my wife's meal not to include her drink and offering to give her a free meal if she came back... Nice but they screwed up everyone's meal and drinks at the table at least once, we all  got our meals at different times. Screwed up our drink order. And then the manager blamed it on the owner for being on vacation.. Really? It took 1 hour 40 minutes to get our food and it was wrong and cold. Should have Comped the whole table and I don't want to hear excuses from the manager! Epic Fail... To many other places to brunch on Sunday... Won't go back even though they did offer a free meal. You only get one first impression..

m_PF5ppTNppy7fwf2wvaAQ.text: The food was very good, but the service could use some work and organization. I'm definitely a person that's all about customer service and the hostess needs to be more personable and inviting. The older lady is more getting in the way than helping the situation. They need a restroom sign because I saw atleast five people almost walk in the kitchen.  Overall it's definitely a good start, just need to work out the kinks. I gave it four stars for the food and effort! Plus where do they get these stemless mimosa glasses!

GVLGJHi2cg_SVOJ8N4RTAQ.text: Breakfast was awesome. Service was a little slow, but the place was packed. We didn't have to wait long for a table on a late Sunday morning.   Overall I was really impressed by the restaurant. Decor was funky and the menu was unique.

IdwVkQyQJLWKVyWGGE919w.text: I wanted to love this place, it's close, convenient and it has different types of bacon.  It is because I wanted love it that it got 3 stars.    My guy and I stopped for breakfast Saturday morning, it took awhile to be seated but once we were the service wasn't bad for as busy as they were.  We both got eggs, hash browns, bacon and toast. I ordered my Applewood smoked bacon extra crispy, he ordered the jalapeno bacon not crispy.  This is where the stars began to fall.  It took forever for our food to arrive.  Several people who came in after us had their meals and were finished by the time ours arrived.  The hashbrowns were hot, the eggs warm and unfortunately his bacon was extra crispy and mine wasn't even close to crispy.    I don't mind the food mixup so much as the waiting.  We will give them another try and I will update then.

OjeKoC5uiGl_sjSoLx7mIw.text: We like the name but this is the first time I persuaded my wife to check it out. We sat outside on a pleasant morning. We an an excellent server. We started with a bacon bloody mary: better than it sounds. I had the oink omelette though the dog is getting a big part of it. My wife had a blt which was mostly bacon.  We missed bacon covered pastry and the bacon flight which is 8 pieces of bacon, one of each kind sold.   The only problem was that my plate apparently waited for the omelette as toast and hash browns were barely warm. All the food tasted good.

t0byfdqYSxH048NaFJq70w.text: Service has gotten better since opening week, thank goodness. Still not perfect but we will keep trying.

7JYDBoY-iR5z12MM9MOPZg.text: I just moved to this area and we tried this place out. Nothing special and I have definitely experienced better.  Service is so so

PcdGJjFoPdyPKqLI-yTc6Q.text: I have to agree with many of the other reviewers, food is good but the service is bad. The person in charge of the servers has got to be the problem.  I witnessed other tables having service issues. Lousy manager and/or lousy training program.  Won't last with that kind of program.

a-biZu7GRpW-0rP-IoKPBw.text: Service was good. Food was pretty standard. Bacon was awesome!

o58cZjHkjlQKkKFl20fL7w.text: With a name like "OINK" how can you go wrong.  I went here last Friday after my ritual Squaw Peak morning hike.  The eggs benedict were great and the hash browns were extra crispy as ordered.   Excellent, attentive service and good food...I will return!

jDAjM-wxFN3DOKZyvvwckg.text: Was excited to eat here. Food was disgusting, too greasy, and service sucked. Would not recommend to anyone!

bJcfZFs2NfhJG79yMWrxRQ.text: The French toast and the Belgian waffle are the best. Rachel took care of us and she is wonderful. Thank you, Rachel!

JzB8VoBuxy2Q4DkLXllrNg.text: great spot for breakfast or lunch...nice staff....bacon lovers paradise!!  Mike

pKgT4j82nknYSIequVUpig.text: Sunday brunch made delicious.  The wait at 11 am on a Sunday morning was long but worth it.  I had the Pork Confit Benedict. The pork was amazingly juicy and flavorful and not at all overpowered by the hollandaise sauce.  My wife had the Oink Omelette which was massive (with 5 eggs) but delicious with bacon, ham, and sausage.  Reasonably priced for the quality and service.  I would definitely eat here again.

aKYKoKm_dFuJxlqqQrbFoQ.text: The service impeccable; spot on, friendly, quick, that alone is worth the trip. Now add the food! Even the decor! Will be a frequent flyer.

W3okoqn2jGi1LI22G1lTWA.text: The food was very taste. The staff was friendly and the manager made sure to make sure we were happy. We got the oink plate (8 pieces of bacon) and some didn't have enough flavor for me to distinguish the difference, but still yummy. The applewood bacon and jalapeno bacon are the best!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberries and cheesecake pancakes! You will die and go to heaven
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oink plate!

5ro1w88HYoNOR1IR0CleiQ.text: The food is worth the wait. We had a great breakfast this morning. Close to ACU. Go Firestorm. Our server did a great job. I think her name was Taylor. I did overhear a guy complain about they were quoted 30 minute wait and it took 45 minutes. What did he expect. There was a line out the door. Can't wait to go visit my daughter so I can take her back.

3jd-cWaZXrmQFGbIjD47_g.text: I've been here twice now... Wait times are kinda long, but once you get seated they do a good job of either filling up your drinks or dropping off a pitcher so you can refill yourself.  Food was good and worth going back to try something else.

idrnjmjKBoAab3pnSArIIw.text: I tried, oink cafe, I tried. I came and ate your food a number of times. I had your coffee. I had your juice. But no matter what I had it made no use.  It seems your staff would be somewhere else. It seems you buy the cheese that comes pre-melt. I want to love you and to tip you well. Because you're right there and you could be so swell.  But I work hard for the little money I make. At a restaurant in fact so I know what's at stake. It's not with pride that I make this 2 star review. It's in hope that the truth will motivate you.  But for real, I've come in here like 6 times over the course of 8 weeks. The food is mediocre, edible greasy spoon stuff but that doesn't match the scenery. Though the staff is nice enough, I had the (mis)pleasure of sitting at the "bar" which apparently is where the staff goes to do their b****ing and I was thoroughly disappointed, particularly by the older one with silver hair - she doesn't seem like she has one sympathetic molecule in her body. All face value nothing genuine there at all. Anyway, I can handle all that I work at a bar and restaurant I know how it goes. But the final straw was waiting a longer than it took to cook and eat my food for me to receive my check. Quite actually, 21 minutes. And it wasn't even my server who noticed.

c8C8oT85XEfeDnBVWlAfrA.text: What a find! This is an excellent place. Staff is friendly and quick. The food is unique and fresh. Eggs Benedict several different ways with perfectly poached eggs. Favorite breakfast and lunch place for now. Come on in!

hjaFFvQPahUMEoej6hog-Q.text: Their healthy omelet is so delicious as well as the oink omelet. We did the flight of bacon which was fun as well. Oatmeal is the best. Staff are fantastic. Great experience.

IAOzPu7HVJQbVjmGYhBOEQ.text: They told us it would be a 20 minute wait. We waited 40 minutes. We ordered premium coffees and they were cold.

mIU6iFVhSJuY4peJxHSVig.text: I have been wanting to come here for the longest time and this morning we had such an awesome experience here. The cafe is designed so cute and the staff is all smiles! We were sat right away, the waiter was very attentive and friendly. The mimosa's were delicious and strong. :) We ordered biscuits and gravy which were phenomenal and a side of french toast to share which was also delicious. You get a big portion and the food quality was great. Thank you too Sean for stopping by our table to make us laugh and make small talk, he was so nice! I definitely recommend this breakfast spot and I will be back! You won't leave hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and Gravy with hash browns and two eggs. There is a side of french toast and mimosa&#39;s. You will have left overs!!

yCeXng2Yk2n324fc-aNqcw.text: Great food and bacon!  So many unusual but delicious sounding options on the menu!  This was my first time here and my entire family loved it!  Favorites were pork confit omelet, French toast, pork confit Benedict!  My 10 year loved her pig in the Blankets!  I am excited to come back soon!

2CEZ6jUeDM4Psve8Jg8Hzw.text: This was the first place we ate at when we moved to Scottsdale, great food, amazing service, and worth any wait.  My husband is the most impatient person but never minds if we have to wait (its usually 15-20 min as they manage their tables and service well). We truly love coming here and highly recommend - especially if you love bacon.

mucCCJ8UZSBbE76WXC5EVQ.text: I would probably only give this place two stars. I came for breakfast with my boyfriend today and neither of us were too impressed.   We started with the flight of bacon. First of all for what you get it's expensive. $8-$9. They all tasted the same except for the peppered bacon somewhat stood out.   I ordered the Arizona omelette because I love chorizo. You literally couldn't even taste or see the chorizo. It seemed like one big blended omelette. Kind of weird. Plus it's SMOTHERED in "ranchero" sauce. It's this dark red thick spicy sauce. I would ask for it on the side if you're going to order it.   My boyfriend got the breakfast burger. He didn't seem too thrilled.   To be honest, I know it's the "oink cafe" but it was almost pork overload. And I don't really enjoy staring at pictures of cute cartoon pigs all over the walls while I eat bacon. Probably won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

n0SdJhYK29ZUMcTPDnPWRQ.text: Great food and fabulous service!  Wonderful dog friendly patio and all of the wait staff including the manager came out to say hello to the dogs.  They make a great Chai Tea. They have something on the menu for everyone.  Good location and nice atmosphere.

D9873fpz5Tw9Hxaq4ztbHQ.text: I was probably the only person to go there and not order any bacon. What was I thinking???   I was thinking of their delicious freshly made biscuits and sausage gravy. That's what I was thinking. If I had four stomachs I could have finished my breakfast and gotten a few slices of bacon. Go hungry. Really hungry as portions are huge and you are going to be ant to the at it all.   Mom had the French toast with strawberries blueberries and whipped cream. The French have nothing on this breakfast.  Lol. Amazing. I can't decide which one I like more so I'm going back for another test. Maybe a few more breakfast just to make sure which one is my fave. I do know this is my new fave breakfast place in north Phoenix.

ga-NtwDkNDlohmWyXGXbXw.text: Great BLT. So-so, perfunctory service. Hadn't been here before so when I walked in I stood at what I learned is their to-go counter for a good solid 90 seconds before anyone acknowledged me. There were six people behind the counter, & not one gave me eye contact or a simple hello. SIX. Not a good first impression. Once I was told to go ahead & take a seat a young lady dropped off a menu & silverware rollup. She said nothing, did not offer water or tell me my server would be right with me. I realize this is a very casual place but still, when guests are tipping for service it should be welcoming & attentive at the very least.  Food is pretty much what I expected. BLT was great--nice & big, delicious bacon (good thing since this is what they're supposed to be known for!). I added avocado which was fresh and tasty. Fruit salad was the generic pineapple, underripe honeydew, grape combo... but even at The Phoenician the fruit is this way!  Overall, good food, but after tax I wouldn't come & spend $11+ on a BLT (and that's without the avocado). Decent atmosphere, despite the bright yellow & green walls and very harsh fluorescent lighting. Very cute patio.

JaXQ56JTwswMd-_QC9ngwQ.text: Pros: Good amount of choices for menu options, including a full coffee service menu.  Staff was friendly.  Food was good - I had the waffle combo.   Cons: Noisy and a little on top of each other as far as table space.  There was a wait and no real place to stand and wait other than outside.  A touch overpriced for breakfast food, making them a bit less competitive for the surrounding area.  Overall: B+  Not the best breakfast place we have been to in Phoenix, but most certainly not the worst.  We'll be back for the bacon flight!

f4jofWfIk3u6JIldfKgWZQ.text: Our server Jossie helped show us the secrets to getting the most out of our visit at Oink. We loved the bacon, but the service was better! Will definitely be back and bring more friends!

LayAIH-G2E2Nonsz_2gEdw.text: We were here for brunch with a large group. The staff did a great job of accommodating us and once we ordered keeping everything straight. I had the 50/50 burger, which was really tasty. The Cole slaw side was a bit sparse. My husband had a traditional Eggs Benedict, which he raved about. And for him, hash browns is the best indicator of a great breakfast, and these were great. The rest of the group seemed to enjoy their meals as well, although there was some question about whether the different bacons really tasted different.

IJ9HQWbTMtLD0QjacSG6TA.text: SOGGY belgian waffles...the maple bacon donut(which sounds amazing) is full of grease...service is mediocre...save your Money

sRHEGQ6_HZt0b8mdYIJFpQ.text: If you love all things bacon this is your place! Just across from paradise valley mall in the a Target parking lot Oink has quickly become a favor for Sunday morning breakfast. It fills fast so get there early but even a wait is worth it. All the servers are good and your food comes out quickly. I've had the breakfast hash which is excellent. Omelettes are delicious and coffee good as well. Enjoy! Long live Bacon!!

ksyrKX9XqDqTkl5ubP0Jqg.text: Went for breakfast today. The food was typical breakfast food. The bacon was good but not anything special. What really turned me off was Fox News playing on the tvs. Completely made me lose my appetite and shouldn't be on at a restaurant unless you know your only customers are idiots.

8RFpFTmqctg9I6Mq5dBQnw.text: The Oink is my family's favorite restaurant.  The staff is friendly and the food is great.  It's our version of "Cheers"....everyone knows our name when we walk through the door!

lOXOyvtpNw7i1iyh7KHmWw.text: Pretty basic breakfast food, fast service.  Food was a bit greasy for my personal liking.

wDHALKh1bESkPCn0AD2XcQ.text: Great food but terrible service. When we entered there were plenty of empty tables but the wait was 15-20 minutes and then people who came in behind us were seated before us.  It was a chaotic atmosphere and it seemed the hostesses were not able to control the demands of customers who wanted to be rude and just cut in line. It's a shame this overshadows the great food. Don't go when it's busy.

Y-48_5-BQ4BhQXphAOefnA.text: Tempted to give only 2 stars but the sonoran hot dog I had the first time i stepped foot into Oink saved them.  I have been here twice. First time was was shopping at Target and my wife wanted to stop in and get an iced coffee. Got denied as the espresso machine was already off and cleaned for next days use. Manager gave use a coupon for two free specialty drinks so that was very thoughtful. While checking out the place I noticed a special on the wall and it was a sonoran hot dog. For 6 bucks I got the bacon wrapped dog, side of fries, and roasted jalapeno, Serrano, and onion. Great presentation and excellent taste. This was a 3-4 star visit although not getting what we came in for the sonoran hot dog saved the day.  2nd trip. Went in for breakfast wielding our 2 free specialty drink coupons. Waitress took our drink order (two iced americano's) and they came out hot. No biggie lets order food. Waitress' customer service skills were that of a high school kid at his first job. Lady was very blunt and did not act like she cared. Food came out to order but the frozen hash browns were over cooked and couldn't get a water refill.   Had the maple glazed bacon donut and it was basically a sugar cake glazed in maple with bad n bits on top. nothing special.  3 stars and will try this place again eventually.

dbnlSfXxSyYaG-R5rzhGCg.text: The last time I was here we had a big group and so the slower service made sense. But today it's just me and my friend. We asked if the bar was open seating and they said no. The hostess passed us over because she can't confirm what she heard.  In the meantime people just walked up and sat at the bar. Great....so we did the same. The problem is understaffing and mis-staffing. The bar guy is responsible for so much that he's super busy but others are standing around laughing, not rushing and most importantly not helping out. The food was decent but nothing special. The bacon of course is outstanding but the little things are missed.

cYkObiOgvrUNPTzuOOf_JA.text: Not impressed. Ordered Ham steak and eggs for $8.99. If the ham was shoe leather it would'nt be enough leather to resole my 18mo grandsons shoe. $3.99 for one dinky biscuit with gravy (which was horrible) come on. hash browns were cold and flavorless. service was so-so. You need to get it together. there are better breakfast restaurants out there competing for your dollar. I  would not go out of my way to return

-pbOiT4I5Lj2jdzeqmm4Ag.text: First let me say this.  They have only been open a few days, and I will give them another try AFTER they get all their kinks worked out.  My fiance and I went Saturday morning around 10am for breakfast.  First there was no one at the door or a sign that said please wait to be seated or seat your self, so we walked up and found a server and asked.  They just said find an open table, which we did.  After 10 minutes we flagged down a server to get a drink order and then menus.  Drinks took forever.  First they ran out of coffee and then coffee mugs.  We sat and watched many people sit down, wait, and then just walk out because no one even acknowledged them.    We got our ordered placed and then heard from other tables around us that they had been waiting over an hour for their food.  Luckily we weren't in a hurry.  I had the cafe fresh toast and my fiance had some eggs and bacon with a side of biscuits and gravy.  Their food was VERY good.  I Loved mine!  The biscuits and gravy were the best we have had in Phoenix (I'm not too sure if that is saying all that much though).  The food took about 30 minutes.  We constantly had to ask for coffee refills.  I think the servers were doing their best.    Either they were not prepared for a busy morning or they really had no clue what they were doing in the back of the house or front for that matter.  I hope they can pull it together because the food was very good.  Like I said I will go back for another try and re-rate they in a month or two.  I would recommend it to others as long as they know going in that it might be a Cluster.

7UmKreddAc1T-rm4RnH_jw.text: I've had the jalapeno bacon stuffed pancakes, they're to die for every bite is hot and sweet...we've never had a bad meal and always recommend it!

FvWwgNNXdKHyS9f5DBV0GA.text: Walked in and had to wait 5-6 minutes for acknowledgment from anyone.   After we asked if we could just take a table,  we waited what seemed another 5mins for menus.   We asked for coffee ASAP and sat another 8mins before just leaving.   The place was not busy and had tables open.   I don't think speed is a priority and from what we were able to gleam from the prices on the filthy menu, neither is value.   $3 for an egg and $2.50 for a slice of bacon? ... really?   No thanks.   We went to 5 & diner for half the cost and had coffees in hand within 4mins.

ylc8j_8rGcemwDvZeUnHYA.text: Everthing we had was good. Service took A LONG time. The food could be hotter (temp.) ours was just warm. I love the unique bacons you can choose. It is a little pricey for what you get.

LT527sr-a4ER3vvtrVigyA.text: We have now been to this cute little cafe twice. The first time our service was beyond slow and orders all screwed up but they made it right. Our waitress was working her butt off and gave us free muffins (which were delish) while we waited. We ended up getting two free meals for our troubles. The second visit was much better and the food came at a reasonable time. I think they're just working out the kinks since they're new.   Pros: The food is really good and they're pastries looked awesome. My kids loved the mini coloring books and were given a free cookie. The bacon was delicious. Friendly atmosphere and the staff is trying.   Cons: long wait and slow kitchen but I think they're trying and improving.   Hope this place succeeds! The food is worth it.

0p2UOnHl8Fn79tn5yI80DQ.text: Positives first: my bloody Mary was really good. My boyfriend and I both thought our breakfasts were good. Sad realities: this place is always so crowded. I went twice and left after being told there was a 45 minute wait for a table. On the third time, we had a 20 minute wait. But once we were seated, our waitress was so busy and overloaded that it took 15 minutes to get our WATER. As a former waitress, I know I'm not being unreasonable in saying that THAT is UNREASONABLE. And then we ordered 2 different side orders of bacon (jalapeno and honey-cured), thinking that a place that supposedly specializes in bacon would have mind-blowing bacon. No. It was normal bacon. Our lives were not changed. It's a cute place but I would not recommend it to anyone unless I knew they had NO other plans for the day, because they would have to spend most of their morning sitting and waiting for average bacon.

eAutQ0S3NS1SFyh7xYYbFw.text: If I could give this place a negative star or none at all I would. First off the food is mediocre at best, and they put less effort into their customer service than I did writing this review.

zvCc6I_qCwOPe0F9MwwB0Q.text: I guess this place is known for their bacon? Other than their many bacon-infused menu items I wouldn't really get that vibe, I ordered a side of applewood smoked bacon and it was pretty regular. Nothing amazing or special about it.   French toast was yummy, but again, pretty standard.   Cute pictures of piglets. Nice color-scheme. Coffee bar is plus. Screaming children was a negative...  The service was great. Good location.   Will probably back if I'm in the area.

ji4F2Lk7y2YqqvCRsHk87A.text: Well... with a name like Oink, I expected a cute place full of piggies, bacon infused items, and smokehouse smells.  With fun outdoor windows with cute quotes like... "warning: bacon smell is imminent" I hoped for another breakfast joint to add to our local list of favorites like Chez Vous.  Unfortunately, the food did not stand out by any measure.  We sat outside at a wonderful table smelling some scrumptious things from inside.  After looking thoroughly over the menu, we decided we had to try plates with bacon and sausage, signatures off their name, right?  We ordered the Oink Burger - a HUGE sausage patty with hashbrowns and a fried egg on top of a bun - and 2 eggs with hashbrowns, toast, and the applewood bacon.  Now if you're like me, you're envisioning thick, smoked bacon and flavorful sausage.  After waiting for the food to arrive, we held our opinions until after tasting the food.  The bacon had a nice flavor, but was very thin and overcooked.  The Oink burger had the makings of a winner, but the almost 2" sausage patty had no flavor and so bland I cut it in half to make a thinner patty.  I think the best thing on the plate was the hashbrowns.    Our waitress was very nice even though she had so many tables to serve she was not able to provide refills on our drinks - something we can easily overlook.  I REALLY wanted to love this place... Sadly we didn't find enough amazing differentiators or flavors to drive us back.  I suggest the owners go visit some smokehouses in the south - like Loveless Cafe in Nashville - and bring us some new award worthy dishes!

2JlqBK5tahSoSowp-YwOoA.text: This place is amazing! Service was on point and you made my bacon loving fiancee very happy. We can't say enough about Oink, except we will see you again next weekend.. And the week after that and the following .. Etc!

7xj1KjjxvQE3lxRE7FYAOw.text: Food is good but only if you're eating there. Out of the last three times I've ordered for pickup they forgot to place my order twice and only realized so when I got there, unapologetic at best.

3ZvPZYGLcFAIxyrezLFYsA.text: I have been here a couple of times already and have had two great breakfasts.  The wait staff is pleasant and upbeat.  We were seated right away and able to order in a matter of minutes.The food arrives fresh from the kitchen and reasonable portions.    The restaurant has been fully updated from its previous incarnations.  The price of the food is reasonable and the coffee is delicious.  Visit!

Z0wabKd_reLps0XIyU93cQ.text: Came into your restaurant hungry and excited to try a new place.  Was seated by an unenthusiastic host person at a nice booth with my toddler.  We decided what we wanted and listened to the gentlemen who came in after us be greeted, receive their drink order, and order their meals.  I did everything short of waving my arms in the air to get the attention of the waitstaff who were actively avoiding eye contact with me.  We got up to leave and complained to a manager as he stared blankly at me and let us leave hungry.  I am writing this from Panda Express where I have received much better service.  Thanks for nothing Oink Cafe.

HylMW3Px6PiScZCE-Wj1aQ.text: Walked in and instantly loved this spot. Was clean and yummy goodies. #Baconlover all welcome. :) Came around 930am on a Sun day and their were pretty busy inside and outside. Ordered espresso and goodies, will come back for breakfast as soon as possible. Decorations were layed out nice and staff was friendly.

4Qpvz8GTVpc5SNgS8FSuFw.text: A plethora of bacon choices and busy at 10:30 for breakfast is always good news.  A counter gives a modern place an old school feel not to mention a decent patio.  This is a perfect idea and needed breakfast option for the area.

u8PsR9YY-N-wqPXj3EB9dQ.text: First time going and very disappointed. Got in quickly. Waitress was quick with placing the order and very friendly but we waited for our food for about 45 min. Looked good but didn't taste good. I ordered the biscuits and gravy. Biscuits were so hard and not eatable. Gravy was ok. Ordered a chocolate latte and charged $1.50 for the chocolate on top of the latte price $3.29. Walked out very disappointed. Never going back.

mTm4lb94yLGbtRxsEB18rQ.text: I like this place!   When I was growing up, my Mother and Grandmother, were determined to put weight on me with their hamburgers.  There'd usually be a 1/2 pound of meat covered with the freshest condiments you might ask for.  Having come from a dairy ranch where they got the freshest beef you could ask for,  any beef they bought had to be up to their standards.  I ate well when we had hamburgers.  My mushroom with swiss burger was the first I have had in a long  time that brought back those child hood memories.  The Burger itself is really to big for two hands to hold and I have large hands.  So the bottom bun got soggy.  The beef was fresh enough for it to get that way as you bite into the beef and tastes good in the process!  My friend had a burger with bacon on it.  They have eight kinds of bacon to choose from.  She had sugar cured and it was thick cut and yummy.  I am going to go out on a limb and say I think the Oink has the best burgers in Phoenix!

EyhS1hAnpB0Res_MLTZuCA.text: Seriously...it's called Oinks but where is the bacon? I ordered an omlet with bacon in it...should have been fabulous with big chunky pieces of GOOD bacon. What did I receive? An ok nothing special omlet I could have gotten anywhere. My husband's omlet was the same. He ordered the one with the shredded meat on it.... can't even recall what it was....but it not anything even worth remembering. Let me say, the concept of Oinks seems good as does the decor and such, but come on, there should be more bacon choices in the menu (options with bacon in them) and when a dish states there is bacon in it, it should be awesome, chunky, full of flavor bacon - nothing like we experienced. Sorry guys.....unimpressed.....you need to live up to your name.

wzadXArclHTcH5oILZfr1Q.text: So here is the deal.  I have been to Oink twice before and although I liked it I was not blown away or anything.  I would say it was slightly above average.  But I also knew there was something special about this place.  So recently I went back for the third time and I discovered something great.   So for years now if anyone mentioned chicken fried steak there was only one place that came to mind.  Texaz Grill.  Everyone agrees that they have the best chicken friend steak in town.  Well I am here to tell you,  there is a new player in town.  Oink has amazing, amazing chicken fried steak.  I would have to say that Oink and Texaz Grill are 1 and 1A.  in no particular order.    Also maybe it was because I was enjoying my food so much that the service was also exceptional that day.    I am very much looking forward to my next visit to Oink.

SzsioXg_LydkbHOYQKRyew.text: Food was good, service not so much. Maybe the waitress was just having a bad day.  We bought a coupon pack from a neighbor selling them to support his high school football team so we will go check it out another three or four times.  If the service stays bad I'll have to change the review I'll have to change the review to 3 stars because there's plenty of places to get good food it he area.  We will see:)

UyNW2pG8kD37n6BqOP-Naw.text: I love coming here! The staff is always on point even when busy! I bring all my friends and family here whenever I can. It's a great spot for a high quality meal for a great price. I love sitting on the patio with my dogs. I come every weekend and know I'm going to have a great meal... With tons of perfectly cooked BACON!!

JWNC4kY1Yvebw8oXrU1UDQ.text: Oh how we looove Oink, you can get breakfast or lunch - I myself cannot pass up getting the traditional eggs benedict - So very good! My boyfriend on the other hand gets the healthy choice omelet and oatmeal. I will admit sometimes we have a stellar experience and sometimes its questionable. The little tables in the middle are really awkward with people walking by on both sides you almost feel in the way -we always wait for a table or booth. Overall one of our favorite spots.

Yvcx3HMM-DiaU87vZQRDiA.text: Our server wasn't as attentive to details as she should have been. Our order wasn't complete and one item was wrong, but since our server only took our order she could not know what the food runners brought us. We waited way too long for our bill to be returned to us once we gave her our CC. There was nothing spectacular about the food. I asked for hollandaise sauce for my omelet and paid $2.49 for about 2 tablespoons. I could get more flavor for less at Denny's. I expect better service for the prices.

WAoBbTHj5t8duq7HFAu6Yw.text: I've been here a few times and service has always been good, but the food is inconsistent. I was here a few days ago and the server was excellent (never let my coffee run out!), my French toast was good, but the bacon was SO disappointing! It had zero flavor and looked like they had taken one piece and sliced it in half. They were 2 flimsy, skinny slices that looked like they came from a fast food place. I couldn't believe it. After the disappointment of this last visit I probably won't be back anytime soon.

GLdDGZemPQ7-YKHxH3k2xg.text: What a great place!  Went there for breakfast while in town.  The day we went a local television station was there doing a live shot.  Despite that we were greeted and  seated as soon as we walked in.  The waitress was very friendly without bring overbearing.  The Bacon Bloody Mary was one of the best I have ever had.  Our food came out quickly.  It was very full of flavor.  The flight of bacon was excellent.  The Ranchero Sauce was made by someone who really knew what they were doing.  The taste was exciting and full of flavor.  The servings were plentiful without leaving me feeling like I ate too much.  The owner stopped at our table despite the large crowd that was on hand to say hello and check on us. An excellent place which will be on my short list to visit again.

7m95b3qMoBfWZJW0SRCiOQ.text: Walking into Oink, you'll discover it's anything but a pigpen. Clean, minimalist design, wide open aisles, bright atmosphere. The menu is simple, but lots of bacon choices. Prices are moderate, food quality is excellent. Most breakfasts include choice of hash browns, cottage cheese or even fruit at no additional charge. Coffee is simply standard old brewed restaurant coffee, but they do have specialty espresso based drinks, that I did not try. I will definitely be back.

LwB4DFqm9Sit7-wgQgyoiA.text: I had a pleasant valley omelette with bacon cheddar cheese and spinach. The presentation was rustic and the omelette was flat and greasy. Server was testy to start but warmed up over time.  Lots of options for sides and toast. If in area would give a second try but would not search it out.

Mw-Cg1Z3984_29FuY7_0jg.text: Food was decent enough. I appreciate that they offer corn tortillas instead of toast. However, the restaurant was freezing, and thus I have to give it four stars.

sKWXrk_HuxRqUKgkWL2Y5g.text: Tried Oink Cafe on a whim today with some friends, and may I say -- OMG!!! I absolutely LOVED this place! The wait staff was absolutely on point and extremely friendly. The owner happened to be in also, and came over and chatted with us for a bit also which made us feel extra special. As far as the food goes, the Paradise Valley omelet was phenomenal and I could taste the freshness -- I also substituted the applewood smoked bacon for the jalapeno bacon (they have 8 different flavors of bacon). We also tried the bacon maple donut -- this is an absolute MUST TRY!!!! Oink Cafe exceeded our expectations and I will definitely be returning again.

fIOUJO3PMXz_XB-tZ30jEg.text: Great place for breakfast! We tried the full bacon flight, Heuvos Rancheros, Arizona omelette, and bacon donut holes. Everything was delicious, service was great. Cute restaurant concept...because everything is better with bacon!

lO72kRoCuFh1jPjkkOzfSQ.text: So the server started off with a positive bang. She was friendly etc...we ordered the omelette w bacon spinach cheese ok. The hashbrowns were frozen type small tiny portion cold and over done. I had the oink french toast. Nice could not taste the cornflake crunch. Because it was over cooked. One strawberry cut into tiny pieces and you get 5 blueberries on top. Two dried up pieces of bacon. Oink is the name of the place. Bacon lost me there. Finally we had a coupon from the entertainment book she says oh you got a bargain today. Lady don't count my money. It was our first time there we wanted to use our book. They should not say the food is homemade when you know they are not. Oh well you eat and learn....

2UhI6SoTOt_tfX4dJGpPeQ.text: O-M-G!!! If you like breakfast, go to Oink. If you like bacon, go to Oink. If you like Cuban sandwiches, go to Oink. Just remember that their hours are limited!

FL_QRlpnM2ClYCQa-Fawgg.text: Awesome won't disappoint. Best Benedict's and bacon combinations. Awesome French toast too. One of the best breakfast in town. Got to try the bacon flight and bloody Mary's

K2R_m1pGY-WE6fhK8dHfIg.text: I've been here a few times and service is generally decent, the food is consistent (decent). Nothing really terrible but nothing to write home about either. I would probably recommend other spots for breakfast if asked, but I do like the lunch here.. But as others have mentioned, bland. I like the mimosa and Bloody Mary flights. They have many different flavors for lattes which is nice too. Usually you don't have to wait long to get a table. Nice concept with bacon flights, but I think they all generally taste the same.  Average spot, maybe a step up from IHOP/ Denny's

1TSIE1WSDB8ZWEBF-nV-Mw.text: Bloody mary flights and they also do mimosa flights.  Not to mention a good value breakfast.  Indoor and limited outdoor seating.  Cyclist friendly for after ride protein.  Thai chili was my favorite but all had a unique flavor and very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody mary flights and they also do mimosa flights.

DcTSo4V7pv7k0293uN1xkA.text: The food is great here. It's small and a bit noisy but that's if your used to it. Over all great service and food i will be coming back :)

_2vVbpQBnS4kCsoHC_xEgQ.text: Great brunch spot with lots to choose from.  Server was very nice and the food was cooked perfectly.

CSvax8X-2iyN0vZkQE6Xlg.text: This place has been on my radar to try for months and I'm so glad I finally went.  As soon as I saw bacon-topped glazed donut holes in their case I knew how my meal would start. They came out warm and crunchy, heaven on a plate. Not something you want to eat on a regular basis, but what a treat! With my cup of mocha coffee, I really could have stopped there but didn't...I wanted to try their bacon. They offer a ridiculous 8 varieties... even a flight lol!  I ordered the 2 eggs home fries and bacon. It was served with a delicious biscuit and the home fries came out exactly as I ordered them -- very well done and delicious. My sister loved her meal as well and even wants to return a second time while she's here. Who am I to deny her of that?

fNuOCxN-My0dj4MgpAR38g.text: The bank trial was amazing but the best was the donut covered with bacon, it was to die for! I loved the capitan crunch toast too! I wish I would have tried the bloody mary but I didnt see it until we left. It gives me a reason to go back again! Super fun and super delicious. Very kid friendly too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy

gPOYkNEbtL7cRpTBOPa9GQ.text: This is a great little breakfast and lunch place with a serious pork fat problem. Think bacon in flavors you may not have thought of. Had a bacon eggs benedict that was really great!. our group also had an amazing pumpkin spice pancake and the florentine omelet. All were very very good. If you like bacon try a bacon flight. 6 pieces each with a different flavor!! This place gets busy so expect a short wait but its is zoo worth it. Here is a tip. They have opened one of these in Tucson and are planning to open in Tempe soon. Do go here!

5vkNu-tU9xUISsyli0tqKA.text: So I thought they were open to 3. I walk in at 1:45 to learn they close at 2. So, I placed a to go order and sat at the front to wait. While I'm waiting the staff is sitting around the front service area complaining about customers that walk in close to closing. Forgive, but a customer who is spending money is the same at an hour to closing as they are at 15 minutes to closing. My last visit

nlAxAcw0p5A5UccrxVpiZQ.text: If you are a BACON fan, this is your place.  The Spicy Bloody Mary is great. The peppered bacon was good.  The Oink Benedict was really good and is served with slices of bacon on it.  I ordered it with cottage cheese as the side. The portion was average but not huge. Service were very good, attentive, and perceptive. We ordered a plate with four additional slices of bacon to sample the applewood smoked and the peppered bacon. The bacon is served crispy but not to the point of breaking when picked up. I thought they did a nice job all the way around. Went at 9:30 AM on a saturday and were seated right away.  Mostly full at that time.

XmF2P0VVJGriS6jFAS1c4w.text: Great place to get a mimosa or bacon bloody merry :-) I'm a regular at this place because of good food and great breakfast.....the staff is always friendly....but...unfortunately the customers are always rude. I've witnessed table hawks and pushiness on numerous occasion.....I've sat at the bar and had people hover over my food and try to force feed me just to get my stool.....I guess that's because this is a popular neighborhood place.

PSSgn5aYqlZZtB0mSKDSHA.text: Service was prompt but the food wasn't all that. The sandwiches are plain and the orange juice came warm. Most likely wouldn't return because of there wasn't any flavor. Their sweet potato fries were pretty bomb though, I have to give them that.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Top is BLT with regular fries, bottom is turkey sandwich. Neither were very good. If you&#39;re a plain person, you&#39;ll like this place.

I3UDXIZaLxLehrPciqcgvQ.text: For one the service here was piss poor. There was no hostess at the front and when we did get seated they didn't explain they serve both breakfast and lunch at the time (we thought it was only lunch until we overheard other ppl ordering breakfast after we had ordered). The booth was squished together where we got sat at. Then the server took forever to come over, when she did she apologized and gave this lengthy story about not knowing who was cut (I don't care). There was 2 servers, one was in training (I'm assuming) and this wasn't explained either. The server never got my drink refill and also managed to screw up my order. The flight of bacon all tasted the same for the most part and their tomato soup wasn't great (how do you screw up tomato soup)? I will not be going back here-I've had better bacon and food elsewhere and service was pretty bad.

RUYRc-SCZ_v4tG2MYyTOTg.text: I suggest you order the Bacon Flight, a sampling of eight varieties of bacon, to accompany whatever else you are ordering. You'll then be on your way to refining your bacon palette. The flight will add about nine bucks to the cost of your meal, but it's a delightful item to share if you are socializing with friends or family. Every visitor to The Oink Cafe needs to order the flight at least once.  Servers at Oink are very friendly and helpful. They do a nice job of making recommendations and keeping your coffee cup filled. The cafe itself finds a middle ground, with solid food served at reasonable prices. Not a cheap diner nor a too trendy premium dining spot. The menu is not that innovative, except for a willingness to throw bacon into anything, which is fun. Ordering the eight bacon flight is essential to appreciating the bacon varieties. If nothing else, you'll then know which bacon to request on your next visit. If you don't have this basis for comparison, you'll just think the bacon with your meal is well, bacon. You won't be able to appreciate what differentiates Oink from other breakfast spots.  The restaurant is housed in an odd long and narrow space, but there's a deceptive amount of seating. There can still be a wait, however, at peak times. There is also a small dog friendly patio for outside dining. Oink is kid friendly, with a "little piggies" menu and a pig to color while waiting to be served. If you appreciate art, you'll enjoy the large number of the pig masterpieces from previous diners on display.

Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kid&#39;s &#34;little piggies&#34; menu
Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MQaLkaFZKRNvMBFTvfSwtg.text: I am giving this place a 1 star for one reason only.  I don't know if it is the lack of training or just not getting it.    Twice I've taken my 81 yr old mother who does not get around well to this place.  It's less than a mile from our house.  The first time there was a 20 min wait.  No biggie, there was a chair for her sit.  There were 5 groups ahead of us and a number of groups that came after.  We'd been waiting 10 min or so when a couple came in after everyone else and waited less than 5 mins.  The lady manager took them to a table that seats 4 that had just opened up.  You could tell this couple were regulars and a favorite of hers.  Two of the groups ahead of us were a group of 4 and a group of 5.  Those of us that were standing there couldn't believe it.  Everyone was annoyed, but didn't say anything - my mistake there.  Finally got seated.  It's a few weeks later and thought I would take mother and try one more time.  Get there and it's a 5 min wait.  No one waiting in front and and a few  people walking in behind us.  The young gal asks if we would like to sit at the counter and we say no, we would like a table.  Not one minute goes by, a young mother and her child come, and again all of us are passed over and they seat them at a table  that has just opened up and proceed to take us to a booth.  We very specifically had said table.  My mother has trouble in booths.  They coud have very well taken the mother and child to the booth.  I see that the lady manger knows the mother and is taking care of them.  WHAT THE???  My mother and I look at each other and decide this place isn't worth our money.  The hostess that seated us asks if everthing is okay and this time my mother says something.  The best the gal does is a hollow apology and not an offer of anything.  We're not the type of people to expect anything, but not even an offer after this stupidity?!  To be that rude and disrespectful twice, to not only us, but to the people who are also waiting is inexcusable.  It's a shame since all of the servers we have had are very good and I would give them 4 stars.  I'm done with this place.  Butterfields and U.S. Egg are MUCH better choices and worth driving to.

LUPgoVZpZNIfoppdYdTZZQ.text: My husband and I decided to give this place a go, seeing as tho it's new and we were looking for brunch on Saturday. Restaurant set up is nice and new however, the service is horrible. We had an older lady with blonde hair that basically rushed us through everything from the moment we sat til the moment we paid. The food was ok but the service was horrible. Seemed as if she was expecting her tip regardless of the service she provided.  If I wanted the "fast food type service," I wouldn't have gone to a sit down. We will definitely not be going back.

htgffZj0pPj9rRNZAnv3vg.text: - This is probably my go to breakfeast joint !! Any time i get a day off i love to come and eat here , the staff is extremely friendly and try to get you a seat asap , although there is a short wait, its absolutely worth it. Next time your raving some bacon or in the PV area make it a must & stop by the Oink Cafe. You wont be disappointed.

Mlx0iYf-D98T7xH2qsdgsg.text: Great bacon- Try the the bacon flight to sample all of their flavors! My favorites are the jalapeno, pepper, and honey cured bacon.   Great coffee- fresh and smooth. Always hot.   Great pancakes- the bacon pancakes have small pieces of bacon in the batter. They are topped off with more pieces of bacon and powdered sugar. Yum!   Another great dish is the Huevos Rancheros. The sauce served with them is thick and flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best part of the menu...the flight of bacon!

IZaTn8L3kBdmBLq_EQjs5w.text: I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately it doesn't live up to expectations. With a name like Oink you'd think they would get really creative but other than offering several eight types of bacon and maple glazed bacon donuts, they don't really seem to do all that much with it.   We ordered the bacon flight to sample all of the different types and then our individual meals. I had the 50/50 burger which is described as 1/2 ground bacon and 1/2 ground beef. It was good, but the bacon flavor wasn't nearly as tasty as I expected. My wife had two eggs and bacon which also came with hashbrowns. She noted that the hashbrowns were boring and the eggs and bacon weren't any better than other breakfast places. My kids ate pancakes and pigs in a blanket off of the kid's menu which didn't seem to include any specialty bacon offerings.  As stated, for a place that claims to specialize in pork products, there really didn't seem to be many. For a start, how about pork belly, bacon-flavored hot chocolate, or even just the ability to order a plate of a specific type of bacon. Yes, the bacon flight is nice but the presentation was lacking, basically just 8 strips on a plate. I'm sure a creative chef could come up with even more ideas.Right now Oink has a good name but they definitely need to work on the execution.

IgimAubUiYiCpaM91v-lsw.text: So I have smelled this place a lot because I work in this plaza. I stopped here on a Saturday morning and sat at the coffee bar outside. Right away the window opened and my friendly waitress greeted me. The menus are kind of like place mats outside. Very straight forward with yummy options. I was impressed to see that they has a flight of bacon as a menu option. 8 different bacons as a meal choice?! I ultimately chose the pork confit Benedict. It was delicious. The shredded pork was so tender. It melted in my mouth as I chewed. I enjoyed the hollandaise sauce as well, thick and creamy. I had a side option of fruit, hash browns or home fries. I got the hash browns. No complaint there! Really good breakfast place. I can't decide if I want pigs in a blanket or an omelet for next time!

XTkmt29xkEbWuGKJNEr7bQ.text: If I could eat here every day, I would... food is amazing, drinks are amazing, and the staff is amazing... really friendly customer service . I can't wait till I go back. Bloody Mary's is something I would recommend here. Flight of bacon as well..

ZRIcU5JHaO5gM8H-kQoClA.text: Found my new breakfast spot when near that area! Customer service was excellent. I had a 2 egg combo with egg whites, fruit, wheat toast and bacon.  Everything was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Oink Cafe-Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short Stack

qjtNJJ0fS78lIGa8SA7LvA.text: This place is always crowded, so there is a wait but the food is worth it. The portions are big and the service is great.

EZjvisQlgyHNsRVUIQ-nSA.text: We came here for a cup of coffee and decided to order some eggs and bacon. Clearly bacon is their strong suit and the coffee was really very good as well.  I decided to come back the next day and see if yesterday was a fluke. Since we generally liked our original visit over a year ago but at the time we found things somewhat uneven.  Well the good news to report is that since my first visit with fellow Yelp'ers and Pepper Head Mark, things have improved. Service can be a bit slow during busy periods, they have definitely improved. The sad sausage I had eighteen months ago has been retired. It's been replaced by a very flavorful one (see photos).  Today we ordered the French Toast and the Oink's French Toast. The latter is just over the top sweet and a bit too much for this gourmand. While the regular French Toast would be enjoyed by every Gourmet as being just right. Look that up in your Roget's. LOL  Expect to pay $15 each if you don't order a 4 piece (1/2 flight) or 8 piece (full flight) of their absolutely delicious thick flavored bacon. If you do, and I would recommend that you do, then expect to pay accordingly, around $22-$25.  But ohhh, but it's sooo worth it!  Enjoy!
